loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de campo y padre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría, alimento y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para él y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a un hombre trabajador con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Francisco is a man from the countryside and a father of two children, for whom he has gone through many challenges in his life. Even so, he has had the fortitude to succeed and continue to progress with his family. 

For some time he has wanted to start a chicken breeding and selling business. 

For this reason he is requesting financial encouragement in order to purchase breeding chickens, feed, and construction materials for a chicken coop. 

With this new business he will be able to generate income for his family, which is everything for him. He will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his wife and children. 

He will work every day in order to advance his business and make it a sustainable and profitable endeavor. 

Support a hardworking man with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase breeding chickens, feed, and construction materials for a chicken coop.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a sus dos hijos, es viuda y se dedica a la producción de granos básicos desde hace muchos años.

María, se dedica a la producción de granos básicos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años, ya que anteriormente lo realizaba su esposo y fue de él que aprendió acerca de la agricultura. 
   
María, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar fertilizantes para la producción de granos básicos. 

María, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria y que se desarrollen como profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 and has a sixth grade education. She lives with her two children, is a widow and has made her living  growing basic grains for many years. Maria makes her living growing basic grains and has done so for the last 12 years. Her husband did the same work before and it was from him that she learned about agriculture. 

Maria will use the loan money to buy fertilizers to grow basic grains. Maria dreams of seeing her children graduate with university degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a small photovoltaic system for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cake ingredients such as wheat flour, margarine, eggs, etc

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelia is 46 years old and one of her children is in school.

Nelia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Nelia has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 55 years old and one of her children is in school.

Nenita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 46-year-old woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has four school-aged children who are 16, 10, 6 and 4 years old. Ruth and her husband have been doing a fishing business for 20 years. They work together to provide the needs of their children. Aside from fishing, Ruth also has other businesses like buying and selling dried fish. She is also engaged in a food vending business. She is asking for a loan to buy dried fish to sell, a motorcycle to be used in transporting her business easier and to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar for her food vending business. Ruth dreams in the future of increasing her earnings so she can construct a sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, a motorcycle and ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Wenchie

texts.en:
Wenchie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wenchie is 39 years old and both of her children are in school.

Wenchie has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to resell.

Wenchie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Wenchie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with 10 children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like boarding house rentals.

Encarnacion dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita, featured in the photograph, is a 53-year-old lady from a small village in Bolangir district. She works as a farmer and cultivates paddy on her small piece of land. She is a widow and lives with her son and daughter-in-law. She has a very loving personality and adores caring for others. Lalita wants to get the benefits from a sanitation loan, which she will use to improve the toilet facilities in her bathroom. This will allow her to enjoy a more hygienic environment and hence improve the quality of her life.

Lalita is asking for a loan of 15,000 INR. She will use the loan to remodel the bathroom in her home, replace the pipe work and install a new toilet. She hopes this will eliminate the bad smell caused by the dilapidated toilet system that pervades her home.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom in her home, replace the pipe work and install a new toilet

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a businesswoman and she now lives in Atsabe. In the place where she lives, she opened a business and now she wants to request a loan of $1,000 to fix the business and buy goods according to the tastes of the people including beer, slippers, shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, sardines, toothpaste, cooking oils, detergents, cigarettes, biscuits, hand lotion and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2013 with her own working capital of $200. There are three members in the family: her, one child and her husband.

loans.use: to buy beer, slippers, shampoo, coffee, sugar, noodles, sardines, toothpaste, cooking oils, detergent, cigarettes, biscuits, hand lotion and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jayshree

texts.en:
Jayshree is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children in a small village in Bolangir district. She has five children: one son and four daughters. Her husband is a fisherman and Jayshree is a food merchant. She sells traditional cakes, snacks and cooked side dishes. They pull together to increase their family's income.

She has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum for 15,000 INR. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for the family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but she is able to repay the loans she receives.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 28 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional farm supplies.

Fe has been farming vegetables for 20 years and earns additional income from selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional farm supplies

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 50 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Alona is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alona requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Alona has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 28 años de edad, una persona que se siente muy feliz pues hace solo 6 meses llego a su hogar la mayor alegría, su pequeña hija que la ama y que da todo por ella.

German es un hombre que trabaja como independiente distribuyendo refrescos y licores, pero esa motivación y esas ganas de brindarle un gran futuro a su hija, hizo que despertara y que quiere buscar una ambición más grande para su familia.

Es por esta razón que German se encuentra solicitando un aliento económico para la compra de surtido al por mayor de licores, cerveza y refrescos, saldrá con su moto a distribuir a clientes habituales y buscara por todos los medios posibles nuevos clientes que dinamicen su actividad.
texts.en:
German is a 28 year old man. He is a happy person because just 6 months ago the greatest joy arrived to his home, his infant daughter whom he loves and gives everything for.

German is a man who works independently, distributing refreshments and liquors. The motivation and desire to provide a great future to his daughter caused him to wake up and seek a greater ambition for his family.

It is for this reason that German is requesting financial support to buy an assortment of wholesale liquors, beers and refreshments. He will go out on his motorcycle to deliver to regular customers and will seek new customers, by any means possible, to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of wholesale liquors, beers and refreshments.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Saran, a rural villager living in Battambang province, is 41 years old. She is a farmer and married mother who has five dependent children, one of whom is in school and one is too young to attend school. To make a living, she and her husband are working hard to earn an income through providing motor-taxi services, raising chickens and working for others for a fee. She has been in these businesses for seven years. Her challenge is that her chickens got ill and it caused her to expend some of her income to cure them. Saran decided to form a group of two members to apply for a new loan, which is her sixth, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Based on the previous loan, she has managed to upgrade her standard of living. With the new loan she is asking for, she will purchase a good chicken breed and feed, and build a chicken cage to generate more income to support her family. She hopes she can expand her business so as to increase her income for better support of her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a good chicken breed and feed and build a chicken cage to generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines. Amy has been in this business for 8 years. Amy also earns income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of ginger to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of ginger to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mylene works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mylene is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

Mylene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 40 years old and has four children. Rosalinda is married and has four children who are in school.

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda has been involved in selling activities since 2000. She started her business with her own working capital of $1500.00. She is married and she has 3 children. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens, cows, as her husband is in agriculture. 

Fernanda has a shop of her own for business and she is also selling in the market. So now she is requesting a loan of $1500.00 because she wants to use to buy buckets, chairs, rice bowl, thermos, scoops, ladles and kitchen tools and other things. 

She is very hopeful with this loan she can be improving her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy buckets, chairs, rice bowl, thermos, scoops, ladles and other things kitchen tools.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Jessie Jhon is 19 years old and is 2nd of two children in the family. Her mother Fe supports the family through her cafeteria business in the Philippines.

Jessie Jhon is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

Fe is borrowing Php 10,000 to pay for tuition fees of the First semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Jessie Jhon plans to graduate and help her family.

loans.use: to pay her son's 2nd year tuition fees for a B. Sc. in Marine Transportation

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba and her husband have been engaged in fishing business. She is a 48-year-old woman and has eight children. She has four school aged children ages 19, 17, 13 and nine years old. Melba is working hard to help her husband in providing the needs of their family.

 In the future Melba dreams to buy new engine to help them increase their livelihood. With this she is asking a loan to buy a new engine and for boat repair.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and for boat repair

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Vestine is a 35-year-old married mother of four. She was elected as the president of Abunzubumwe Group. She is the first individual on the left, wearing orange and green clothing. The group has 15 members, but only 14 are pictures as one member was unable to leave her business to attend the group meeting. Vestine works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. For the past 5 years Vestine has sold bananas, beans and maize at the market from in her farming business. 

Every morning Vestine opens her shop at 7 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business buy purchasing fertilizer so that she is able to increase the output and quality of her crops, which will eventually lead to increased profits when her crops are sold at the local market. Vestine realizes that she has several competitors in the area so she is hoping that this loan will allow her to produce a superior quality and quantity of crops. 

With the profits, Vestine will be able to get medical insurance for her family and pay school fees for her four children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to increase the output from her crops to sell at the market.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Felma works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Felma is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer from Shawai Vilage. Iliya joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Iliya would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Chich's Group

texts.en:
Chich is local resident of a remote area of Battambang province and a 43-year-old father of two dependent children who are in school. He works as a policeman to earn the main source of family’s income. Additionally, he and his wife are growing cassava to supplement income. Chich expects to enhance his cassava farming business; unfortunately, he lacks capital. 

Thus he leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is his fourth cycle and he has repaid his past loan completely. The past loan was helpful and it enabled him to earn good income to renovate the house and provide family members with sufficient food. Chich, who is the leader of group, will use his loan to pay for plowing fee, purchase cassava seeds, organic fertilizers and organic pesticide for the cassava farmland. He hopes to achieve his dream of expanding his business so as to earn more income to upgrade the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fee, purchase cassava seeds, organic fertilizers and organic pesticide for the cassava farmland.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old and has one child in school.  

Francisca is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Francisca has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm suppplies

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 51 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Venus is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Venus has been farming sugarcane for 29 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Venus would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre soltero de 54 años de edad, un hombre soñador, emprendedor, trabajador, se dedica a la cría de cerdos, una actividad en la cual deposita todo su cariño y cuidado, ya que le gusta mantener sus cocheras en óptimas condiciones, sus cerdos en excelentes estado higiénico y no recurre al maltrato de estos.

La sostenibilidad del negocio que tanto ama hacer es lo primordial para este humilde campesino, pero los altos costos de insumos y la fuerte competencia en precio de venta de cerdos hacen que pequeñas empresas como la de Nelson se vena seriamente afectada.

Es por esta razón que Nelson recurre a un apoyo financiero para la compra de cerdos y alimento en cantidades, con el objetivo de ser más competitivo en el mercado, también quiere crear canales de desecho y de alimentación, adecuando sus cocheras y teniéndolas en perfectas condiciones de infraestructura para albergar cerdos.
texts.en:
Nelson is 54 yeas old and single. He is a dreamer, an entrepreneur, and a hard worker. Nelson makes a living raising pigs, a trade into which he puts all his love and care. Nelson likes to keep his crops in optimum conditions, and his pigs in excellent hygiene conditions. Nelson does not mistreat his pigs.

Sustaining the business he loves is essential for Nelson, a humble peasant. The high cost of supplies and strong competition in pig sale prices, however, make it difficult for small businesses, such as that of Nelson, which are seriously affected.

As a result, Nelson is applying for financial support in order to buy pigs and feed in bulk in order to be more competitive on the market. Nelson also wants to create channels for waste and for feed, and to look after his crops, and to keep his infrastructure in perfect condition so that he can house his pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed in bulk.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old and has four children.

Susan is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Susan has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her making dried fish business.

Jasmine has been in this business for 4 years. Jasmine earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en: Yun is 52 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school and needs her support. She is now living in Battambang province where she has been growing rice and vegetables for 25 years. She is also working as a paid worker to earn additional income. The rice crops were destroyed by pests and not healthy enough to produce good outputs, which were her challenges. For Yun, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her farming business. She hopes to improve her farm and get more income to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her farming business.

loans.name: Mikaila

texts.en:
Mikaila  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maájah Village. Mikaila  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Mikaila  suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to feed his family and children. 

Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Mikaila  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 20 bags of maize this year, Mikaila can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Lejla

texts.en:
This is Lejla and her husband, Gezim who both are in the early fifties and parents of two and members of the ethnic Egyptian Albanian community; they live in a little town in northern Albania. Their earnings come from Gezim who works in a grocery store, Lejla's who works as a kitchen help in a nearby restaurant and one son works in a supermarket.  All in all, the total earnings adds up to $300/month. 

One of their sons though, works occasionally in recording events such as weddings, baptisms, birthdays etc and recently his professional recording camera broke down and he needs to replace it. This is why Lejla is applying for a loan

."My son was making some money doing the professional recording on occasions and recently he stopped doing it because of the broken camera. Living all of us with $300/month is tough and the lack of additional cash that was coming from his profession was felt right way," said Lejla.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera for her son who's profession is recording events

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 31 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sales essential commodities.  She also has a beauty salon.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more hair braids and relaxers for the beauty salon and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and improve on her family standards of living. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a whole sale shop. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire more hair braids and relaxers for the beauty salon

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a computer services business where he offers typesetting, printing services. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in urban area and he describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another computer. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another computer to increase his business services

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. 

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt and other items

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is a married woman with 1 child. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers M-pesa services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add M-pesa float. She hopes that in the future, she will own a supermarket. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add M-pesa float for her money transfer service

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional seedling and other farm supplies.

Leonila has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and married with seven children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mariarose

texts.en:
Mariarose is 43 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mariarose requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

Mariarose has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Mariarose would like to save enough money to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Hello lenders! Edna lives with her handsome husband in Kapsowar, a small rural town in Kenya. The Kapsowar area is also referred to as the mango region of Kenya because half the mangoes consumed are from that region. She has been farming for the past five years and has never looked back. To earn a decent and honest living, she sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. Edna is satisfied with the returns she gets through farming. However, she wants to diversify and start horticultural farming. The main challenge she faces is accessing funds. She is kindly requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. To access funds, Edna joined Juhudi Kilimo, an institution that supports smallholder farmers with both financial and technical solutions. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo, she answered, “They assist small-scale farmers.” Through horticulture, she will be able to improve her living standards and secure the future of her family. In the long run, the ultimate goal for Edna is to permanently improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming

loans.name: Edith Noemy

texts.es:
Edith, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, vive junto a sus dos hijos y dos hijas.  

Edis, tiene una pupuseria desde hace 6 años y lo aprendió gracias a una amiga, quien le apoyo a conocer el negocio y luego ella se independizo para realizarlo; esto ha sido el medio de subsistencia para la sostenibilidad de su familia.  

Edis, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar harina de maíz, aceite, frijoles, tomates, etc. para la elaboración de pupusas. 

Edis, desea que su negocio sea sostenible y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Edith is 43 years old and completed high school. She lives with her two sons and two daughters.

Edith has had a stall where she sells "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) for six years. Edith learned this trade from a friend who supported her in learning about this business before she started doing it independently. This work supports the family.

Edith will use this loan to buy cornflour, oil, beans, tomatoes and more to make pupusas.

Edith wants her business to be sustainable for her children to continue in education.

loans.use: to buy cornflour, oil, beans, tomatoes and more to make pupusas.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafki Village. Solomon joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Solomon will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Solomon now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Tafki Village. Hussaini joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. T

hrough Babban Gona’s input loan, Hussainiwill have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hussaini now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Mary Ann’s perseverance. Wanting to give them a brighter future, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store and internet café business. She dreams that her children will finish school because she knows that it’s the first step in their success.

Mary Ann resides in Fatima, General Santos City with her husband, Mario, and their two children. She is operating a variety store that sells various commodities like canned goods, snack items, candies, toiletries, mineral water and other beverages. She tries to make her store competitive by organizing her stocks in such a way that customers can easily locate their needed products. It’s more pleasant to the eyes and naturally it can entice more buyers. She also started a small internet café adjacent to it, hoping that internet users could be her captured store buyers. She’s doing this endeavor because her husband’s income as a self-employed worker doesn’t suffice for their children’s educational expenses. One of them is studying in college and the other one is in high school.

Now that she aspires to further improve her business, she humbly asks for a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy assorted grocery items to sell. In the long run, she hopes to convert it into a grocery store with complete supplies. You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness.

Mary Ann meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items to sell

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 50 years old and married with 12 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Cora has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig raising.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and eggs

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dona is 40 years old and has one child who is in school.

Dona has a general store business in the Philippines. Dona requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dona has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Dona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn, the farmer living in Battambang province, is married and 44 years old. She is blessed with six children, three of whom depend on her and one of whom is in school. She has been working hard to earn main sources of family’s income by growing cassava, sesame, and paddy rice and she has been involved in them for ten years. Moreover, she sometimes works for others for a fee in order to earn additional income. The cassava farming business grew slowly and she cannot afford to support it well. 

Therefore, she is now leading a group of three members to take out a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which will be her second cycle loan. The past loan enabled her to renovate her house much better and more comfortable. Chhorn, the leader, will use her loan to pay for plowing fees, purchase cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well. She hopes she can get more income to buy more organic fertilizers, which are expected to increase the crop products.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, purchase cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta is married and has10 children, their numbers are 12 people in her family. She has a very small business, so she has an idea to request a loan from the Tuba Rai Metin. 

She wants to open her kiosk as a bigger store but her capital is not enough so she is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business.  She will used this loan to buy pop mie, biscuit, candle, toothbrush, sugar, rice, detergent, noodles, pens, shampoo, sweets and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2000, with her own working capital. 

She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pop mie, biscuit, candle, toothbrush, sugar, rice, detergent, noodles, pens, shampoo, sweets and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing rope and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items and variety vegetables to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad sells variety vegetables within her locality. She has been in this kind of business for 35 years.According to her, she had half hectare of vegetable farmland where she grows eggplant,string beans,green pepper and tomato.Trinidad also raises goat,carabao,duck,chicken and cow.

She plans to purchase fertilizers,insecticide,pesticide and vegetable seed to keep her vegetable vending business productive and profitable. To make her plans possible,she is seeking for a loan of PHP7,000. She knows that having this amount of loan will enable her to obtain better income and improve her vegetable farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer,insecticide,pesticide and vegetable seed for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 53-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Two of these children are still attending school ages 20 and 17 years old. Her Husband is a farmer and a carpenter while Amelita is selling snacks. She used to do this during school days. She has been doing this business for 17 years. 

In the future Amelita wishes to improve her food vending business to have a better living. With this, she is asking a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast and sugar

loans.name: Debelita

texts.en:
Debelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Debelita has been in this business for three years. Debelita earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Grullo

texts.en:
Grullo is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Grullo is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and other pig supplies .

Grullo has been pig fattening  for 6 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to have an additional business and to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and other pig supplies

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Ma.Theresa is 42 years old and all four children are attend in school.

Ma.Theresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma.Theresa requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma.Theresa has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Ma.Theresa would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Etoile De Bethlehem Group

texts.fr: Marie est âgée de 25 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants. Commerçante depuis 5 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience, son accueil et le respect des clients et la qualité de sa marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter du lait en poudre, sucre et divers à 100 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner sa boutique en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 1 fois et a rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en:
Marie is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has been a merchant for five years and has been successful because of her experience, knowledge, respect for her customers, and the quality of her merchandise.

She wants this loan to buy powdered milk, sugar, and other goods for 100,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to stock her shop with enough to strengthen her business.

Marie has already received one loan, and she reimbursed it on time.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, sugar, and other goods

loans.name: Sophary's Group

texts.en: Age 57, Sophary is a farmer who lives in Battambang province. She is a married mother who is blessed with four children, one of whom is relying on her and in school. She has been growing cassava for years to earn her main source of income. In addition, she is working as a tailor to supplement her income. Her cassava farming business has been growing slowly as there is insufficient capital to enhance it. Sophary is leading a group of two members to take out a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which will be her sixth loan. The past loan, which was paid back completely, enabled her to renovate her house and support her family’s needs. She will use her loan to improve the cassava farming business by paying for plowing and paid workers' fees, and purchasing cassava seeds and organic fertilizer. She hopes to expand her business to fulfill her dream of upgrading her standard of living.

loans.use: to improve her cassava farming business by paying for plowing and paid workers' fees, and purchasing cassava seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida  is a married woman with one child who attend school. She lives at her own  house that neither has piped water nor electricity. She cites food as her monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past eight years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. In addition, she also operates a food stall business that earns her a another source of income. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Bin Kelema Group

texts.fr: Bintou est âgée de 53 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants dont tous scolarisés, son époux est u cultivateur. Elle exerce son activité depuis 20 ans.  Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est  son expérience, son accueil, respect de ses clients et aussi l’emplacement de son lieu de commerce situé au bord de la voix. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter de poisson en quantité pour 40 kg par four. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner son activité en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire ses clients. Elle à déjà  reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Bintou is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who all attend school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Bintou has worked [selling fish] for 20 years, and her success comes from her experience, her knowledge, respect for her customers, and also the location of her business along the road.

She wants this loan to buy fish in bulk--40 kilograms each day--so as to satisfy her customers.

Bintou has already received two loans before, and she repaid them both on time.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Nazimbé Group

texts.fr: Djétou est âgée de 45 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants dont tous scolarisés, son époux est commerçant. Elle exerce son activité depuis 20 ans. Ce qui fait marcher ses activités c’est son expérience, l’accueil et le respect des clients, le lieu de l’emplacement de l’activité, la marchandise est toujours disponible. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter des légumes (choux, oignons, tomates) à 150 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Djétou is 45 years old, married, and the mother of six children, who all attend school. Her husband is a merchant.

Djétou has worked [selling vegetables] for 20 years. She succeeds in her business, because of her experience, her knowledge, respect for her customers, the availability of her stock, and also her location. 

She wants this loan to buy vegetables (cabbage, onions, tomatoes) for 150,000 francs CFA, which will be enough to satisfy her customers.

Djétou has already received three loans, and she has repaid them all on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cabbage, onions, tomatoes)

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met, 52, lives in her own humble home made of daub and wattle in a small village in Bolangir district. She has lived there for a number of years with her husband and their two daughters, age 26 and 24, and their 19-year-old son. Met works as a restauranteur in the community, and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Met is well known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.

Met is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene. She hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system

loans.name: Bolibana 30 Group

texts.fr: Mariam est âgée de 39 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants. Vendeuse de paire de chaussure et d’habits depuis 9 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience dans le commerce, le respect de la clientèle, la qualité de la marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 60 paires de chaussures et 30 complets d’habits. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner sa boutique afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME
texts.en:
Mariam is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has worked selling shoes and clothing for nine years. She has been successful in this business because of her experience, her respect for her customers, and the quality of her merchandise.

Mariam wants this loan to buy 60 pairs of shoes and 30 clothing outfits. This loan will go towards stocking her shop in order to satisfy her customers.

Mariam has already received two loans, which she reimbursed on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing

loans.name: Surekha

texts.en:
Surekha, 40, lives in a community in Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She has three children. Her two daughters are married and her one son is continuing his studies.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. She has been in this type of business for 20 years.

Surekha wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Thadyam2 Group

texts.fr: Korotimi âgée de 52 ans mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Elle mène le commerce de pagne et chaussure il ya plus de 10 ans. Elle a de la clientèle tant au quartier, au marché et au camp militaire où elle est restauratrice. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter de marchandises diverses qualités qui lui permettront de faire plus de profit. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 9 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Korotimi is 52 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has worked selling pagne [bright, colorful fabric] and shoes for more than ten years. Her customers are from her area, from the market, and from the military camp where she works preparing food.

She wants this loan to buy various quality goods, which will permit her to earn more profits. She has already received nine loans, and she has reimbursed them all on time.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and merchandise

loans.name: Yerebi Group

texts.fr: Routie, est âgée de 51 ans mariée mère de 5 enfants. Depuis 2005 la cliente vend du charbon et du bois de chauffe chez elle à domicile. Les produits en permanence font que la clientèle gagne plus de client ce qui fait marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter un chargement de bois et du charbon. L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour s’satisfaire sa clientèle afin d’avoir un bénéfice. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt à ACFIME et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Routie is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Since 2005, she has worked selling charcoal and firewood from her home. She has been successful because of her consistent stock. 

She wants this loan to buy a load of wood and charcoal. This loan will allow her to procure enough stock to satisfy her customers in order to earn more. 

She has already received one loan through ACFIME, and she reimbursed it on time.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Snehalata

texts.en:
Snehalata, 43, lives in a small village in Bolangir district and is a married mother blessed with two dependent children. One of her children is in secondary school and needs her support to study in order to have a bright future.

To make a living, she grows rice and sells grocery items. She sometimes works as a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. Her husband also works as a farmer and helps her in cultivating her crops. However, Snehalata lacks access to toilet facilities and is bound to depend on the field for defecation and urination

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR. She will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes that all of her family members can live healthily and avoid infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile telephone covers

loans.name: Bonswendé 2 Group

texts.en:
Minata is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children--one daughter and four sons. She has been a merchant for several years, and she has been successful because of her experience, the quality of her cereals, and the respect between customers and suppliers.

She wants this loan to buy cereals at bulk--300,000 francs CFA worth of corn and 200,000 francs CFA worth of millet. The loan will allow her to procure enough stock so as to earn enough on average to take care of her family.

She has already received loans 18 times before, and she has reimbursed them all on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and millet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sacs of flour, supplies, and equipment (fryer, plates, pots)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans qui a deux enfants à charge. Yawa est une revendeuse de condiments et biscuits  habitant à Adidogomé. Yawa achète ses marchandises au marché une fois par mois et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Yawa sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des piments et de biscuits afin d’avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is 38 years old, married, and takes care of two children. She lives in Adidogomé, where she works selling condiments and cookies. 

Yawa buys her goods at a market once a month and resells them in a shop at her home. She is seeking this loan to buy peppers and cookies as a way to earn enough to help her husband cover their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 60 trays of peppers and 50 boxes of cookies

loans.name: Diariwou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 23 Décembre 2014 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles ont une bonne entente et nouent des liens fort de solidarités et d’entre aide.

Madame Diariwou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et  mère de 05enfants dont 02 filles et 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile raffinée de patte d’arachide , d’huile de palme etc..

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 20 litres d’huile raffinée à 11000, 20 litres d’huile de palme à 16500f et de la patte d’arachide à 20000f pour le revendre en détails son quartier

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et de s’occuper de ses enfants : soins médicaux, habillement etc.…
texts.en:
This group was created 23 December 2014 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. The group is composed of women who largely have acquired a solid base of experience in small-scale commerce, which is their principal activity. They get along well, and they share strong ties of solidarity and mutual aid. 

Diariwou (who is standing on the far right [in the photo] with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 48 years old, and the mother of five children--two daughters and three sons. 

Diariwou works selling refined oil, groundnut paste, palm oil, etc. This new loan will allow her to buy 20 liters of refined oil worth 11,000 francs CFA, 20 liters of palm oil for 165,000 francs CFA, and groundnut paste worth 20,000 francs CFA. She will resell this stock at retail in her area. 

Earnings will allow her to help her husband cover the daily expenses and take care of their children's healthcare, clothing, and other needs.

loans.use: to buy refined oil, palm oil, and groundnut paste

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, solicita el credito para la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche y quesos, gracias al crédito podra comprar y mejorar su economia y sacar adelante a sus hijos, lleguen hacer profesionistas, en su tiempo libre le gusta ayudar en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 44, is married and has two children.  She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow to produce milk and cheese.  The loan will enable her to buy the cow and improve her economy.  This will allow her to provide for her children and see them become professionals. 

In her free time she likes helping out in the community.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Maman est un emboucheur âge de 38 ans, marié, père de six enfants, leur âge se varie entre 16 et 2 ans parmi les six enfants deux sont  scolarisés. Sa conjointe vend des poissons sèches dans leur village son, rêve est  de construit une maison en dure et pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle réside aux Mali il est analphabète ; il fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter beaucoup d’animaux pour engraisser.  Il s’approvisionne dans la foire locale. Il fait la vente dans les mêmes foire donc  il dispose une méthode de vente rentable. Il réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel  qui  varie entre 50 000f et 150 000Fcfa Par tête. Il utilise le prêt dans l’embouche en achetant plus de bœuf. Le prêt l’aidera à prospérer dans la vie. Il fait cette activité depuis 3 ans. Ce qui lui plait dans ce travail est que les services  financiers du RMCR soit d’actualités pour toujours pour qu’il puisse être  indépendant dans les jours à venir. Les obstacles sont souvent les hautes des prix , les maladies et la meuvent. Mais malgré il se défend mieux
texts.en:
Maman is a livestock farmer. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of six children, who are aged between two and 16 years old. Six of the children are in school. His wife works selling dried fish in their village. Maman lives in Mali and cannot read or write.

Maman's dream is to build a long-lasting house and to be able to support his family's needs.

Maman joined RMCR to buy many animals to fatten. He has been a livestock farmer for three years. He procures his stock from the local markets. He makes his resales in the same markets. This makes his work profitable. He earns a profit that varies between 50,000 and 150,000 francs CFA per head. 

He will use this loan to buy more cattle. The loan will help him prosper in his life. The financial services offered by RMCR will help him to be independent in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and resell

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven enérgico, sonriente, charlatán de 24 años de edad que ante la falta de oportunidades de empleo mostró su mejor cara, la de un guerrero emprendedor que busca por todos los medios honestos recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar, de él dependen sus padres, su pareja y su pequeña de tan solo 2 años de edad.

Para generar recursos Carlos se dedica a la cría de ganado de porcino, una actividad que de seguro que con empeño y dedicación hará que la calidad de su familia aumente y no descansará hasta asegurar un buen futuro a su tesorito (hija).

En su negocio Carlos tiene que enfrentarse a una fuerte competencia y la falta de recursos le impiden elaborar estrategias de crecimiento y mejoras locativas para dinamizar su profesión, es por ello que necesita un impulso económico para la compra de cerdos, alimento y materiales, que le ayudaran a darle un impulso significativo a su negocio que se traducen en aumento de ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, energetic, smiling, chatty 24-year-old who, when faced with a lack of opportunities, shows the best of himself.  He is a determined entrepreneur who seeks out honest means of income to support his household.  His dependents include his parents, his partner and their two-year-old daughter.

Carlos raises pigs for a living and is sure that with hard work and dedication he will improve his family's quality of living.  He will not rest until he is sure of a bright future for his little darling daughter.

In his business Carlos must face strong competition; his lack of resources stands in the way of coming up with growth strategies and infracture improvements to boost his profession.  Therefore he needs economic support to buy pigs, feed and materials that will significantly enchance his business and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed and materials to give his business a significant boost and increase sales.

loans.name: Liceth Cristina

texts.es:
Liceth es una joven de 24 años de edad, la cual inicio a principios de este año una profesión de venta y cría de pollos, ya que necesitaba recursos para mejorar las condiciones en su vivienda y ofrecer algo mejor a sus dos hijos de 6 y 5 años.

Liceth aprendió de la profesión gracias a su pareja, con la cual comparte el hogar, es un noviazgo joven y quiere apoyarlo incondicionalmente para que juntos salgan adelante y construya un hogar donde primen los buenos valores y no pasen necesidades.

El objetivo principal a largo plazo de Liceth es pagar la educación de sus muchachos y ya que su empresa está en etapa de consolidación, necesita recursos para invertir, es por ello que solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos y alimento, su estrategia es tener sus galpones surtidos y vender un pollo grande y gordo cuando el cliente lo desee.

Apoya a esta empresaria que prefirió buscar una solución, antes de quejarse por su situación económica.
texts.en:
Liceth, 24, started her business at the beginning of the year and raises and sells chickens.  She needed the income to improve the conditions of her home and give her children, ages 6 and 5, something better.

Liceth learned her trade from her partner who lives with her.  They are a young couple who wants to support each other unconditionally to get ahead and build a home with good values and lacking for nothing.

Liceth's long-term goal is to pay for her children's education.  Since her business is in the consolidation stage she needs resources for investment.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and feed.  Her strategy is to have a varied chicken coop and sell large fattened chickens to customers who are interested.

Please help this entrepreneur who preferred seeking out a solution rather than complaining about her financial situation.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed.  Her strategy is to have a varied chicken coop and sell large fattened chickens.

loans.name: Flor Mery

texts.es:
En el año 2007 inicio el sueño como independiente de la señora Flor, ella montó un negocio que es un restaurante el cual opera desde su hogar, su perseverancia en momentos difíciles son la que la tiene hoy pasado 8 años en el mercado.

Flor siempre está en busca de nuevos clientes, trata de llamar la atención variando el menú y ofreciendo cómodos precios, pero al solo tener un empleado hace que la mayor parte del tiempo la pase en su negocio cocinando o haciendo el papel de mesera y cajera.

Pero sin importar lo que pase, ella quiere seguir firme con su negocio y lograr sus metas y objetivos, como mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda o tener un restaurante visualmente hermoso y con un excelente sazón.

Ella necesita mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, actualizar sus activos fijos, por ello quiere recurrir a un auxilio monetario para la compra de insumos como abarrotes, vegetales, granos, refrescos, cervezas, frutas y compra de aparatos eléctricos como estufas, ollas arrocera, licuadora industrial, nevera.

El empuje monetario, será el dinero complementario para realizar todas las compras que en el momento necesita en su negocio.
texts.en:
In 2007 Flor started to realize her dream of being an independent woman. She set up a business, which is a restaurant that she runs from her home. Her perseverance in times of difficulty is what has allowed her to be in the business for eight years. 

Flor is always on the look out for new customers. She tries to attract attention by keeping the menu varied and offering reasonable prices. But as the business only has one employee she spends most of her time cooking and playing the role of waitress and cashier. 

But no matter what happens she wants to move on confidently with her business and achieve her goals and objectives. For example, she wants to improve the conditions of her home and have a visually attractive restaurant which offers excellent flavours.

She needs to improve her sales, get more customers and upgrade her fixed assets. In order to do so she wants to use some financial help to buy supplies such as  groceries, vegetables, grains, soft drinks, beer, fruit and electrical apparatus such as stoves, rice cookers, an industrial blender and a fridge. 

The monetary boost will be the supplementary money that will allow her to buy all of the items that her business currently needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as groceries, vegetables, grains, soft drinks, beer, fruit and electrical apparatus such as stoves, rice cookers, an industrial blender and a fridge

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica es una joven de 25 años de edad, con ambición, ganas de progreso, una persona que está decidida a buscar el progreso usando como herramienta el negocio de fabricación de productos lácteos que tiene en su hogar.

Ella es madre de una hermosa princesa de 3 años de edad (ver foto), la sonrisas que le genera esta muñeca es la que la motiva diariamente a dar lo mejor de si en su negocio y a querer progresar y ser la principal distribuidora de lácteos una ambición grande que espera algún día cumplir.

Mónica en el momento tiene una motocicleta para distribuir sus pedidos, que han estado aumentando, pero necesita un impulso para comprar activos fijos para producir mayor cantidad de quesos, yogurt, quesito, cuajadas, mantequilla, es por ello que solicita ayuda, un impulso económico que usara para la compra de un enfriador, para albergar mayor cantidad de productos, comprar un molino, adecuación del local, para cumplir normas de sanidad y capital de trabajo para comprar a los ganaderos leche que es su materia prima.

 Anímate apoyar una talentosa joven, que busca crecer y agradecerá el apoyo de ustedes por ayudarla a cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Monica, 25, is a young lady with ambition and a desire to prosper.  She is determined to be successful through her business producing dairy products at home.

She is the mother of a beautiful three-year-old "princess" (in the picture).  The smiles of her little doll are what motivate her every day to do her best in her business, progress and become the main dairy distributor.  Her goal is ambitious but she hopes to succeed one day.

Monica now has a motorcycle to distribute her orders which have been on the increase.  But she needs a boost to buy fixed assets to produce more cheese, yogurt, curd and butter.  Therefore she is requesting help to buy a refrigerator to store more products, buy a mill, and fix up her workspace to meet sanitation regulations.  She also needs work capital to buy milk as raw material from dairy farmers.

Please help this talented young woman who seeks to grow.  She is grateful for the support toward meeting her goals.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to store more products, buy a mill and fix up her workplace.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Un día cualquiera del año 1986 una persona llamada Albeiro decidió buscar un mejor futuro e iniciar un negocio de venta de ganando, actividad que hoy continua realizando y gracias a ella ha logrado grandes cosas como lo son constituir un hogar, el cual comparte con su esposa y su hija adolescente.

Albeiro sigue realizando su profesión y espera hacerlo hasta que su salud se lo permita y más aún que tiene un sueño que le falta por cumplir, comprar la vivienda donde actualmente habitan.

En su profesión hay ciertas dificultades que pueden afectar mucho su económica, algunos ejemplos podrían ser   la situación climática y la situación climática que acaban con la vida de estos animales. Perdidas difíciles y más pensando en que son mamíferos que cuestan una buena cantidad de dinero, Ante esta problemática Albeiro tiene que tomar medidas rápidas es por ello que se encuentra solicitando un monto para la compra de 5 terneros y sus respectivas vacunas.
texts.en:
One day in 1986 a man by the name Albeiro decided to seek a better future and start selling cattle.  He continues this activity today thanks to which he has been able to achieve great things such as setting up a hosuehold which he shares with his wife and teen daughter.

Albeiro hopes to continue his work for as long as his health allows, especially since he still has a goal to meet which is buying the house they currently live in.

There are several difficulties in his profession which affect his economy greatly.  An example of this is climate change and its affect on the lives of animals.  Mammals pose a difficult loss as they cost a lot of money.

Because of this adversity Albeiro must take quick steps and is requesting a loan to buy five calves and their respective vaccines.

loans.use: To buy five calves and their respective vaccines.

loans.name: Mikhtojidin

texts.ru: Михтожидин простой, добрый, ответственный и очень честный мужчина, проживающий в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 51 лет, он имеет жену и двоих детей. Его дети учатся. Сам Михтожидин занимается животноводством. Он начал выращивать крупнорогатый скот у себя во дворе 5 лет назад и по сей день продолжает этот стабильный бизнес. В данный момент он обратился за кредитом для увеличения поголовья скота. Если Михтожидин увеличит поголовье скота, то он сможет расширить свой бизнес и будет в состоянии обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым и создать для семьи лучшие условия жизни.
texts.en: Mikhtojidin is a simple, kind, responsible and very honest man living in the J. Rumy region. He is 51 years old and has a wife and two children. His children are studying. Mikhtojidin himself rears animals. He began rearing cattle in his yard five years ago, and continues this stable business to the present day. At the present time, he has applied for a loan to increase his herd of cattle. If Mikhtojidin increases his herd of cattle, he will be able to expand his business and he will be in a position to provide his family with all that is necessary and create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to increase his herd of cattle.

loans.name: Kumudini

texts.en:
Kumudini, pictured in the photograph, is 47 years old and hails from a small village of the Bolangir district. She lives with her husband and one unmarried daughter.

Kumudini works as a farmer in her field and cultivates varieties of green vegetables. She earns her living by selling her harvested produce in the market. Her family is classified as a poor family and cannot afford to have a sanitary latrine.

Kumudini is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap. This will help to improve her family's hygiene and health and contribute to the sanitary improvement of her community.

loans.use: to build a sanitary toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman. She is 55 years old and resides in Tugas, Balingao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Lourdes owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been 16 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 6,500 doing this business.

Lourdes requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase dry goods, sardines, etc. to sell.

Recently, Lourdes joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Eden

texts.en:
Ma. Eden is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Eden dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Auderica

texts.en:
Auderica finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby with her husband but she earns to make a living. At the age of 51 and married with six children, she keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for the family.

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2014 and she gains access to microfinance services of the coop.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Auderica wishes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making dried fish business in the Philippines. Angelita has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her making dried fish business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Jangyaseni

texts.en:
Jangyaseni is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and a son, who works as a mechanic in a garage.

Jangyaseni has a small grocery shop selling soaps, detergents, cosmetics, semi-processed food items, spices and beverages. They pull together to increase their family income. She is recognized for her hard work and dedication in her community.

She has asked for a loan of 15,000 INR. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom in her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants her family to have access to safe sanitation so that she will be able to safeguard her family from infectious diseases.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthful sanitation. Jangyaseni is very grateful for this opportunity and extends her heartiest thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy has four children and she is married. They live at Tuao.

She is managing a store for income. In her store, she is selling grocery items to the people in her village.

She would like to improve her earnings and that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

She hopes to continue improving her output and saving for the family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 49, is a married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Myrna has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like make-up set, etc.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like make-up set, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is married and has seven children. Her husband is a carpenter.

She opened her furniture activities in 2010, starting with her own working capital of $600. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy more materials including wooden beams, wooden boards, a drilling machine, a chisel and other materials.

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can enlarge her business in the future and her income can be increased.

Fatima has animals at her house like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies including wooden beams, wooden boards, drilling machine, chisel and other materials.

loans.name: Rahmatulo

texts.ru: Рахматуло из района Дж. Руми 54 года. Он культурный, ответственный и доброжелательный мужчина. Рахматуло женат и имеет двоих взрослых детей. Дочку он выдал замуж, а сын уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. У Рахматулло в районе есть своя автомастерская. Он отличный автомеханик и может починить любую машину. Однако в силу возраста и постоянной физической нагрузки, его здоровье ухудшилось. Из-за кризиса сын не может прислать достаточных средств на лечение своего отца. И поэтому Рахматуло обратился за кредитом. Он хочет как можно скорей выздороветь и снова начать работать, так как по приезде сына он намерен его женить. Рахматуло верит, что Вы поможете ему вновь обрести силы.
texts.en: Rahmatulo, age 54, comes from the Rumi district of Tajikistan.  He is a cultured, responsible and kind-hearted man.  He is married and the father of two adult children.
