His daughter is already married and his son is working in Russia.  Rahmatulo owns an auto body shop close to where he lives.  He is a skilled mechanic who can fix any car.  However, because of age and constant physical exertion, his health has recently deteriorated.  Because of the economic crisis, his son can no longer send enough money to pay for his father's medical treatment.  For this reason Rahmatulo is taking a loan.  As he intends to marry his son upon his return home, he wants to quickly feel better and be able to resume his work.  Rahmatulo is confident that you will help him regain his strength.

loans.use: to pay for his medical treatment.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Con el propósito de crecer como empresa, este hombre (ver foto) llamado Edison quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de 300 pollos, el motivo, es, que necesita generar mayores recursos para mantener su hogar, tener precios competitivos.

Edison heredo el negocio y un sueño de sus padres que era comprar una vivienda propia y quiere luchar por alcanzar ese logro que ha sido esquivo para su familia, apóyalo, ayúdalo a crecer y volverse un empresario competitivo de la zona de Chinu.
texts.en:
With the goal of growing as a business, this man (see photo) called Edison wants a loan to purchase 300 chickens, the motivation is that he needs to generate more earnings to support his household and to have competitive prices. 

Edison inherited the business and a one of his parents' dreams was to purchase their own house and he wants to struggle to achieve this goal that has been elusive for his family. Support him, help him to grow and become a competitive businessman in the zone of Chinu.

loans.use: to purchase 300 chickens to have a competitive business and an excellent stock.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba, a sus 50 años de edad es una mujer con visión, emprendedora y muy activa; por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil conseguir oportunidades de trabajo, por lo cual ha decidido iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía y productos de uso personal, para lo cual requiere el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cremas corporales, productos de aseo personal, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que inicialmente serían familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector.

Con esto podrá obtener ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar y podrá invertir más en su negocio así, podrá ir avanzando para convertirse en una líder del negocio, ser altamente productiva y muy competitiva a nivel comercial, así podrá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 50 years old, is a woman with vision, is enterprising and very active. Her lack of work experience has made it difficult to get work opportunities, so she has decided to begin her own business selling merchandise and personal care products. For this, she needs the loan, with the end of investing it in the purchase of stock in bulk (body creams, personal care products, and more), with the end of taking advantage of the discounts that are offered and, so, to have a variety to offer her customers who at first will be her family members, neighbors, and friends in the area. 

With this, she will be able to get income to contribute to the maintenance of her household and will be able to invest more in her business, she will advance to become a leader in the business, to be highly productive and very competitive at a commercial level, so she will be able to increase her income level and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of products in bulk (body creams, personal care products, and more).

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José María es un trabajador y honesto hombre de 56 años de edad, el cual genera recursos gracias a su negocio de cría de aves, medida que adoptó guiado de sus raíces agrícolas que fueran inculcadas por su padre y las cuales honra con su labor.

Es padre de dos hijos, en los cuales enfoca todos sus esfuerzos, por ello su principal sueño es poder pagar su educación y ayudarles hasta que consigan un empleo o en el momento que lo necesiten.

Los altos costos de insumos, el impredecible clima, la fuerte competencia, se convierten en factores que pueden llevar a la quiebra un negocio como el de José María, es por ello que desea tener un aliento económico para prepararse para enfrentar estas adversidades, el dinero que solicita lo quiere invertir en pollos, alimento y materiales para fortalecer sus galpones, con el objetivo de reducir la muerte de animales por el clima, cabe aclarar que los pollos y gallinas son frágiles ante el frío.
texts.en:
José María is a hard-working and honest man, 56 years old, who earns resources thanks to his business of raising poultry, a means he adopted guided by his agricultural roots which were created by his parents and which he honors with his work.

He is the father of two children, on whom he focuses all his efforts, for this his principal dream is to be able to pay for their education and help them until they get a job or at times when they need it. 

The high costs of supplies, the unpredictable weather, and the strong competition become factors that can bring a business such as José María's to ruin. For this, he wants to have a loan to prepare himself to face these challenges. The money that he requests he wants to invest in chickens, feed, and materials to strengthen his chicken coops, with the goal of reducing the death of animals due to weather. It is clear that the chicks and hens are vulnerable to the cold.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, feed, and materials to strengthen his chicken coops.

loans.name: Leyda Maria

texts.es:
Leyda, una mujer de 28 años de edad ha intentado salir adelante, con su estudio y realizando algunas actividades para conseguir dinero.

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa de cría y venta de pollos como camino a tener una buena independencia, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente porque quiere disfrutar de una mejor vida, estudiar y tener todos los días un motivo para sonreír. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento y materiales para construcción de un galpón.

Apoya a esta joven que quiere demostrar que puede ser muy prospera.
texts.en:
Leyda, a 28-year-old woman, has tried to get ahead with her education and doing some jobs to get money.

She asks for a loan to start her own business, a small business of growing and selling chickens as a path to have good independence. She took the initiative basically because she wants to enjoy a better life, to study, and to have a reason to smile each day. 

She asks for the loan to purchase chickens, feed, and materials to build a shed.

Support this young woman who wants to show that she can be very prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and materials to build a shed.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana es una humilde mujer de 56 años de edad que se dedica a la cría de cerdos, detrás de ellas se encuentra la razón por la cual está ante ustedes contándole un pequeño relato de su vida, esa fachada de madera, es la fachada de su hogar, ella trabaja por construir ese terreno en concreto (cemento, adobes), es el sueño que ha perseguido toda la vida y no quiere descansar hasta lograrlo, por ello solicita un préstamo para incentivar su actividad el cual destinara en la compra de cerdos + alimento de engorde.
texts.en: Ana is a humble woman, 56 yeas old, who works raising pigs. Behind her is found the reason she is in front of you telling a little story about her life. This wooden wall is the wall of her home. She works to build this property in concrete (cement, adobe). It is the dream that she has been pursuing all her life and she doesn't want to rest until she has achieved it. For this, she asks for a loan to stimulate her business which will be used to purchase pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Francocer

texts.es:
Francocer es un veterano de 61 años de edad, que se dedica a la cría de cerdos, una persona humilde, trabajadora, que vive en un hogar que construyo con madera y lo comparte con su pareja y sus 5 hijos adolescentes.

Su propósito es generar recursos para llevar alimento y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar, sueña con que su hogar este construido en material, tener un piso de cerámica, propósitos que tiene trazados y que no piensa detenerse a pesar de las adversidades y dificultades que se le puedan presentar.

Francocer buscando mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, optimizar su negocio, darle sostenibilidad en el tiempo a su negocio, solicita un pequeño monto de capital el cual destinara en la compra de cerdos y alimento.

Para una persona como él, es muy gratificante saber que hay personas que están dispuestas a ayudar a los más necesitados, pero no con una limosna por el contrario le prestan la herramienta para forjar su futuro la cual tiene la responsabilidad de devolver una vez adquieran una propia.
texts.en:
Francocer is a 61-year-old veteran who works raising pigs. He is a humble, hard-working person who lives in a house which he built with wood and which he shares with his partner and their 5 adolescent children.

His goal is to generate income to bring food and improve the living conditions of his home. He dreams of having his home built of stronger material, to have a tile floor, goals which he has outlined and he doesn't plan to stop despite the adversities and difficulties which can come up. 

Francocer, looking to improve his sales, increase his customers, optimize his business, and provide sustainability over time to his business, asks for a small amount of capital which will be used to purchase pigs and feed. 

For a person such as him, it is very gratifying to know that there are people who are ready to help the most needy, but not with a handout but rather they loan the tool to forge their futures which they have the responsibility to return once they get their own.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed to increase the sales turnover in his business.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: Diego tiene 20 años de edad el se dedica a la agricultura y realiza trabajos de pintar las casas y fachadas, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas para sus sembrios de papas, gracias al crédito mejorara la economia para poder sustentar la casa de su madre ya que viven los dos solos, su pasatiempo es jugar voli.
texts.en: Diego is 20 years old, works in agriculture and does jobs painting houses and the fronts of other buildings. He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies for his potato fields. Thanks to the loan he will improve the economy to be able to support his mother's home, as the two of them live together. His hobby is playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Afi Djifa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme agée de 29 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Afi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qu’elle achète et revend au marché deux fois par mois. Afi désire ce prêt pour commander des poissons fumés en vue d’en tirer profit pour répondre aux attentes de ses clients et aider son mari à bien s’occuper des enfants.
texts.en: Afi is married with three children. She is 29 years old and lives in Adidogomé. Afi sells food products that she buys and resells at the market twice a month. Afi requests this loan to order smoked fish so that she can make a profit and satisfy her customers’ expectations, and help her husband to take good care of the children.

loans.use: to buy 06 baskets of smoked fish.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 47-year-old woman from Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has four children ages 20, 15, 14 and 11 years old.

Margie and her husband are engaged in the fishing business. They have been doing this business for 20 years. Aside from fishing, Margie has other sources of income, like buying and selling dried fish. She works hard on it to increase their livelihood.

Margie is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell and for materials needed to repair their boat.

In the future, she dreams of being a successful businesswoman, and she also dreams that her children will finish their degrees.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to buy materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 58 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Daisy has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 44-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Yvonne has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Yvonne requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Yvonne has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio tiene 36 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia, solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para engordarlos y luego venderlos para poder ganas alguina comisión y mejorar su estado económico, gracias al crédito podra invertir rapidamente, las compras realiza en Guaranda en el mercado de animales, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien, y su pasatiempo es hacer mingas en la comunidad.
texts.en: Aurelio is 36 years old, is married and has 4 children. His work is farming and cattle raising. He is asking for the loan to buy cattle which he will feed up and then sell on to be able to earn a commission and improve his financial state. Thanks to the loan he will be able to invest quickly and make his purchases at the animal market in Guaranda. His dream is that his children will study, and his hobby is doing cooperative work in the community.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Carlos Israel

texts.es: Carlos tiene 20 años su padre trabaja de vendedor de ganado y el le ayuda, el solicita el crédito para poder comprar una vaca e invertir para poder poco a poco separandose de su padre ya que quiere independizarse y gracias al crédito otorgado lo hara, su desafio al que se enfrenta es la falta de empleo y en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Carlos is 20 years old. His father works selling cattle, and he helps him. He is asking for the loan to be able to buy a cow and invest in order to strike out from his father bit by bit, as he wants to become independent. Thanks to the loan given, he will do that, as the challenge he faces is a lack of work. In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Edinson Alberto

texts.es:
Edinson, de 22 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidido a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

El desea desempeñarse como vendedor de mercancía variada como ropa en el municipio de Taraza.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es un joven emprendedor y muy disciplinado.

El solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresario y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
Edinson, 22 years old, is very clear about what he wants for his life and has decided to finish his education to get ahead and have a good life.

He wants to work as a salesman of a variety of merchandise such as clothing in the municipality of Taraza.

He wants to begin this work with the end of seeking the resources he needs to support himself and for his education, in addition to being able to contribute to the household expenses.

He is an enterprising and very disciplined young man.

He asks for the loan to purchase a wide assortment of clothing in bulk and, in this way, take advantage of the opportunity that Corporación Interactuar presents him to be independent. 

He has the hope of being able to progress as a business man and have some more stable income and is grateful to all the people who can contribute to his dream.

loans.use: to purchase a wide assortment of clothing in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans habitant à Adidogomé et ayant six enfants à charge. Abla est une revendeuse d’ignames, arachides et divers qu’elle achète et le revend au marché trois fois par mois.  Ayant la volonté d’étendre son commerce et de promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants, Abla  souhaite ce prêt pour commander des ignames, de l’arachide et de la farine de manioc afin pouvoir bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abla is married, she is 47 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She has six dependent children. Abla sells yams, peanuts and various other products that she buys and resells at the market three times a month. Abla would like to expand her business and promote her children’s education. Abla requests this loan to order yams, peanuts and manioc flour so that she can organise her children’s education well.

loans.use: to buy 04 yam gourds, 03 packets of peanuts and 25 bowls of manioc flour.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Con tan solo 19 años de edad, esta sorprendente joven llamada Luisa ya cuenta con su negocio propio, una cafetería la cual se está convirtiendo en su motor de sueños, pues en esta deposita sus esperanzas de estudio y mejora de calidad de vida.

Ella no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y aporta una cuota importante en su casa, siempre ha querido crecer, su negocio es básico pero desea poner todo su empeño en convertirlo en un negocio modelo en la zona, su principal inconveniente serían su inexperiencia y la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio y ya que esta joven no posee un historial crediticio muchas entidades financieras le cierran las puertas al no tener avales de la joven, pero Interactuar es diferente, le apuesta al progreso y las capacidades de la joven, es por ello que la apoyara en su negocio.

Luisa  necesita un apoyo financiero para la compra de surtido al por mayor y mejorar el aspecto visual de su negocio. 

Tu puedes ser participe y darle un voto de confianza a esta joven que con trabajo honesto busca cambiar su realidad y construir un próspero futuro.
texts.en:
At only 19 years of age, this surprising young woman named Luisa already has her own business, a cafe which she has made into the driver of her dreams, since in this she puts her hopes for education and improvement of her quality of life.

She doesn't have any children, lives with her parents, and contributes an important amount in her home. She has always wanted to grow. Her business is basic but she wants to put all her determination into making it a model business in the zone. Her principal problem would be her inexperience and lack of capital to invest in her business and, since she is young, she doesn't have a credit history, so many financial institutions close their doors to her upon not having guarantees from the young woman. But, Interactuar is different, it wagers on the young woman's progress and capacities, and for this it will support her in her business. 

Luisa needs a loan to purchase an assortment of products in bulk and improve the visual aspect of her business.

You can participate and give a vote of confidence to this young woman who, with her honest work, seeks to change her reality and build a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of products in bulk and improve the visual aspect of her business.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Antonia, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad y está casada. 

Antonia, se dedica al comercio de marisco dese hace 7 años, este producto lo sustrae su hermano de una laguna y ella lo prepara para trasladarlo en autobus hasta el mercado central donde lo comercializa.  

Antonia, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar redes de pesca y mejorar el equipo de pesca artesanal.
texts.en:
Antonia, 29 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. She lives with her two children, ages 7 and 5, and is married.

Antonia has worked in selling seafood for the past 7 years, her brother takes these products from a lake and she prepares them to bring them by bus to the central market where she sells them.

Antonia will use the money from the loan to purchase fishing nets and to improve the traditional fishing equipment.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and improve the traditional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Santos Tulio

texts.es:
Tulio de 27 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes  principios, se dedica realizar trabajos de la agricultura actividad que realiza desde que era un niño y aprendió de su padre y sus abuelos, creció desempeñando estas actividades y a lo largo de su vida son su principal fuente de ingresos y la que le ha servido para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, que está formada por su esposa y sus 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.
  
Tulio se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño cuenta con mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre y su abuelo. En la actualidad se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, maíz y frijoles de esta forma  puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos 

Él solicita este crédito para comprar insumos  agrícolas y  un sistema de riego por goteo.

Las metas que tiene para futuro son las de tener un macro túnel para proteger sus cultivos de las plagas para también trabajar en época de verano lo cual le facilite la plantación de cultivos, también haber terminado de cancelar el crédito para adquirir un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
Tulio, 27 years old, is a person with excellent principles. He works doing agricultural jobs, work he has done since he was a boy, and learned from his father and his grandparents. He grew up doing these jobs and throughout his life, they have been his principal source of income and that which has served to satisfy the needs of his family, which is made up of his wife and 2 children, who are students in the community school.

Tulio has worked in agriculture since he was a boy and has a lot of knowledge and experience, thanks to the teachings of his father and grandfather. Currently, he works growing basic grains, corn and beans, and in this way he can satisfy his family's needs and support his children's education.  

He asks for this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and a drip irrigation system.

The goals that he has for the future are to have a macrotunnel greenhouse to protect his crops from pests and to also work in the summer, which facilitates the planting of crops, and also to finish paying off the loan to get a new loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and a drip irrigation system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to better supply her shop with products like rice, candies, beans, fizzy drinks, bread and coffee.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, aged 40, is a married woman who has five dependent children, four of whom are in school and need her support. She lives in Battambang province, where cassava, corn and paddy rice have been grown for ten years. To supplement income, she sometimes plows fields for others for a fee.

Due to a lack of finances to sustain the cassava’s growth, Mom decided to form a group of four members to request a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the second loan cycle for her. It was a great achievement for Mom, as she wisely managed her past loan to renovate her house and support her family’s basic needs as well. The loan was repaid successfully.

As the group leader, Mom will spend her loan on paying for plowing fees and purchasing cassava seeds and organic fertilizer for the farmland. She hopes to earn more income to buy more organic fertilizer so that she can enhance the cassava farming business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and purchase cassava seeds and organic fertilizer for the farmland.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
A resident who lives in Kampong Cham province, Chea is 25 years old. This married woman is blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is in school. The other one is too young to attend school.

Growing cassava has been Chea's main business for five years. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement income. She could manage to earn only 30,000 KHR per day from her cassava farming, for she could not afford to provide enough organic fertilizer to support its growth, and, consequently, it produced low outputs.

Now, Chea is requesting for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to enhance her business. She will use her entire loan to pay for farmland rental and hired workers' fees, and to purchase cassava seeds and organic fertilizers. The past loan, which was paid back completely, enabled her to support her family with sufficient foods.

Chea hopes to get more crop yields, which can be sold at a high price in the market so as to fulfill her dream of buying a hectare of farmland in two years.

loans.use: to pay for farmland rental and hired workers' fees, and to purchase cassava seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Asibi

texts.fr: Divorcé et mère de deux enfants, Asibi est une femme âgée de 43 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Asibi est une marchande des ignames qu’elle achète et revend au marché deux fois par mois. Asibi désire ce prêt pour commander des ignames afin de réaliser une épargne pour subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de ses enfants et de leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Asibi is divorced. She is 43 and has two children. She lives in Adidogomé. Asibi sells yams that she buys and resells at the market twice a month. Asibi requests this loan to order yams so that she can save up to meet her daily expenses for her children and their education.

loans.use: to buy 14 yam tubers.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will enlarge her business. she will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugar, soaps, salt and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora, está casada, vive con su esposo que se dedica a la carpintería, tiene 3 hijos, pero todos están casados.

Josefina, tiene una carpintería junto a su esposo, en donde elaboran muebles como roperos, chineros, mesas, entre otros muebles, se ha dedicado a este oficio desde hace 10 años y anteriormente se dedicaban a la herrería pero el negocio fue cayendo y por esa razón decidieron dedicarse a la carpintería, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.   

Josefina, necesita el crédito para comprar madera, pega, barniz y un formón, con este préstamo podrá comprar todas las herramientas que le hacen falta, para fabricar los muebles.

Los sueños de Josefina, son poder contar con un torno eléctrico, porque el que tiene en este momento es artesanal.
texts.en:
Josefina, 64 years old, went to school up to the second grade. She is a very enterprising and determined person, married, and lives with her husband who works in carpentry. She has three children, but they are all married. 

Josefina has a carpentry shop with her husband, where they make furniture such as wardrobes, china cabinets, tables, and other furniture. She has worked in this profession for 10 years and previously they worked as blacksmiths, but business was dropping, so they decided to work in carpentry. The business is in their home and their work schedule is from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. 

Josefina needs the loan to purchase wood, adhesive, varnish, and a chisel. With this loan she will be able to purchase all the tools that they lack to make furniture.

Josefina's dream is to have an electric lathe because the one they have now is traditional.

loans.use: to purchase wood, adhesive, varnish and a chisel.

loans.name: Sandra Agustina

texts.es:
Sandra, ella  cuenta con ningún nivel académico de tercer grado, vive junto a su tres hijos dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando su nivel básico, Su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 4 años ella realiza el comercio de marisco esto es el producto que sustrae su esposo de la laguna de Olomega también   cuenta con el negocio de una tiendita en la comunidad,

Sandra, es una persona que conoce muy bien la actividad que desempeña, que es la comercialización de marisco y tienda esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió de una amiga quien le apoyo a conocer el negocio y luego se independizo para realizarlo  como propietario con el apoyo de su esposo también realiza la pesca artesanal y producción de granos básicos. 
   
Sandra, necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, pan, café y detergentes para el mejoramiento de su tienda y para comprar trasmallo para la pesca artesanal.
texts.en:
Sandra has a third grade level of schooling, lives with her three children, two of whom are in primary school. Her husband has worked in traditional fishing for the past 4 years. She sells the shellfish, which is the product which her husband gets from Olomega Lake. She also has a small business of a store in the community. 

Sandra is a person who knows the work she does very well, which is selling shellfish and a store. She has done this work for the past 4 years and she learned it from a friend who supported her in knowing the business and later she became independent to do it as an owner with the support of her husband who also works in traditional fishing and growing basic grains. 

Sandra needs the loan to purchase rice, beans, bread, coffee and detergents to improve her store and to purchase a trammel net for traditional fishing.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, bread, coffee, and detergents to improve her store and to purchase a trammel net for traditional fishing.

loans.name: Sadiku

texts.en:
Danlami is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon Gari Daji Vilage. Danlami joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Danlami will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Danlami would like to use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Akouvi Paulette

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 26 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec un enfant à charge, Akouvi est une marchande de friperies qu’elle achète et revend au marché trois fois par mois. Akouvi demande ce crédit pour commander des corsages pour femmes. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akouvi pourra bien prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en: Akouvi is married. She is 26 and lives in Adidogomé. She has one dependent child. Akouvi sells secondhand clothing that she buys and resells at the market three times a month. Akouvi requests this loan to order bodices for women. With the profit margin that she will make, Akouvi will be able to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 45  bodices for women.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
She is a widow and a mother of five children. They all live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has been through difficult moments due to the lost of her love once and inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater for her family's needs.

With this new loan requested she will buy groundnuts, palm oil, onion, garlic, general spices, groundnut oil, shopping bags tomatoes and salt. She is optimistic that the business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, she has a good business site and she treats her customers well. With this business activity, the community will benefit from quality products, moderate price and she will contribute to development by paying her taxes.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business site, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Members also share their experiences and ideas.

loans.use: To buy groundnut oil, palm oil, onion, garlics, eggusi, njangsa, general spices, groundnuts, shopping bags, tomatoes and salt.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which deals in charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more sacks of charcoal and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase on her stock so as to attract enough customers. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire more profits from her business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to obtain charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 52-year-old divorced father of two children and a Palestinian refugee. He started twelve years ago selling coffee on his little coffee cart to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Mahmoud is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business.  Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a refrigerator and juices to satisfy his customers needs.
 
Mahmoud hopes to keep on expanding his business to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and juices to satisfy his customers needs

loans.name: Taronkei

texts.en:
Toronkei is 22 years old. He is married with one children. He has had a farming business for five years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help him buy  livestock. His hopes and dreams for the future are have a very big land and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to help him buy livestock

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita is a 49-year-old entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She has owned a small grocery store for 17 years now.

Her business consists of selling merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, beans, soda, and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income. 

Avita needs to make further investments in her store however she lacks the funds to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy additional items or merchandise to sell like rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, seasoning, milk, coffee and cooking oil. With the loan, Avita will be able to augment her stocks to attract more customers thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales for her eight-year-old dependent.
Avita hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, seasoning, milk, coffee and cooking oil

loans.name: Nohemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemy, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de corralero en una ganadería.

Nohemy, se dedica a atender en una tienda desde hace tres años, anteriormente tenia venta de tortillas y como había mucha afluencia de personas en esa zona decidió colocar la tienda, porque obtiene más ganancias y el horario de atención es de 7:00 p.m. a 6:00 a.m.

Nohemy, necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería y verduras para surtir la tienda, con esta inversión asegurar las ganancias para el sustento de su familia. 

Los sueños de Nohemy, son poder ampliar aún más el negocio y repara el techo de la casa.
texts.en:
Nohemy, 29 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade, has 2 children, ages 7 and 4, is partnered and her partner works as a ranch hand on a ranch. 

Nohemy has worked running her store for the past three years. Before, she sold tortillas and since there was a large influx of people in this zone, she decided to open a store, because she gets more earnings and the hours she works are 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. 

Nohemy needs the loan to purchase merchandise and vegetables to stock the store, with this investment she can assure the earnings to support her family.

Nohemy's dreams are to expand her business even more and to repair the roof on her house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Divorcé et mère de deux enfants, Yawa est une femme âgée de 39 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Yawa est une revendeuse de chaussures  qu’elle achète au marché trois fois par mois et les revendent de quartier en quartier. Yawa sollicite ce crédit pour avoir un stock important de chaussures de femmes et maximiser son profit afin de soutenir ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Yawa is divorced with two children. Yawa is 39 and lives in Adidogomé. She sells shoes that she buys at the market three times a month. She sells them from district to district. Yawa requests this loan to have a large stock of shoes for women and maximise her profits in order to support her children in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy 18 pairs of shoes for women.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una empresa de procesamiento de sardinas, no tiene hijos y vive con su mamá.

Sara, tiene una pequeña tienda y también de dedica a confeccionar uniformes escolares, anteriormente tenia una venta de pupusas, pero decidió dedicarse a este negocio, porque cuando termino de estudiar no encontró trabajo; su horario de atención en la tienda es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

Sara, necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, golosinas, gaseosas, pan, café y otros productos para la tienda y también para comprar tela para confeccionar los uniformes escolares.

Los sueños de Sara son, poder comprar una maquina de confeccionar uniformes más moderna, para poder facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sara, 29 years old, studied through secondary school, is partnered, her partner works in a sardine processing business, she doesn't have children, and lives with her mother.

Sara has a small store and also works sewing school uniforms. Before, she had a pupusa business, but she decided to work in this business because when she finished her schooling, she couldn't find a job. Her schedule in the store is from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

Sara needs the loan to purchase rice, beans, sweets, soft drinks, bread, coffee, and other products for the store and also to purchase fabric to sew school uniforms. 

Sara's dream is to purchase a more modern sewing machine to make uniforms, to make her work easier.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sweets, soft drinks, bread, coffee and other products for the store and also to purchase fabric to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a Babban Gona farmer from Tafki Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Sarah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably.  This season Sarah has ambitious plans to harvest 30 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Tafki now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Lucio Antonio

texts.es:
Lucio, vive únicamente con su compañera de vida, tiene 21 años de tener el mismo domicilio, en el que ido luchando por tener un mejor estilo de vida y ampliar su negocio el cual consiste en comercializar frutas, verduras y legumbres; funciona desde hace siete años y aprendió el oficio de una amiga, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde y lo realiza solo, ya es muy reconocido en la zona y los productos que ofrece son frescos.
Solicita un crédito para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres para que este más surtido su  negocio, además adquirirá carretillas para distribuir sus productos en otros sectores y así tener más ganancias y nuevos clientes, la finalidad de la inversión es adquirir producto al por mayor y ampliar su negocio para que su estilo de vida familiar cambie.
Sus aspiraciones son sacar el máximo provecho del crédito para mantener su negocio en el mercado y minimizar las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Lucio lives with his life partner at the same home where he has been for 21 years. There he has been fighting to have a better lifestyle and to grow his business which consists of selling fruit, vegetables and legumes. It has been up and running for seven years and he learned the trade from a friend. His work schedule runs from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon and he does it alone. He is already very well known in the area and the products which he offers are fresh.
He is asking for a loan to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes so that his business is well stocked, as well as to buy carts to distribute his products in other areas and thereby have more profits and new customers. The aim of the investment is to buy wholesale products and grow his business so that his family's lifestyle changes. His aspirations are to get as much benefit as possible from the loan to maintain his business in the market and to minimize his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes so that his business is well stocked, as well as to buy carts to distribute his products in other areas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past 15 years, Maria has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which trades hardware materials. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain iron sheets and cement for the shop and will help Maria to generate greater profits and increase her capital stock. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to start working from her own premises. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maria who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to obtain iron sheets and cement for her shop,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and they have 3 children. 

She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for 10 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon. 

She will use profits from the business to do home repairs.  

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her salon to make it bring enough income

loans.use: to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for her beauty salon

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 58 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She also supports other two adults. She will use the loan buy chicken feeds, cattle feeds and pesticides and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce such as eggs and milk for sell to generate more income. Her hopes and dreams in future are to expand her farming business, make more income and be able to feed the family members as well as pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds, cattle feeds and pesticides and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce such as eggs and milk for sell.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita has owned and operated her variety store since 1983. With her patience and hard work, she has been able to improve it.

She plans to increase the stock of grocery items, glassware and kitchen utensils she offers. To make that possible, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos. This investment will keep her variety store profitable and a stable source of income for her family. 

Norlita hopes for continuous access to financial services from lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of grocery items, glassware and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Lewis

texts.en:
Lewis is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be dynamic. He operates a retail business where he sell flasks, plastic containers and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers and flasks. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of plastic containers and flasks

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and mother in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Karen works at the private workshop, but he is also seriously engaged in farming. Karen has a lot of cows and with the help of his mother, he sells great amount of milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd and also meat. Karen likes his cattle care very much and as he says he has plans of farm enlargement also so in near future he may start swine breeding as well.  

With this loan amount, he wants to buy enough fodder for his farm cattle, to keep them fed in order not to have lack of dairy-products.

loans.use: to buy enough fodder for his farm cattle, to keep them fed, in order not to have lack of dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan se mantiene trabajando en su venta de cocos y estableció mejor la venta de hielo, lo cual es posible a la buena administración del crédito anterior y las ganancias, su familia se mantiene.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar cocos, una hielera y reparar el carretón, tendrá materia prima para su negocio y el equipo para realizar sus actividades, espera que sus clientes continúen visitando su negocio para tener siempre ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan supports himself by working selling coconuts and started to sell ice, which is possible due to good management of the previous loan and the earnings. His family supports itself. 

He asks for another loan to purchase coconuts, a freezer and to repair his cart. He will have the raw materials for his business and the equipment to do his work. He hopes that his customers continue coming to his business to always have income.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts, a freezer and to repair his cart, he will have the raw materials for his business and the equipment to do his work.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дильбар, 55 лет, вдова, имеет 5 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем младших классов. Также на протяжении 14 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Дильбар успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса. В хозяйстве есть 20 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 26,000 сом (KGS). Дильбар очень приветливая и веселая, а также очень добрая и общительная. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли Дильбар обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На доходы от кредита Дильбар хочет и дальше развивать бизнес и накопить на свадьбу ее дочерей.
texts.en: Dilbar is 55 years old, a widow, and has five children. She has a higher education and works as a teacher of elementary grades. She has also been rearing animals for the last 14 years. Thanks to her tireless work and patience, Dilbar has successfully grown her small business. She has 20 sheep on her farm. Her gross monthly income is about 26,000 som (KGS). Dilbar is very friendly and cheerful, and also very kind and sociable. In order to develop her business further and increase her profits, Dilbar has applied to Bai Tushum Bank fo ra loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock. Dilbar wants to further develop her business using the proceeds of the loan, and also to save up for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José vive con su esposa y un hijo menor de edad, en ocasiones recibe ayuda económica de parientes, es propietario de un taller automotriz, trabaja en un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, paga alquiler por el local y una de sus ventajas es que realiza trabajos a domicilio.
Cree que debe atender mucho mejor a sus clientes por lo que solicita un crédito complementar la compra de un vehículo en el que se trasladará con todo el equipo necesario para realizar sus trabajos en menor tiempo y tener clientes satisfechos.
Sus sueños son comprar un terreno en el que piensa construir un local propio y tener mejores utilidades para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and his child who is a minor. Sometimes he gets economic help from relatives. He is the owner of a auto mechanic shop, and works on a schedule of eight in the morning to five in the afternoon. He pays rent for the space and one of its advantages is that he does work at people's homes.

He believes that he should serve his customers much better, so he asks for a loan to combine with his savings to purchase a vehicle in which he will go with all the equipment needed to do his work in less time and have satisfied customers. 

His dream is to purchase land on which he plans to build his own shop and have better profits to meet his obligations.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle in which he will travel with all the equipment he needs to do his work in less time.

loans.name: Saídu

texts.en:
Saídu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maiyashi Village. Saídu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saídu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Saídu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase hiss yields

loans.name: Kpanmanga  - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Ayi is a 40-year-old hard working woman from Tamalgu in the Northern region of Ghana. Ayi is married and has 5 children with 2 of the children attending school. Ayi is the individual pictured with both hands raised high among the members squatting.

Ayi is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the past 5 years. The name of the group is ‘Kpanmanga - Tamalgu’. Ayi earns a good profit from the business as the group had been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing techniques such that they will always produce premium quality for the home (Ghanaian) markets and for export.

Ayi and ‘Kpanmanga - Tamalgu have asked for a loan of GHS 12,100.00 after they successfully paid off their previous loan of GHC 8,800.00. Ayi’s share of the loan is GHS 400.00 which would be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Ayi aspires to earn more income to expand her business as well as to payback this loan and support her family.

Ayi is greatly thankful to her lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Warner

texts.es: Warner se dedica a la venta de perfumes y productos de uso personal, esto lo realiza desde su propia tienda. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), dinero que usará para la compra de más productos que le permitirán aumentar su volumen de existencias y expandirse en este mercado .
texts.en: Warner works selling perfumes and personal products, which he does in his own store. He asks for a loan of one million colones (₡1,000,000), money which he will use to purchase more products which will allow him to increase the volume of his stock and expand in this market.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
For two years now, Eugenia raises and sells pigs. She is forty-seven year old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Three of her children are still attending school ages 18, 14 and 12 year old respectively. 
In addition to that, she also sells root crops like camote(sweet potato), ubi( purple yam) and gabi (taro).

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and  purchase root crops. These will help Eugenia improve the way she raises hogs. With these, she could raises quality pigs after few months to come. Thus, she could able to purchase assorted root crops to sell also. Thus, her income will improve and able to handle her finances.She could able to feed her children with nutritious diets and better shelter to live.

In the future, she  dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pigs and purchase root crops

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. She started, almost a year ago,selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Rana is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of fashionable summer clothes to satisfy her customers' requests.

Rana hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of fashionable summer clothes

loans.name: Narlys María

texts.es: Narlys es una comerciante residente en el municipio de Galapa, ella cuenta con tres años de experiencia en esta actividad que le ha permitido aportar a los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Ella se inició en el comercio, cuando le colaboraba a su hermana ayudándole a vender productos de la oferta  de una revista, así palpo los beneficios que se obtenían y decidió incorporarse a este sistema de distribución comercial.  Hoy en día su base de clientes está consolidada y todos los días realiza visitas a diferentes clientes, a quienes les presenta el nuevo catálogo y realiza sus pedidos, sin embargo ella necesita promover más ventas y abrirse a nuevos mercados, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará artículos para el hogar, perfumes, cremas y demás encargos de sus clientes.  Con esta inversión surtirá su negocio y podrá ofrecer más variedad.  Su meta a futuro es aperturar una miscelánea y realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Narlys is a businesswoman who lives in the municipality of Galapa. She has three years of experience in this work, which has allowed her to contribute to the household expenses and improve her quality of life. She began in sales when she cooperated with her sister, helping her to sell products from catalogs. In this way, she felt the benefits that they got and decided to join this system of commercial distribution. These days, her customer base is strong and every day she visits different customers, to whom she shows the new catalog and they make their orders. However, she needs to promote her sales more and open new markets, so she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will purchase household goods, perfumes, creams, and other orders for her customers. With this investment, she will stock her business and offer more variety. Her goal for the future is to open a general store and fix up her house.

loans.use: to purchase household goods, perfumes, creams, and other orders for her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family well being. 

This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es: Carmen de 22 años es una confeccionista de ropa que aprendió este arte de la mano de su madre quien se ha dedicado por años a esta actividad; su curiosidad en conocer el proceso de fabricación de blusas, pantalones y demás prendas de vestir, le permitió tener sus primeras bases y técnicas para a futuro convertirse en una experta de la costura. Cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento en su taller ubicado en su residencia en el municipio de Barranquilla, lugar en donde se consolida gran parte de su clientela.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar telas y accesorios para sus diseños, puesto que esta inversión incrementara su producción y con ello sus utilidades.  Carmen es madre de una niña de dos años a quien en compañía de su cónyuge ofrecen bienestar con el fruto de su labor. Su meta a futuro es que sus ventas aumenten, para así empezar a ahorrar para la cuota inicial de un apartamento.
texts.en: Carmen, 22 years old, sews clothing and she learned this art at the hand of her mother who has worked in this job for years. Her curiosity to know the process of making blouses, pants, and other clothing, allowed her to have her first bases and techniques to become an expert in sewing in the future. She has been running her shop for two years, located in her home in the municipality of Barranquilla, a place where most of her customer base is located. Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase fabric and accessories for her designs, since this investment will increase her production and, with it, her profits. Carmen is the mother of a 2-year-old girl to whom, with her spouse, she offer well-being with the fruits of their labor. Her goal for the future is that her sales increase to begin to save for the down payment on an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and accessories for her designs.

loans.name: Marta Damaris

texts.es:
Marta, por los buenos resultados que tiene de los créditos se ha decidido por uno nuevo, para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá realizar sus cultivos de granos básicos en la próxima de temporada de siembra.
Actualmente continúa desarrollando sus actividades agrícolas y la crianza de cerdos sin ninguna dificultad, mismas que ha fortalecido con el crédito anterior, su familia ha crecido y tienen estabilidad financiera.
texts.en:
Due to the good results that Marta has from the loans, she has decided on a new one. She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to be able to grow basic grains in the next planting season.

She now continues to engage in her agricultural activities and raising pigs without any difficulties. She has strengthened these business activities with the previous loan, her family has grown, and they have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to be able to grow basic grains during the next planting season.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is married and she has two children. She has a kiosk in her home and she also sells in the market. If there is a market day then she will sell in the market, but if there is no market today then she sells at her house. She also sells shoes. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy slippers, mirrors, women's wallets, children's toys, shoes and other things to sell. She started her business in 2012 with her own working capital of 500 USD. She also raises animals like buffalo, pigs, chickens, dogs and goats.

loans.use: to buy slippers, mirrors, women's wallets, children's toys, shoes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 24-year-old woman from TulKarm City, in the west bank, which is a difficult place to live due to the economic bad conditions.  She is single and lives with his family in a small house.

She wants to improve himself and be an entrepreneur and his business idea is to sell cosmetics and accessories for ladies. 

Hanadi took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start her own business. She hopes that, by taking this loan, Hanadi will be able to improve her family's conditions. Hanadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start her own business.

loans.name: Inshozamihigo Group

texts.en:
Sylvie is a 33-years-old and is married with five children. She was elected leader Inshozamihigo Group and highlighted in the group photo on the left side holding a small piece of paper. Sylvie works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. Every morning Sylvie opens her shop at 8 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Like many general stores in Rwanda, she sells produce, salt, soap, soft drinks, water, etc. She has operated her general store for the past year and has already seen an increase in goods sold.  

As her business continues to grow, she is hoping to expand her offerings to attract new clients. With a loan from Vision Finance Company, funded through Kiva, Sylvie wants to purchase different items like: sugar, rice, cooking oil, honey, etc. to sell to the community. With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family and reinvest in her business to continue the expansion of inventory and offerings.

loans.use: To expand the offerings at her community general store.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en:
Renie has owned a motorcycle transport business since 1991. He is married to an overseas Filipino worker and has two children.

Renie doesn't want to depend on his wife's remittances. That's why he is doing his best to sustain his family needs. He and his wife work together to improve their way of life and give their children a higher level of education. 

Renie would like to take out a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos. That would enable him to buy new tires, a chain and a change of oil for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a chain and an oil change for his motorcycle

loans.name: Narn

texts.en:
Narn is a 30-year-old widow with 4 children who lives in Kampong Cham province. She has  grown cassava for twelve years. She also grows rice to earn supplemental income. These two businesses earn about 40,000 KHR. She did not earn a good income from her cassava crop because the price declined. 

Narn has borrowed from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) eight times and successfully repaid previous loans. The past loan enabled her to improve her family’s living condition. She is applying for a new loan to pay the plowing fee and purchase cassava seeds, organic pesticide, and organic fertilizer. 

Narn wants to expand the business, send her children to school, and upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and purchase cassava seeds, organic pesticide, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un ganadero, que tiene su propio negocio desde  hace ya 30 años, su padre le ayudo aprender a desarrollar dicha actividad, tiene un horario de trabajo de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde y lo realiza solo, su ventaja es que ya tiene popularidad en la zona. Pedro, es soltero vive actualmente en compañía de una sobrina.
Comprará ganado, concentrado y zacate picado, necesita tener alimento suficiente para engordarlos y facilitar su venta, espera que su clientela aumente así como también sus ingresos, confía que su ganado este sano por lo que resta del año.
Sus sueños son diversificar las clases de animales que cría para tener un negocio más competitivo, cancelar su deuda y cambiar su estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Pedro raises livestock, and he has had his own business for 30 years. His father helped him to learn how to engage in this business activity. His work schedule is from six in the morning until five in the afternoon. He works alone. The advantage is that his business is popular in the area.

Pedro is single, and he now lives with a niece.

He will buy livestock, concentrated feed, and shredded fodder. He needs to have enough feed to fatten them and to facilitate their sale. He hopes that he gets more customers and more income. He expects his livestock to be healthy for the rest of the year.

His dreams are to diversify the types of animals that he raises in order to have a more competitive business, to repay the debt, and to change his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy livestock, concentrated feed, and shredded fodder because he needs to have enough feed to fatten them and facilitate their sale.

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.en:
Sulmira is a woman who is very interested in business, even though she is married and has three children. She is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible for the household. Where there is a market day, she carries her belongings and wares to sell. 

Sulmira opened her business in 2007 with a capital base of $1,200. She also keep animals at her place, such as pigs, chickens and dogs.

Now she requests a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital. She will use the loan to buy more goods, such as slippers, toy cars, combs and hats to sell. 

Sulmira plans to open a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy slippers, toy cars, combs, hats and other things to sell.

loans.name: Giorghino Felix

texts.es: Giorghino tiene 21 años de edad es soltero. El es un joven estudiante dedicado a sus estudios profesionales de tecnología ambiental.  El se encuentra contento por que ya solo le falta un año y medio para lograrse como profesional ya que es  una de las metas más importantes de su vida. Su mayor deseo es trabajar en una CIA Minera. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de las pensiones de sus estudios. Giorghino agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Giorghino, age 21, is single. He is studying environmental technology. He is happy because he only needs one and a half more years to become a professional, which is one of his most important goals in life. His biggest wish is to work at a CIA Minera.

He will use the loan to pay for room and board. Giorghino is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that was provided.

loans.use: to pay for room and board while going to school.

loans.name: Maysoun

texts.en:
Maysoun is a 24-year-old  single accountant who has worked in a reputable company since June 2014. She is a hard worker interested in developing her career and supporting her family.

Maysoun is the primary financial supporter to her family but  her limited monthly salary prevents her from achieving future plans.
Maysoun cares a lot about her family's education and works hard to make sure they receive an education to obtain  better working opportunities. 

Maysoun requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her younger sister's school education fees.

This is Maysoun's second experience as Al Majmoua borrower, she has repaid previous loans.  She bought  a car with her previous loan.

She hopes to start her own business.

loans.use: to pay for he sister's education fees.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is the owner of a sari-sari (variety store) from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 18, her youngest is 12 years old. Her husband is a carpenter who works hard to provide for the family's needs. 

Analiza has been in the sari-sari business for 18 years. She is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items, such coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, bath soap, spices, soft drinks and canned goods. 

In the future, she wishes to improve her business to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy coffee, powdered chocolate drink, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, bath soap, spices, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 29-year-old  married woman with one school-aged child.

 She manages a store and would like to increase her earnings.  She will use the loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks. This will help increase her earnings and profits.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con su familia. 

Hace aproximadamente 15 años inició la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Jairo busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Jairo tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Jairo!
texts.en:
Jairo is a person who has had to experience many adversities in his life, however he has always had the strength to overcome time and to get ahead with his family.

Approximately 15 years ago, he began searching for a source of income for his household. It was in this way that he began to raise and sell chickens, a business that has generated earnings with which he can support the household expenses.

Jairo looks for a loan that offers him the possibility of purchasing concentrated chicken feed and fix up the chicken corral. He knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar, he can manage it.

Jairo has the hope that the loan will let him get ahead with his business. 

In addition, he hopes that his business grows and generates more income with which he can offer his children a better quality of life and more opportunities for progress.

With the loan that you make today, you can improve Jairo's life and business!

loans.use: to purchase concentrated chicken feed and fix up the chicken corral. He knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar he can manage it.

loans.name: Rozante

texts.en:
Rozante is 36 years old, married, and has two children (an infant and one school-aged child). 

Rozante learned about how the financial services of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative extend to farmers like him. With the burning desire to fully finance his own farm, he signed up for membership and availed loan products and other services. Recently, he requested a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. He believes that having enough inventory of fertilizer will ensure him a good yield.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Tibisay Ines

texts.es:
Una luchadora, toda una guerrera así es Tibisay, una empresaria de 31 años de edad que se dedica atender la típica farmacia del pueblo, un negocio que decidió montar por necesidad económica ya que su pareja no generaba los ingresos suficientes para el mantenimiento de su hogar que lo terminan de completar dos bebes de 2 años y 8 meses de edad.

La principal ventaja de Tibisay es que no tiene competencia, pero a la vez tiene una enorme responsabilidad de tener abierto el negocio el mayor tiempo posible para ofrecer un medicamento a cualquier cliente que lo necesite.

Las principales dificultades que atraviesa la empresaria es la inseguridad en la zona, posibles robos o pago de cuotas para operar, son algunos de los inconvenientes a los que se debe enfrentar.

La sostenibilidad el negocio es en el momento lo más importante, una vez consolidada y con un buen flujo de ventas Tibisay le gustaría expandirse pero primero quiere consolidarse por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de inventario de analgésicos, pastillas, jarabes y productos capilares.

Este préstamo ayudara a consolidar el negocio de una  empresaria que tiene como misión el cumplimiento de dos sueños, pagar la educación de los hijos y comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Tibisay is an enterprising, tenacious woman, 31 years old, who keeps the typical small-town drugstore. She started this business out of financial need since her partner was not generating enough income to support the household, which includes two children aged two years and eight months.

In her business, Tibisay's main advantage is that she has no competition, but at the same time she has the great responsibility of keeping her store open as much as possible to make medications available to her customers who may need them. The main difficulties include the lack of security in the area, the possibility of theft or payment of fees for operating the store, these are some of the inconveniences she has to face.

Most important at the moment is to ensure the stability of the business. Once it is running efficiently and with steady sales, Tibisay would like to expand, but first she must consolidate. Therefore she is asking for the loan to buy a stock of analgesics, tablets, syrups, and hair products.

This loan will help consolidate the business of a small entrepreneur whose goal is to achieve two dreams: pay for her children's education and buy a home.

loans.use: to stock her drugstore with various products.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Al hablar de Carlos no se puede evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Carlos no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar un negocio de ganado para complementar sus actividad ya que encontraba mucho tiempo muerto y si hay algo que caracteriza a un agricultor es que no puede estar, quieto tiene que estar trabajando constantemente y es por esta razón que el señor Carlos solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales para la canalización de sus cultivos, comprar de leche e insumos como abonos y riegos.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
When speaking of Carlos, it can't be avoided noting that he is a farmer from birth, raised and educated with the lovely rural values such as humility and work, being these two the most representative of Colombian farmers. 

Carlos doesn't settle with the income that he gets as a farmer and decided to establish a livestock business to complement his work since he had a lot of down time and if something characterizes a farmer is that he can't be quiet, he has to be continually working and for this reason, Carlos asks for a loan to purchase materials he needs to channel his crops, purchase milk and supplies such as manure and to pay for irrigation.

His dream is that God grants him health to work tirelessly and to be able to generate good income.

loans.use: to purchase materials to channel his crops, to purchase milk, and supplies such as manure and paying for irrigation.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan con 24 años de edad es soltero. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee unos pequeños cultivos de café, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Juan es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 24 years old, is single. He was raised his whole life in the countryside, where he has done agricultural work the larger part of his life.  

Currently he has some small coffee crops, so he manages to have sufficient resources to bring daily sustenance to his home.

Juan is a serious, responsible man, committed to his family and his work, so he always wants to continue advancing in search of a better future. For this reason, he asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pesticides with the end of continuing with the care of his crops and to be able to get a harvest in optimal conditions.
