All of this will help him to get ahead, improving his standard of living, little by little.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and pesticides with the end of continuing to care for his crops.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita has run a sari-sari store business for 21 years. She is married, has 2 sons @1 and 18) and is from Calape, Bohol.  

She works hard to provide the needs of her children and send them to school. Bernardita  requests 15,000 PHP to buy rice and soft drinks. 

In the future, she wishes to improve her business and have a better living.

loans.use: to buy  rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nando

texts.es:
Nando es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, dedicado a la cría cuidado y venta de ganado, un negocio que con mucho esfuerzo logro montar desde hace poco.

Con el propósito de agrandar sus corrales, Nando solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los materiales que esta ampliación necesita como lo son las tablas, tubos y techos.

Su meta es continuar trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, pues debido las fuertes lluvias esta se ha ido deteriorando mucho.

Apoya a Nando con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Nando is a friendly, helpful and very enterprising man, dedicated to raising, caring for, and selling livestock, a business that he managed to establish recently with a lot of effort.

With the goal of expanding his corrals, Nando is asking for a loan to be able to purchase the materials that this expansion requires such as lumber, pipes, and roofing.

His goal is to continue working to improve the conditions of his house since, due to the heavy rains, it has been deteriorating a lot.

Support Nando with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase materials that he needs for the expansion such as lumber, pipes and roofing.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan es un campesino muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de café que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposa por la cual ha tratado de luchar siempre.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos, por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de café, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible.
texts.en:
Juan is a very skilled rural person with experience in various areas of agriculture, with an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind. 

He has a coffee crop which he cares for every day from the very early hours in the morning. 

Currently, he lives with his wife for whom he has always tried to struggle. 

He wants to give a boost to his crop and to get more income, so he asks for a loan to invest it in agricultural supplies such as pesticides, manure, and coffee seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to have a better-quality product.

His greatest dream is to be able to improve the condition of his house and to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as pesticides, manure, and coffee seeds; the loan will give him the opportunity of having a better-quality product.

loans.name: Vatha's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Battambang province, Vatha is 53 years old and a mother of five dependent children. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. She also works for others, for a fee, to supplement her income. 

At one time, Vatha did not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her farming, so her rice did not grow well. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. With the previous loan, she was able to increase her income from her farming and upgrade her farm. 

Vatha leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and organic pesticides to support her rice farm and produce a good yield. She hopes that her rice yield improves and earns her more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and organic pesticides to support her rice farm and produce a good yield.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 42 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de caña de azúcar, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el municipio de Valencia, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y su hijo.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de José Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
José is a humble and hardworking 42 year old farmer. Since the time he was little, he learned everything about farm work, thanks to his father's teachings. 

Right now, he has sugar cane crops. They are harvested and sold in the town of Valencia. This generates enough income to support his home and cover the basic needs of his wife and child. 

He is motivated to ask for the loan in order to invest it in buying agricultural materials wholesale (compost, pesticide, fertilizer). This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and improve the yield of his next harvest. This will benefit his income he receives from each sale. 

José states that his biggest wish is to keep fighting to generate financial stability and offer his family better living conditions and more well being. 

José will be able to support himself and get ahead with your help!!

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials wholesale (compost, pesticide, fertilizer).

loans.name: Antonio Maria

texts.es:
Antonio es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo plátano en el municipio de Los Córdobas.

 Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de plátano.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a humble and hard-working farmer. He has the drive and the tenacity that distinguishes men women from the countryside. He is a man with an enterprising mind. When he was very little he learned all of the country jobs like growing crops and raising animals. He now has his own banana crop in the Los Córdobas municipality.

His plan is to increase his crops and to improve those that he now has. That is why he turns to the help of a loan from the Interactuar Corporation. He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, compost, and banana seeds. The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as a businessman and as a person. It will also increase his earnings and continue contributing to the support of his household. The only things that he wants is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, compost, and banana seeds.

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en:
Net, 29, is the mother of two children, one attends school. She resides in a rural area of Kampong Cham province and has grown rice  for eight years. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Pests, drought, and insufficient fertilizer resulted in a poor rice crop. 

She leads a four-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to save her endangered farming business. Net will use her some of loan to paying the plowing fee, buy rice seeds, and organic fertilizer ,and provide healthcare to her child. 

She hopes to improve the family’s living conditions and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer and provide healthcare.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Eder Alfonso

texts.es:
Eder encuentra en sus pollos esa oportunidad que siempre ha soñado de poder pagar una educación de calidad para su hija y tener el sustento diario para sobrevivir.

Hoy en día se siente muy orgulloso de lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora gracias a su dedicación, esfuerzo y trabajo duro.

Solicita un crédito para compra de pollos, alimentos, vitaminas y vacunas para sus animales, esto le permitirá tener unos animales mejor alimentados y de mejor calidad.

Es una actividad realizada con todo el cariño y empeño que solo un padre puede tener.
texts.en:
Eder finds with his chickens and opportunity that he has always dreamed of- being able to pay for a quality education for his daughter and have daily support to live.

Today he feels very proud of what he has been able to build so far, thanks to his dedication, effort and hard work. 

He is asking for a loan to buy chickens, feed, vitamins and vaccines for his animals. This will allow him to have some animals that are better fed and of better quality.

This is an activity he does with all of the affection and hard work that only a father can have.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, vitamins and vaccines for his animals.

loans.name: Gabriel Maria

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre muy dedicado a su familia, trabajador y humilde. Que desde hace 5 meses se dedica al cultivo de frutas, un medio por el que ha logrado salir de una crisis económica bastante fuerte.
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes, insecticidas y agroquímicos.

Su deseo es tener una empresa familiar, la cual en un futuro sea de sus nietos.

Como Gabriel, miles de empresarios esperan de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a man who is very dedicated to his family, is hard-working and humble. For the past 5 months he has worked growing fruits, a means with which he has managed to get out of a rather bad economic crisis.

He works every day for 6 hours.

He asks for a loan to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, and agrochemicals.

His desire is to have a family business, which in the future would be his grandchildren's.

Like Gabriel, thousands of businessmen await your help. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn is a 33-year-old  married woman with two dependent children, one attends school. She has grown cassava  for fifteen years. In addition, she grows rice and works for a fee to supplement her income. 

The cassavas are growing in farmland which is full of weeds and pests. These negatively affects the yield. She leads a two-member group to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Previous loans enabled her to meet thee family’s daily expense, improve business, and  send her children to school. 

Orn will use her loan  to purchase cassava seeds, organic pesticides, and organic fertilizer. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her family’s living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase cassava seeds, organic pesticides, and organic fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina lives in Atsabe and is married with 3 children. She began selling in 2000 using her own working capital of $ 1,000.00. 

She requests a loan of $ 1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more cows.  She was very happy with the loan that offered by the Tuba Rai Metin, because she could use this loan to improve her management skills.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom is a 37-year-old woman with 4 children (1 attends school), who resides in Kampong Cham province. She grows cassava on five hectares  to earn the  family’s income; she has done this job for years. Her harvest was lower-than-expected. 

She leads a two-member group to apply for a new loan. This is her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Previous loans were successfully  repaid and enabled her to improve the family's  living. Khom will use her loan to pay workers fees, purchase organic pesticide, and organic fertilizer. 

She hopes to sell her crop at higher prices so that she can start a new cashew business.

loans.use: to pay workers fees, purchase organic pesticide, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aurora May

texts.en: Aurora is a 25-year-old woman with a young child. She sells different food products and is very patient selling her merchandise. She wants to earn a good profit and asks for 5,000 PHP to buy hot dogs, pork, and chicken to sell. She hopes to continue improving her sales and someday develop her business.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, pork, and chicken.

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo, con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha mejorado un poco la productividad de sus cultivos, tiene estabilidad económica la cual le ha permitido pagar su deuda y tener mejores calidad de vida.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en semilla, fertilizantes y abono, para sembrar maíz, espera aprovechar a comprar todo a bajos precios y tiene la esperanza que la cosecha sea de calidad.
texts.en:
Ricardo, with the help of the previous loan, has improved his crops' productivity a bit. He has economic stability which has allowed him to pay off his debt and have a better quality of life.

He needs another loan to be able to invest it in seeds, fertilizers, and manure, to plant corn. He hopes to take advantage of purchasing it all at low prices and his hope is that the harvest will be of quality.

loans.use: to invest in seeds, fertilizer and manure to plant corn.

loans.name: Rosalba Elizabeth

texts.es:
A sus 54 años, luego de pasar por una difícil situación económica, la cual dejo su esposo al abandonar el hogar, la señora Rosalba logro montar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda la cual situó en la sala de la casa donde reside, un medio por el cual logro salir adelante junto con sus tres hijos.
Su deseo es abrir su primer negocio y llegar a generar empleo a las personas más necesitadas.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara un enfriador y surtido como lo son los productos de la canasta familiar y de aseo personal.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprarse una vivienda propia.

Como Rosalba miles de empresarios esperan de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
At 54 years old, after going through a difficult economic situation, which her husband left behind when he left the home, Rosalba managed to establish her own business, a small store which is located in the living room of the house where she lives, a means with which she manged to get ahead with her three children.

Her desire is to open her first business and be able to generate jobs for the people who most need them.

She works every day for 8 hours.

She is asking for a loan with which she will purchase a cooler and supplies such as basic pantry items and personal care products. 

Her goal is to continue working until she realizes her dream of buying her own house.

Like Rosalba, thousands of businesswomen await your help. Come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler and supplies such as basic pantry items and personal care products.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es:
Abel es un hombre con mucha experiencia en el campo. 

Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Abel is a man with a lot of experience in agricultural. He is a humble and simple man. He has a great gift and enough energy to grow any type of crop.   

He has a plantain crop which he works with every day to sell his harvests in the marketplace of Valencia.

Thanks to his years of experience and the teachings of his father when he was a child, he has a lot of capacity to work and assist other farmers in the area who need help with their crops.

He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, plantain seeds and pesticide. This way, he will inject capital into his activity and improve his crops in a significant way, facing the biggest difficulty he has, which is the variable weather that affects his harvest.
 
He has a lot of faith in his business and a lot of hope from the supportive people who help the hardworking farmers of Colombia, like Corporación Interactuar.

Support a humble farmer so that he can get his crops ahead with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, plantain seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Mercedes Candelaria

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 58 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos, no estudio porque en ese tiempo no había posibilidades económicas para ir a la escuela y su esposo es agricultor. 

Mercedes, trabaja la agricultura desde muy joven, siembra y vende la cosecha.

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y abono para los cultivos.

Sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan superarse y tengan las oportunidades que ella no tuvo.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 58 years old, is married, has three children, and didn't go to school because at that time, there wasn't any economic possibility to go to school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Mercedes has worked in agriculture since she was very young, she plants and sells the harvest.

The money from the loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and manure for the crops.

She dreams of her children finishing their education and being able to improve themselves and have opportunities that she didn't have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Thary's Group

texts.en:
Thary is a 35-year-old farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two young children. She has grown rice for years and also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

She is applying for her first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and is the leader of a two-member group.  She will use her loan to buy a  pumping machine to supply water to her crops. She hopes to earn more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre campesino de 61 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee cultivos de café, cultivos que atiende todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en el municipio de Los Córdobas, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de su familia. 

Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar, comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros, con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos logrando tener una mejor cosecha, más productiva y así mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos.

Luis, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is a rural man, 61 years old, hard-working and humble who, since childhood, learned to do all the work of the countryside, thanks to his parents' instruction.

This has allowed him to progress and today he has coffee crops, crops which he cares for every day and the harvests are sold in the municipality of Los Córdobas. In addition, he works as a day laborer on different farms in the area, since with that he complements his income with that which he cares for his family's well-being.

With the support of the requested loan from Corporación Interactuar, he will purchase agricultural supplies in bulk such as manure, pesticides, fertilizers, and more. With this, he will continue caring for his crops, managing to have a better harvest, more productivity and, so, to increase his income at the time of selling his products. 

Luis, with his enterprising spirit, drive, and tenacity, wants to continue struggling to realize his dream of improving the condition of his house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies in bulk such as manure, pesticides, fertilizers and more.

loans.name: Rosa Dinora

texts.es:
Rosa, de 46 años de edad, creció con su abuela, estudio hasta tercer grado, se casó cuando tenía 24 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a los cultivos de hortalizas, sus hijos están estudiando.

Rosa, tiene un molino desde hace 4 años, lo adquirió gracias al esfuerzo de esposo, que mediante la agricultura y la siembra de hortalizas ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su familia; el molino lo atiende todos los días por la mañana y parte de la tarde de lunes a domingos y cuando cosechan hortalizas ella sale a venderlas en la ciudad, las hortalizas que principalmente siembran son pepino y ejotes.

Rosa, está solicitando el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para las hortalizas, de esa manera podrá seguir con sus negocios y otra parte del dinero lo necesita para hacer una nueva instalación en el molino, porque se acerca el invierno y el techo está un poco dañado.

El sueño de Rosa, es hacer una vivienda con techo más resistente, porque la que tiene actualmente es de lámina y bahareque y poder hacer una galera para poder tener más seguro el molino.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46 years old, grew up with her grandmother, went to school up to the third grade, got married when she was 24 years old, and her husband works in agriculture and growing vegetables. Her children are students.

Rosa has had a mill for the past 4 years. She got it thanks to her husband's efforts, who through agriculture and planting vegetables, has managed to get ahead and help his family. She works the mill every day in the morning and part of the afternoon from Monday to Sunday and when they harvest vegetables, she goes out to sell them in the city. The vegetables they grow are primarily cucumbers and green beans.

Rosa is asking for the loan to purchase manure, pesticides and herbicides for the vegetables. In this way, she will be able to continue with her businesses and another part of the money she needs to make a new shelter for the mill because winter is coming and the roof is a bit damaged.

Rosa's dream is to have a house with a much stronger roof, because the one she has now is made of metal sheeting and bamboo, and to be a able to build a shelter to have her mill more secure.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, and herbicides for her vegetables.

loans.name: Zhamiylahon

texts.ru: Жамийлахон, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, она очень оптимистичный и трудолюбивый человек. В качестве дополнительного дохода Жамийлахон на протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 3 коровы. Также есть 1,64 ГА поливной земли, где Жамийлахон выращивает малину и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль в хороший сезон составляет до 12,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 8 овец. Доходы от кредита Жамийлахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить на высшее образование ее сына.
texts.en:
Zhamiylahon is 42 and married with two children. She has a high school education and is a very optimistic and hardworking person who has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for five years as an additional source of income for her family. Thanks to her constant effort, she currently has three cows on her farm as well as 1.64 hectares of land where she grows raspberries and corn for her own use and for sale. Her monthly income in a good season is up to 12,600 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhamiylahon has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by purchasing eight sheep. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock, so she can save toward her son's university education.

loans.use: to buy eight sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Lali

texts.ru: Лали, 46 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. Лали в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы. Также имеется плодоносящий сад. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лали обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Лали планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и свадьбы дочерей.
texts.en: Lali is 46 years old, married, and has four children. Lali rears animals as the main income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today she has two cows. She also has a fertile garden. Her monthly income averages 19,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Lali has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock for fattening and resale. Lali plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and her daughters' weddings.

loans.use: to buy some livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools such as a polishing machine and an electric planer.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil, 53, is married, has adult children and lives in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is a farmer, carpenter and hog breeder. 

Gil is also a hardworking father and dedicated family provider. He sent all of his children to school until they finished college and got comfortable jobs. 

Now that he has been successful with his children, he wants to live comfortably in a decent home. He is applying for a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He is asking for 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase bags of cement and sand and to pay for labour.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and sand and to pay for labour

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es madre de 8. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años. 

Ella aprendió este negocio a traves de su madre. Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos de frutas. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos. 

Marina sueña con tener un negocio más sostenible. 

¡Impacte la vida de Marina y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Marina is the mother of 8. Apart from her family, she has worked in agriculture for 15 years. 

She learned this business from her mother. She and her family live in a rural zone in Colombia where it is not easy to have access to financial services such as those that Interactuar contributes.

Her loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, pest control products, and manure to be able to prepare her fruit crops.

Thanks to this loan, the family economy and quality of life will improve since she will be able to increase her income.

Marina dreams of having a more sustainable business. 

Impact Marina and her family's life with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, pest control products, and manure to be able to prepare her fruit crops.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está soltero, vive con un hijo de 23 años de edad, porque los demás hijos ya se casaron o se acompañaron y viven en otra parte con su respectiva familia.

Juan, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, actividades que realiza desde hace muchos años, lo cual aprendió de su padre, además de sus labores agrícolas también trabaja como albañil y en un taller de herrería donde se elaboran machetes, los cuales son ingresos que sirven para sus gastos familiares.

El presente crédito lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, pago de jornales y preparación de terreno para dicho cultivo, con el cual espera tener una buena cosecha este año.

Juan, sueña con lograr que su hijo aprenda muy bien las labores agrícolas, así como a él le enseñaron sus padres.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, studied until the 5th grade, is currently single and lives with his 23-year-old son. His other children are already married or live with a life partner outside of the home. 

Juan works cultivating staple grains like corn and beans, a labor that he has done for several years. He learned it from his father. He also works as a construction worker and in a blacksmith’s forge where they make machetes. All of his incomes help him to pay for the household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers, manure, to pay for labor and prepare the field for sowing. He hopes that with this help he will have a good harvest this year.  Juan’s dream is that his son will learn the agricultural activities just like he learned them from his parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like fertilizers, manure, pay for labor and prepare the field for sowing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works with her husband to manage their rice farm in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has always found ways to add to their core income and to improve their living situation. 

She has borrowed from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to purchase a batch of natural fertilizer to improve her rice yield during the coming year. She expects that her increased rice sales will enable her to repay the loan and keep a small surplus to help her children. 

In the future, Josephine wants to have a better quality of life for her family and to produce even more rice.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more water tanks to pump water into and then sell.

loans.name: Myri

texts.en:
Myri, a poor villager and father of two in his 60s, needs your financial help to buy a dairy cow.
 
Myri's focus for almost a decade has been on agriculture. He asks, "What else could I do having no other skills?" 

He owns land, where he plants lima and black beans, wheat, corn, potatoes and red and white beets. He sells most of the products to wholesale buyers.  

He says his region, including his village, is blessed, because the soil is very supportive of many types of grains as well as beans, onions, potatoes and apples. To help transport his goods, he's got a horse. 

With his two sons, he also gathers wild medicinal plants in the mountains around him, but they don't always find buyers for the plants. 

At the moment, Myri has a cow that has not been producing milk lately, due to its age. This is why he wants to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Erkinali

texts.ru: Эркинали, 47 лет, женат, 3 детей. У него среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки овец с ягнятами. Благодаря упорному труду Эркинали, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 7 овец, также на 0,46 Га собственной земли он выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 13,000 сом (KGS). Эркинали решил обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота, тем самым инвестировав в свою деятельность и сохранив поголовье. Доходы от бизнеса будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Erkinali is 47 years old, married, and has three children. He has a secondary education, and he rears animals and grows crops to get income for his family, having started 18 years ago by buying some sheep and lambs. Thanks to Erkinali's hard work, today his farm has two cows and seven sheep, and he also grows potatoes on 0.46 hectares of his own land. His monthly profit is about 13,000 som (KGS).

Erkinali has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy hay and feed for his livestock, in doing so investing in his business and preserving his herd. He will invest the income from the business in further increasing his number of domesticated livestock and building a barn.

loans.use: to buy hay and feed for his livestock in order to invest in his business.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, se casó de 20 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, estudio hasta primer grado, no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la guerra que azoto al país en ese tiempo y vivía lejos de la comunidad.

María, se dedica a la venta de antojitos como pastelitos de carne, panes de barra, enchiladas, frescos y golosinas.- Además, se dedica a la venta de pan artesanal en la comunidad y en los alrededores, desde joven fue a una taller donde aprendió a hacerlo y luego se dedicó a este negocio, en donde le ayudan sus hijas a vender el pan artesanal.- Además, elabora hamacas de poli-seda.

María, solicita un crédito para colocar una pequeña tienda en la comunidad, porque donde vive las tiendas están muy lejos y tienen que caminar bastante para ir a comprar parte de la canasta básica y el resto del dinero lo necesita para mejorar el horno artesanal y para comprar harina y otros insumos para hacer pan y poder generar ingresos para su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, es mejorar su vivienda de adobe y también ayudarles a sus hijos a seguir estudiando, para que se preparen y puedan ser personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
48 year old María got married when she was 20 years old. She is the mother of 5 children. She studied until first grade but was not able to keep studying because of the war that battered the country at that time and because she lived far from the community.
María works selling snacks such as little meat pies, baguettes, enchiladas, juices, and candy. In addition, she works selling artisanal bread in the community and surroundings. When she was young she attended a workshop where she learned to bake and, later on, she decided to open this business. Her children help her to sell the bread. She also makes hammocks from poly-silk.
María is requesting a loan to open a small store in the community because the stores are far from where she lives and people have to walk a long way to buy their basic supplies. She needs the remainder of the money to improve her artisanal oven and to buy flour and other supplies to make bread so that she can generate income for her family and offer them a better quality of life. 
María's dream is to improve her adobe house and also to help her children to keep studying so that they are prepared and can be productive members of society.

loans.use: to open a small store in the community and to buy flour and other supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Cristian Andres

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre muy trabajador y con un gran corazón campesino que ha sido fortalecido con la humildad y la sensatez que distingue a los habitantes del municipio de El Peñol.

Vive en una finca con sus dos hijos, quienes han sido su más grande motivación. 

Aprendió de de la agricultura de manera  empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de frijol, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Cristian sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en un futuro y tener un negocio que sea sostenible.

 ¡Impacte la vida de Cristian y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Cristian is a very hardworking man who has a big country heart that has been strengthened with the humility and sageness that distinguishes the people of El Peñol.
He lives on a farm with his 2 children who have been his greatest motivation in life.
He learned to farm empirically, that is to say he learned by doing and by watching others. 
He plans to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as bean seeds, products for controlling insects, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops. 
Thanks to this loan, his family's economic situation and quality of life should improve and he will be able to increase his income. 
Cristian dreams of improving his family's economic condition in the future and of having a sustainable business. 
Impact the lives of Cristian and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seed beans, products to control insects, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops.

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.en:
Cienega Grande is a small town in Southwest Guatemala, thirteen miles from the capital of Guatemala City.  The town is a small suburb, an area of lush green rolling hills.  Cienega Grande is an agricultural community  where corn and wheat are grown. Beautiful handicrafts are created here as well.  The women speak Maya K’iché and proudly wear their colorful traditional clothing even though their climate is relatively cold compared to other parts of the country. 
  
A year ago, the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Orquidea” meaning “Orchid” received its first line of credit generously funded by Kiva lenders.  Today, the seven women who make up “Orquidea” happily and with great satisfaction report that thanks to their line of credit, they have been able to manage and diversify their small businesses and finally have been able to increase their inventories which has led to greater profits.  Now, with their  increased capital, they are able create short and long term projects. 

With the huge successes of their first loan cycle, the seven women are asking for another loan.  Amelia is a member who is seeking a loan in order to increase her textile business inventory by buying “cortes” (wrap-around skirts), “huipiles” (blouses), “fajas” (belts), along with typical accessories in new designs, styles and colors.  She knows there is a huge demand for these new products!  Amelia has seen her small business grow little by little over the past year which has inspired her to follow her dream of having a larger business located in a shop and to have the ability to save her profits. 

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education is a real asset for the women.  In their monthly meetings, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares valuable and useful information with the women in their own language.
Amelia and the other members of “Orquidea” are extremely grateful to KIVA investors for giving them the opportunity to develop and expand their businesses. They are greatly honored that people outside of their country care about them and their families. Thank you!!!

loans.use: To increase her textile business inventory by buying “cortes” (wrap-around skirts), “huipiles” (blouses), “fajas” (belts), along with typical accessories

loans.name: Las Margaritas Pales Group

texts.en:
Palestina de los Altos, Guatemala is in the Western Guatemalan Highlands in the State of Quetzaltenango. It is a very attractive area surrounded by mountains where women tend their sheep and work on their handicrafts.  Eight women who live here have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Margaritas Pales”.  The average number of children of each member of the group is between 6 and 8.  They support themselves with various small businesses, like selling medicines, new clothes and animal husbandry. 

Thirty-year old Lesly, who has only 6 years of formal education, was elected Treasurer of the group.  She has a small business selling shoes and clothes for women, children and men.  Lesly is asking Kiva lenders for a loan to increase her inventory so that she can offer more of a variety to her customers.   The profits that she earns from her increased sales help her to provide an education to her only son. 

It is important to note that in Guatemala, providing a good education for one’s children is one of the most important things a mother can do!  Lesly and her friends in the “Las Margaritas Pales” Trust Bank are asking for another line of credit in order to combat poverty  as well as provide an education for their children.  They are also very happy that, in addition to the loans they receive, they also have monthly educational lessons in various topics that can help them with their businesses, as well as help them to empower themselves. These monthly lessons are a part of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program that combines small loans and education.  When women are able to empower themselves through education, they help to grow their communities and raise children who are educated and healthy. Everyone has the opportunity to step into a brighter future and leave poverty behind!

Many thanks to KIVA investors for helping to provide the funding that helps the women of “Palestina de los Altos” empower themselves and build a strong community!!!

loans.use: To increase her shoes inventory so that she can offer more of a variety to her customers

loans.name: Elvira Rose

texts.en:
Elvira Rose needs to stand on her feet after her husband died from diseases. She is 35 years old with four school-aged children in her care. 

In addition to the pension she receives from her husband's life insurance, she has managed to create another business venture to augment her income for her family. She decided to covert a parcel of land she inherited from her parents into agricultural land and to plant bananas. 

Elvira Rose landed at the right place when she signed up with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and has employed neighbouring farmers to work on her farm. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to pay for land preparation and irrigation to soften tillage of her banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and irrigation to soften tillage of her banana plantation

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a 61-year-old married woman. She helps her husband, working on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this since she got married.

Banana farming is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer to restore the land's nutrients.

In the future, she wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Carlos Geovanny

texts.es:
Carlos, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja en un negocio de celulares, no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.

Carlos, desde hace dos años vende pomadas (medicina natural) en los buses y tiene un puesto de venta de cosméticos 
junto a su suegra, el cual lo administran juntos y sale a vender las medicinas de Lunes a Sábado.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos medicinales y comprar cosméticos, ya que es necesario tener surtido para poder vender más, de esa manera lograra mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Carlos, es tener un negocio más grande y que siempre su suegra le apoye para poder mantener siempre los ingresos.
texts.en:
27 year old Carlos studied until fifth grade. He has a partner who works in a cell phone store. They don't have children, and they live in the family home.
Carlos has been selling natural medicines for 2 years. He sells on buses and has a stall selling cosmetics along with his mother-in-law, which they administer together. He goes out to sell medicines from Monday through Saturday.
Carlos needs the loan to buy more medicinal products and to buy cosmetics as he needs to stock-up in order to be able to sell more. In this way, he will be able to improve his income. 
Carols' dream is to have a larger business and that his mother-in-law will always support him so that they can always have a good income.

loans.use: to buy more medicinal products and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Keyla Marcela

texts.es:
Keila es soltera y vive en el municipio de Los Córdobas y se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años. 
Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. En este municipio no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros, por esta razón acude a la Corporación Interactuar.

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de plátano, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Keila sueña con poder mejorar sus cultivos y ventas.

 ¡Impacte la vida de Keila y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Keila is single and lives in the municipality of Los Córdobas and she has been a farmer for 8 years. 
She learned this work empirically, that is to say that she learned by doing and by watching others. In this municipality, it is not easy to access financial services, and this is why she came to the Corporación Interactuar. 
She plans to use this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as plantain seeds, products to control insects, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain her crops. 
Thanks to this loan, her family's economic condition and quality of life should improve and she will be able to increase her income.
Kelia dreams of being able to improve her crops and sales.
Impact the life of Keila and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as plantain seeds, products to control insects, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 52-year-old hard working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has 3 children ages 23, 12 and 9. Two of them attend school.

He sells maize, rice and ground nuts and grows crops to supplement the family income. He ventured into business as he realized the need of being self employed. He wishes to expand his business and build a permanent house very soon but he is challenged by bad seasons and unfavourable price changes.

He is requesting a loan to buy more rice and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 63 años de edad fuerte, trabajador, humilde y servicial lleva trabajando en su finca gran parte de su vida y todos sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a su familia que realizan actividades similares. 

Es casado y manifiesta que desea tener una vejez plena con su esposa.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos y semillas de papaya buscando mejorar y aumentar su producción pues es ambicioso y piensa en ser muy prospero.
texts.en:
Jose is a 62 year old man who is strong, hardworking, humble and helpful. He has been working on his farm for most of his life and everything he knows he learned thanks to his family, who do similar work.
He is married and says that he wants to have a full old age along with his wife. 
He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, and papaya seed, seeking to improve and increase his production because he is ambitious and wants to be very prosperous.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, and papaya seeds to improve and increase his production.

loans.name: Khunthea's Group

texts.en:
Khunthea, 22, has one child and lives in Battambang province. She earns income from motorcycle repairs to support her living conditions. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The main problem in her current business is that she does not have enough capital to buy motorcycle materials and spare parts. 

In this group of two members, Khunthea is the group leader. This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has successfully paid back her previous loan. 

As the result of her last loan, she was able to earn a decent income. With this loan, she will spend her entire portion on spare motorcycle parts and other materials to support her business. 

She hopes that her business improves smoothly and earns a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycles parts and other materials to support her business.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 22-year-old single man who works as tutor to cover his needs and expenses, especially the educational costs. 

Tarek is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to finish his studies and start his business. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees for his B. Sc. in Engineering.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees for his B. Sc. in Engineering

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities  like seasonings, vinegar, garlic, fabric conditioner, canned goods and toiletries. She is  married with six four children. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 1 year old respectively. She has been running a store for a year now.
 Her husband has an income by being a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, beverages, rice and assorted goods. With these, she will be able to maintain the stocks of her store and able to balance her earnings. Thus, she could roll out her capital and able to settle her obligation.

She is doing her best to manage her livelihood  to improve the living condition of her family and to be able to finish the schooling of her children in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages,rice and assorted goods

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 47 years old and she lives with her big and nice family in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Armine graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. Started from 1995 till today she works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. Armine also has a group of pupils whom she gives paid private courses of this subject preparing them for the entrance exams.  She is married and has three sons. 

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she asks for the purchase of computer, accessories and also some professional literature for her courses with the pupils. All these will make her courses more productive and more interesting for pupils.

loans.use: purchase computer, accessories and professional literature for her Russian language and literature courses with her pupils

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old. She is married with 7 children. 

She has had a retail shop business for 4 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase stock and hopes this will help her expand the business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock to help her expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cows for meat.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is married and blessed with four children. They all live in a five-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many difficulties in life, which have been the death of his mother, brother who was his only supporter and inadequate finance to start up a business of his. His friends encouraged him to join GHAPE. He became a GHAPE member in 2006 and he has taken and repaid EC five times.

With this new loan he will buy pigs, chicks and extend his pepper plantation.  The community will benefit from his activity in that they will not spend money to go to the market to buy and will also buy at a cheaper rate. He holds a positive view of this business succeeding because he has been doing it for long and the demand of his products are increasing on daily bases. 

He prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Members also share ideas and experiences which empowers other members. He will use the profit to take care of family needs.

loans.use: To buy pigs, chicks and build an extension of his pepper plantation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old. She is married and has one child. She operates a beauty salon and has been in business for 11 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for the beauty salon. 

She will use profits from the business to do home repairs.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair lotions, shampoos, weaves and hair chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a hotel business for 10 years.

She will be using the loan to purchase hotel furniture and hopes this will help her to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big hotel.

loans.use: to purchase hotel furniture to help her to improve her business.

loans.name: Nelly Joy

texts.en:
Twenty-eight years old Nelly Joy  hails in the town of Talibon,Bohol. She has a 3 year-old son. Her husband works and earn a living by being a technician.
She operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, powdered soap and other basic commodities.  She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for 7 years now. She decided to take a loan to finance her current source of living.

She is asking for a loan to purchase stocks like liquor, feeds and assorted goods. These will keep her store full of content and able to cater the order of her respective customers. In these way, her earnings will augment. Thus, she could pay balance her finances and be able to expand her business as well.

In the future, Morena dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable

loans.use: to purchase stocks like liquor, feeds and assorted goods

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 77 years old, a widow with eight children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit from Sevan city of Gegharkunik region is a pedagogue with already 21 years of work experience in this field. Lilit is so thankful for her first Kiva loan and she hopes for one more profitable deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. She has higher professional education and she works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. Lilit mentions that she finds the subject that she teaches one of the most interesting and important subjects and she does her best to make the children to get interested in it and learn as more as it is possible. Lilit is married and she lives with her husband (he is architecture), her son and daughter-in-law. 

Lilit asks this loan as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature and all these she will use for self-development in order to be aware of any innovation in pedagogical methodology and in the mathematical sphere as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories, professional literature which she will use for self-development in her field of Mathematics

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is 31 years old and with his wife, children and parents he lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Vladimir and his father provide car repair services in their own garage. He says once he was his father’s pupil in this craft, now he is also a master in this work. He has a big group of regular customers who trust him and appreciate his work’s quality. Vladimir works all the days of the week and his garage is open till late at night so he uses every chance to earn more money for his family needs.

Now Vladimir asks for this loan of 700,000 AMD as he wants to buy some car spare parts that are in great demand among his customers.

loans.use: to buy some car spare parts that are in great demand among his customers.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Dauda Village. Maryam joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of her family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, she no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for her children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Maryam will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Maryam has set high goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize.

With increased yields and income, Maryam has made it her ultimate goal to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm’s yields.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. Yusuf joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Yusuf has set high goals of harvesting 50 bags of maize.

With increased yields and incomes, Yusuf has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu Group

texts.en:
Fati is an active woman of 41 years old from Tamalgu in the Northern part of Ghana. Fati is married and has 7 children. She is the woman seated third in front from right to left in the group photo. 

Fati is a member of shea nuts and butter processing group who have been doing the business over the last 4 years. Their group is named ‘Suglo Nbori Buni - Tamalgu’ Women Group. She enjoys and makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana and Partners on how to process high quality premium shea nuts and butter for local buyers and exporters.

Fati and the group have asked for their next cycle of loan of GHC 12,900.00 after having paid off a previous loan of GHC 8,800.00. Fati’s share of this loan is GHC 500.00 which would help her to pay for the cost of 2 more bags of shea nuts meant for production of shea butter. With this, Fati would increase productivity and payback the loan. She also intends to support her children by providing for their educational and health needs. Fati is highly appreciative of her lenders’ support.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of 2 more bags of shea nuts meant for production of shea butter.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina who is in her early 50s is married with seven children who are grown up. She has been running a charcoal business for ten years now. She works from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Clementina's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to build her house, loan repayment, took care of herself and covered household expenses.   She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resale. She dreams of extending her business.  
 
Clementina  will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is 13 years old. Her husband is a security guard while she is running a sari-sari store business. Aside from sari-sari business she also sells snacks. 

Cecilia is requesting a loan of PHP10000 to buy more soft drinks to sell and some grocery items such as biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and toiletries. Cecilia dreams to improve her business so that in the future she has enough money to run a business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and toiletries

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina and her husband are engaged in fishing business for ten years. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is nine years old while youngest child is one year old. Aside from fishing, Cerina’s husband is a security guard and work hard to provide the needs of their family. 

Cerina is asking a loan of PHP3000 to buy fishing nets. In the future, she dreams to improve their livelihood for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Nusfati who is in her late 20s years is single with no children. She has been selling clothes one year now. She works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 
  
This will be Nusfati’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the clothes stock especially on fabrics and sarongs and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully . 
 
She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to improve and to expand on her business, took care of herself, loan repayment, saved some in the bank and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date clothes.  She dreams of opening another business of selling water and juice.

Nusfati will share this loan with her loan group kilombero which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date clothes for selling

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is involved in farming and running a retail shop selling items like sugar, salt, match box, cooking oil, soap and biscuits. He is faced with challenges of low capital and defaulter that hinder progress of his business. However, he has a vision of increasing his family income. 

Solomon has asked for a loan to add stock of general merchandise like sugar, salt, matches, cooking oil, soap and biscuits in his retail shop for selling.

loans.use: to add stock of general merchandise like sugar, salt, matches, cooking oil, soap and biscuits in his retail shop for selling.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 33 years old. He is married with three children. He has had a phone accessories business for the last 16 years and the is doing well.

He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of phone batteries and hopes this will help him expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are open another business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase phone batteris to help him expand the business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 49 years old. He is married and has three children. For five years, he has operated an agrovet shop focused on animal health. 

He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs to sell to his clients. He hopes this will help him expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to sell to his clients

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 45 year old married man with 10 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of poultry farming and at the same time grows seasonal crops like tomatoes, onions,cabbages and also does carpentry works that boosts his income. He is faced with challenges of making losses when the birds do not lay eggs and price fluctuations of agricultural products. 

Charles requests a loan to buy poultry feeds for the chicken.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for the chicken

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Afi est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne des mèches au marché trois fois par mois et les revendent dans son salon de coiffure. Afi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des tissages en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en: Afi is a 31-year-old married mother to three children who lives in Adidogomé. She works as a hairdresser who gets her supply of hair extensions from market three times per month. She then resells them through her hairdressing salon. Afi needs this loan to purchase hair extensions so she can earn a profit in order to assist her husband care of their children and meet their family's food and health needs.

loans.use: to purchase 45 packs of hair extensions

loans.name: Rosevillaflor

texts.en:
Rose,a 44 years old, married and has 4 children to provide.

For 15 years she has been running her sari sari store selling goods in their community to earn a living. Despite the small income, it brings in a daily income which is just what the family needed. She took a loan to buy additional stocks for her store in order for her to gain more income.

Rose plan for her future is to earn more profit and expand business to support my children for their education.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old. He is married and has one child. He has had a motorcycle business for five years. 

He will use the loan to complete payment of another motorcycle. He hopes this will help him educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big business and a happy family.

loans.use: to complete payment of another motorcycle

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. Sonia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Sonia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Sonia would like to expand her business so she can secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell veterinary products business in the Philippines. Thelma has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a successful mother as they say. She sent all her children to school until they finished college and landed a good job. After which, she was advised by her children to retire from doing back breaking work.

However, Esterlita does not want to rely on her children for all her needs, especially for her medications. Thus, as a member of Paglaum MPC, she has taken several loan which she nurtures for many years. Recently, she requested another loan of PHP 50,000.00 to pay for a medical check-up & to purchase maintenance medicines. She uses her pension as the source of her monthly payments for her loans.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up & to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda wants to expand her farm in the future. She helps her husband working on their own farm in order to earn a living. She has been doing this since she got married.

Recently, she took out a GDMPC loan to purchase fertilizer in order to expand her farm. In the future, she wants to expand their farm as well as improving the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetable farm

loans.name: Geofry

texts.en:
Geofry is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with one child.

He has had a motorcycle business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will help him expand the business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle to help him expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Jose Will

texts.es:
José, de 46 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, ya que por motivos económicos, no pudo seguir con sus estudios, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos los cuales están estudiando.
 
José, se dedica a la carpintería y hace muebles de madera, se ha dedicado por más de diez años a este oficio lo aprendió con su padre.- El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa y en el negocio se involucra un hermano.

José, necesito el crédito para comprar más madera para la elaboración de muebles y con el préstamo mejorara más el negocio y así obtendrá más ganancias.
 
Su sueño es tener una carpintería más grande y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and only studied up to sixth grade. He could not continue his studies for economic reasons. His wife does domestic work and they have two children who are studying.


José works as a carpenter making furniture out of wood. He has done this for more than 10 years and he learned the trade from his father. The work is done close to his house and his brother is involved in the business.

José needs the loan to buy more wood to to make furniture and with the loan he will improve his business and thus obtain more income. His dream is to have a larger carpentry shop and provide his children with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been involved in business activity since 2007. She used her own working capital of 500 USD. She is married and has one child. Her business is selling cows. Her husband is in agriculture, so he is very supportive of her business. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin. She will add that to her own capital to buy more cows, because she wants her business to grow. She was very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, because she will be able to increase her income in the future. She also raises cows and pigs at her farm.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Crizaldo

texts.en:
Crizaldo is from Calape, Bohol. He is married and has seven children. The oldest child is 19 years old while her youngest child is six years old. 

To earn a living Crizalsdo buys and sells dried fish. He has been doing this business for four years. He works hard to provide the needs of his family. He dreams in the future to improve her business for sustainability. With this, he is asking a fund of PHP6000 to buy more dried fish to sell to increase his livelihood

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes fish to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Delmy Raquel

texts.es:
Delmy, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de profesor, tienen cinco hijos.

Delmy, desde hace cinco años está vendiendo en el cafetín de la escuela, además prepara los alimentos a los 
alumnos, ella decidio dedicarse a este negocio porque quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Delmy, solicita de nuevo el préstamo para comprar productos para su cafetín como galletas, gaseosas, dulces, pan, entre otros, de esa manera lograra que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida.

El sueño de Delmy, es que sus cinco hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y que no les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Delmy is 31 years old and studied through 5th grade.  She is in a domestic partnership and her partner works as a professor.  They have 5 children.  

For the past 5 years Delmy has been selling at the school cafe, as well as preparing meals for the students.  She decided to go into this business because she wanted to hep her husband with the household costs.  Delmy is requesting a new loan to buy products for her cafe, such s cookies, soft drinks, sweets, breads and others.  This will help her achieve better living conditions for her family.  Delay's dream is that her 5 children will be professionals and never lack the necessities.

loans.use: to buy products for her cafe such as cookies, drinks, sweets, bread, and other goods.

loans.name: Tupendane Kawizi Group

texts.fr: Avant de devenir cultivateur de tomates, Gloire se contentait d'acheter les tomates auprès des paysans pour le revendre dans la cité. Persuadé de sa rentabilité, il a pris l'initiative de se rallier à sa culture en 2012.cela lui permet de répondre tant soit peu au vécu quotidien. L'expérience de la dernière récolte lui a permis de réaliser un total de deux cents dollars dont cent de charges et cent autres de gain. Il est confiant s'il cultivait un espace plus grand, il pourrait réaliser des revenus consistants qui lui permettront de scolariser ses enfants et d'améliorer son niveau de vie. Sur photo, Gloire, tout souriant, porte un chapeau bleu.
texts.en: Before growing his own tomatoes, Gloire was happy to just purchase tomatoes from farmers and resell them in the city. Once he was convinced of their profitability, he took the initiative to start growing his own tomatoes in 2012. This allows him to meet his relatively small daily expenses. The experience he gained from the last harvest allowed him to earn a total of 200 dollars, 100 of which went towards paying his overheads while the rest was taken as profit. He is confident that if he had a larger space on which to grow his crops, he could make considerable profits which would allow him to send his children to school and improve his standard of living. In the photo, Gloire is the smiling man wearing the blue cap.

loans.use: to purchase phytosanitary products

loans.name: Walde Yiriwere Group

texts.fr:
Djeneba  est celle qui tient la corne du bélier dans la photo.C’est une éléveuse d’ovin qui reside au Mali, agée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, 3 garçons et 3 filles dont 1 scolarisés. 
Elle exerce cette activité d’élévage d’ovin dépuis 7 ans, elle achete  ses betails au marché local. Elle les élève après quelques mois et les revend avec interêt au marché locale de son village.Le prêt lui permetra de dévélopper son activité, et le revenu sera consacré à  ses enfants à leurs acheter  des chaussures et vêtements, payer leur frais de scolarisation et parvenir aussi a leur besoin sanitaire.Elle n’ a pas de difficulté dans l’exercice de son travail.
texts.en:
Djeneba is the woman holding a ram by the horns in the photo. She is a livestock farmer who lives in Mali. She is a 36-year-old married mother to six children, three boys and three girls; one of them is currently attending school.

Djeneba has been raising sheep for seven years. She purchases her livestock from the local market. She raises them for a few months then resells them at a profit at the local village market. This loan will allow her to further develop her business. The profits will go towards her children. They'll be provided with footwear and clothing, their school fees will be paid for and their health needs will be met. She has not met any difficulties while carrying out her work.

loans.use: to purchase sheep which will then be resold

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 24 years old and a single Palestinian refugee. He took his barbering vocational training in a specialized school and opened his own barber shop to make his living. Jamal has 9 years of experience in his domain, he was only 15 years old when he started working to make his own and family's living. Since he was born and is currently living in a Palestinian Refugees camp, he decided to open his shop in the same place he grew up in, and where he has a good relationship with his community.

As a good step forward towards expanding his business and increasing his services, Jamal decided to buy additional specialized barber chairs and to recruit someone to increase his barbering services, which will lead to increasing his income.
