For this reason he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He hopes that in the future he can stay capable of developing his business upon customers needs.

loans.use: to buy additional specialized barber chairs and recruit someone to increase his barbering services

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, es casado, tiene una familia muy numerosa, vive con su esposa y cinco de ocho hijos, su actividad económica es cultivar granos básicos y atender una pequeña ganadería, aprendió de muy joven a desarrollas dichas actividades con ayuda de su padre, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio.
Hace la solicitud de crédito para comprar básicamente insumos agrícolas para la milpa, espera dar un buen trato a sus cultivos para tener mayor cantidad de granos, con los que abastecerá de alimento a su familia y atenderá a nuevos clientes, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.
La prioridad de don José es resarcir su deuda y darle a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
José is married and has a large family.  He lives with his wife and 5 of his 8 children.  His main economic activity is the cultivation of basic grains and tending to a small cattle farm.  He learned both activities from a young age through the help of his parents.  His children help with the business.  

He is making this loan request to buy agricultural products for corn, in hopes of giving his plants good treatment in order to have the greatest quantity of production, with which he will supply nutrients to his family and tend to new clients, as he has a great deal of experience.  

The priority of José is to repay his debt and give his family better nutrition, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for corn, in hopes of giving his cultivation good treatment to have the greatest quantity of production.

loans.name: Katembe Tukolerehamu Group

texts.en:
Polito, with his hand raised, is a member of a village bank. He is 34 years old and married with children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Polito has been in the Waragi (local brew) distillation brewing business that he has been operating for many years. He obtains additional income from selling agricultural produce. Polito started his business to satisfy his family's needs. He is faced with the challenges of price fluctuation and poor roads that hinder his service delivery. He is requesting for a loan to weed and pay labour involved sugar cane plantation.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has his savings and has guaranteed others but has not taken a loan this time.

loans.use: to weed and pay labour involved sugar cane plantation

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, de 23 años de edad, solo estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos.
 
Teresa, vende ropa, este negocio lo aprendió gracias sus padres, lo tiene cerca de su casa y en el negocio se involucra una hermana de ella y su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. 

Teresa, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa y poder surtir más el negocio, con esto mejorara sus ganancia y tendrá más variedad de ropa.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca más y algún día pueda tener un bazar de ropa.
texts.en:
Teresa is 23 years old, only studied through high school, and is single with no children.  She sells clothing, a business she learned thanks to her parents.  Her business is close to her home and her sister is also involved in the business.  Her store-tending schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  

She needs the loan to buy more clothing to stock her store, and with this she will increase her earnings and have a greater variety of clothing.  Her dream is for her business to grow more and one day have a clothing bazaar.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

Natividad has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the beauty products business for 16 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya no dependen de él y el otro está estudiando.

Oscar, se dedica a la compra de ganado para la crianza y comercialización desde hace más de 20 años y el ganado se encuentra a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de su casa.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abono, entre otros.

Los sueños de Oscar, es poder comprar un terreno donde pueda tener el ganado, porque donde lo tiene está alquilando.
texts.en:
Oscar is 52 years old, studied until the sixth grade, and is married.  He has three children, two of whom no longer depend on him and the other is in school.  He has worked at purchasing livestock to raise and sell for more than 20 years.  The livestock are located 3 kilometers from his home.

The loan he is requesting is to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and manure, as well as other supplies.  Oscar's dream is to buy a plot of land where he can keep livestock, because he is renting where he has them now.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and manure.

loans.name: Jose Marel

texts.es:
Marel tiene 48 años y se dedica a producir café bajo distintos sellos de certificación como ser: orgánico y de comercio justo el cual comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio, Marel tiene más de 32 años de experiencia en la producción de café y este es su principal fuente de ingresos, Su mayor deseo es que sus 5 hijos puedan tener las oportunidades que él no ah tenido.
Marel quiere certificar su cafetal bajo la norma de producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mejores precios por su café además de darle la oportunidad de hacer el cultivo amigable con el ambiente, con las ganancias obtenidas por el valor agregado de su café Marel piensa darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Un préstamo ayudaría a Marel a tener mejores ingresos por su café y hacer su cultivo de café un cultivo sostenible y amigable con el ambiente.
texts.en:
Marel is 48 years old and works producing coffee under the various certifications like Organic and Fair Trade. He is a member of COCAFCAL and sells his coffee through it. Marel has more 32 years of experience in producing coffee and it is his main source of income. His main wish is for his five children to have the opportunities he never had.

Marel wants to certify his plantation according to the organic production standards which would allow him to get better prices for his coffee and give him the opportunity to grow in an environmentally friendly way. Marel is thinking of providing his children a higher quality of living with the profits obtained from the added value of his coffee.

A loan will help Marel to have higher income from his coffee and make his coffee crops sustainable and friendly to the environment.

loans.use: to buy the needed materials to convert his coffee crops to organic such as organic manure, organic pesticides and planting live barriers.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a widowed woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Meali owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Meali has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en: Ma. Nena is 55 years old and is engaged in bamboo furniture production, with her husband as one of carpenters. She is doing so well with her business that it supported her family's needs, especially the education of her two children who are in college. Ma. Nena is grateful that she's turning good sales; she credits her success to the cooperative that assisted her financially and helped her to develop her products to be more saleable to customers. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional inventories of bamboo, varnish and nails, and to pay labor costs for furniture making. She hopes to makie good sales so that she can employ more of her neighbors who are jobless.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of bamboo, varnish and nails and to pay labor costs for furniture making.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He deals in transport business, the business he started with a hope of developing himself. He is faced with hardships of increased competition since many people are joining the business. 

However, he has a vision of constructing rentals that can earn him more income. Wilson has asked for a loan to buy doors for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy doors for his house construction.

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio, poco a poco ha incrementado sus productos y de esta manera sus ingresos.  Ya lleva más de seis años en el negocio y desea seguir creciendo aún más. Lucia solicita un préstamo para incrementar la mercadería que  sus clientes demandan y de esta manera comprar productos básicos, cosméticos y ropa. Poco a poco con las ganancias obtenidas podrá construir una casa de piedra porque la que tiene es de madera ya que quiere mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is an enterprising woman who has been able to move ahead in her business.  Little by little she has increased her products, and also her income.  She now has 6 years experience in the business and hopes to continue growing it more.  

Lucia is requesting a loan to increase stock of the merchandise that her clients request, such as basic products, cosmetics, and clothing.  Little by little she will construct a house of stone with her earnings.  Her current house is wood, and she wants to improve the conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic goods, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
The first time she opened her business in 2013 with a capital base of $ 400.00. So now she is requests a loan of $ 1,500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as salt, candles, cooking oils, noodles, gambling cards, tea, coffee, balm, candy and other things to sell. 

Because she plans to open a bigger business in the future. Margarida is one of a woman who is very interested in the business, even though she was married and had four children, but she is not overly dependent on the husband to be responsible in the household, because where there is market day, she always carries her belongings wares to sell there. Margarida also keep animals in her place such as pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy salt, candles, cooking oils, noodles, gambling cards, tea, coffee, balm, candy and other things to sell.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is married and has two children one of whom attend school and the other is still young to for scholing. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Agripino

texts.en:
Agripino is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC. He is married with one adult age child. He is supported with his only son with his daily needs knowingly he's ailing as he aged. His meager pension help him sustain other needs such as maintenace medicines. 

He is grateful to Paglaum MPC that he was supported fiancially whenever he needs money for some causes. Recently, he decided to avail another loan to purchase amakan (bamboo thatches), sticks, nipa thatch, nails & pay for labor cost in house repair. He hopes to live comfortably with his wife as they still savor the remaining years of his love.

loans.use: to purchase amakan (bamboo thatches), sticks, nipa thatch, nails & pay for labor cost in house repair

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian, de 38 años de edad, estudio licenciatura en computación, es madre soltera, es empleada en una micro-financiera y tiene una hija adolescente.

Mirian, tiene muchos años de tener ese trabajo, puesto que requiere viajar a varios países, solo tiene sueldo base y trabaja de Lunes a Sábado.

Mirian, solicita de nuevo un préstamo para comprar una computadora, porque cuando sale del país tiene que andar una computadora personal, de esa manera la intitucion le ayuda a cubrir la necesidad que tiene.

El sueño de Mirian, es que su hija estudie lo más que pueda, para que ella luego trabaje y se gane la vida por si misma.
texts.en:
Mirian is 38 years old and has a degree in information technology.  She is a single mother of an adolescent girl and an employee of a micro-finance agency.  Miriam has had the job for many years, and it is a position that requires travel to many countries.  She only has a base salary and she works Monday through Saturday.  

Mirian is requesting a new loan to buy a computer because when she leaves the country she must travel with a personal computer, and in this way the institution can help her cover the need that she has.  

Mirian's dream is that her daughter will study as much as she can, and she will work and earn a living for herself.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolto tiene la edad de 66 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  sembrar maiz y frijoles en su finca.   Tiene muchos años que se dedica a su finca y a producir maiz y frijoles, quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El Ha realizado otros préstamos en un banco, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida vida aumentando la producción y obteniendo mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 66 years old, married and lives with his wife, which is his main priority.  He wants to plant corn and beans on his farm.  He has many years of dedication to his farm and to planting corn and beans, and he wants to grow his farm and hopes that it will be very productive.  

This is the second loan he has received with FUDECOSUR.  He has received other loans from a bank, but FUDECOSUR provides him a loan with greater ease and a lower interest rate.  He also wants to give his wife a better quality of life by increasing the production and obtaining more earnings.

loans.use: to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 36 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a business buying and selling of tea leaves for seven years. 

He will be using the loan to purchase more tea leaves and hopes this will help him to educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more tea leaves

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un agricultor de 40 años, casado con Rosa Aminta,  con quien tienen 4 hijos a los quienes debe dar alimentos y una buena educación, Reinaldo depende de la producción de café y miel, Reinaldo sueña con poder darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y que sus hijos tengan acceso a buena educación.
Reinaldo trabaja con las colmenas hace mas de 12 años de las cuales produce miel de una altísima calidad la cual comercializa atreves de COCAFCAL. La producción de miel es una actividad novedosa y muy exitosa en la región ya que la buena densidad de plantas en la región favorece para una producción abundante y las buenas condiciones climáticas ayudan a conservar la salud de las abejas.
En la actualidad Reinaldo necesita un préstamo para comprar materiales para ampliar su apiario de 100 a 150 colmenas, para lo que es necesario construir más cajas, disponer de más espacio preparado y comprar más alimentos para las colmenas.
Un crédito ayudara a Reynaldo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a brindar mejores oportunidades de educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a 40 year old farmer, is married to Rosa Aminta, with whom he has 4 children who he must feed and give a good education to.  He makes a living from coffee and honey production.  He dreams of being able to give his family better living conditions and for his children to have access to a good education.

He has worked with beehives for more than 12 years, which produce very high quality honey which he sells through COCAFCAL.  The production of honey is new in the region and is very successful.  The high density of plants in the area favors abundant production and the good climate conditions help to maintain the bees' health.

Reinaldo currently needs a loan to buy materials in order to expand his apiary from 100 to 150 beehives.  For this he needs to build more boxes, to have more prepared space, and to buy more food for the bees.  A loan will help Reinaldo to improve his family's quality of life and help him offer better opportunities for education to his children.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand his apiary, such as boxes, space preparation, and food for the bees.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy is a wholesaler of fish sauce and detergent soap, and she also offers water refills within her local community. She has been involved to this kind of business for four years. Aside from her wholesale business, she also cultivates her 1.7 hectare rice field. Amy would like to take out for a loan of 11,000  PHP, allowing her to purchase four boxes of detergent soap, eight boxes of fish sauce and to add capital to her water refill business. She hopes to obtain the loan to keep her business progressive and profitable. In this way, she could sustain her family daily needs and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase four boxes of detergent soap, eight boxes of fish sauce and to add capital to her water refill business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is a mother and a hardworking hog grower. She mastered this activity knowing it would give her a good income for her family needs. Recently, she requested a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase additional bags of animal feed and animal vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of animal feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. For two years, she has sold cereals. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a stock of maize, beans, cow peas and green grams as well as paying for transportation. She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children and purchase food for the family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize, beans, cow peas and green grams as well as paying for transportation.

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly is from the village of Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Verly owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store), selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2015, Verly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Verly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has nine branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy additional products for resale.

loans.name: Pricyl

texts.en: Pricyl is 31 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Pricyl works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business in the Philippines. Pricyl requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional spare parts to sell. In the future Pricyl would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Milton Rosendo

texts.es:
Milton, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo, es joyero, elabora y vende prendas de oro y plata, oficio que le enseño su padre, además para tener mejores ingresos decidió ofrecer el servicio de viajes en su vehículo. 
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar oro y plata para elaborar aretes, pulseras, anillos y otras prendas, considera que tendrá disponibilidad de material para elaborar las piezas que sus clientes le solicitan.
Su sueño es continuar luchando para tener su negocio funcionando, ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Milton lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter.  He is a jeweler, he makes and sells gold and silver pieces, a trade he learned from his father. In order to earn more of an income, he also decided to offer transportation services using his vehicle.  

He is requesting a loan in order to buy gold and silver to make earrings, bracelets, rings and other pieces, thinking that he will then have available material to make the pieces that his customers request.  His dream is to continue fighting to have a successful business, since it is his source of income.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver to make jewelry.

loans.name: Febita

texts.en:
Febita is from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has four school aged children ages 19, 17, 12 and three years old. To earn a living Febita and her husband are doing fishing business. They have been doing this for 30 years. Aside from fishing, Febita’s husband is also a carpenter and works hard to raise their children. In the future, Febita wishes to improve her business for better means of living. 

With this, she is asking a loan of PHP6000 to buy new fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 57 years old, widow with 6 children of adult age. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC where she actively participated on its various activities. Now that she's retiring from her business activities, she lives with her monthly pension that her husband left when he passed away. 

Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 19,000.00 to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 36 years old. She is married with seven children. She keeps livestock as well as growing maize, cow,peas and mangoes. She has been in the business for two years. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 59 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir, actualmente está soltera, viven con dos hijos, los cuales trabajan en la agricultura y ayudan a su madre en la crianza de cerdos, su hijo mayor de ella estudia bachillerato los días sábado.

Santos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, actividades que aprendió de sus padres, ella se encarga de comprarlos pequeños y luego los crece hasta la edad de 6 meses, para luego venderlos, ella tiene una casa con espacio suficiente para realizar dicha actividad, ella vende los cerdos a personas que tiene como clientes desde hace varios años.

Santos, necesita el crédito para comprar más cerdos pequeños, comprar concentrados e invertir insumos para los cultivos, además necesita comprar medicamentos para el cuidado de sus animales y no perder su inversión.

Santos, sueña con dar a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Santos is 59 years old and cannot read or write. She is single and lives with two children who work in agriculture and help their mother raise pigs. Her oldest son is studying for his High school diploma on Saturdays.

Santos has been working raising pigs and farming for many years. She learned the trade from her parents. She takes care of buying them small and after letting them grow until they are 6 months old she sells them. She has a house with sufficient space to operate this business. She sells the pigs to people who she has had as clients for a number of years.

Santos needs a loan to buy more small pigs, concentrated feed and invest in inputs for her crops. She also needs to buy medication to protect her animals and not lose her investment.

Santos dreams of providing her family with all they need to live well and that her household has all it needs for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy more small pigs, concentrated feed and inputs for her crops.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She runs a green grocery business and has been in this business for 3 years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more stock of cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions and fruits for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support his children. 

She will use the generated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and do home repairs. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions and fruits for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support his children.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is 26 years old, she is a Palestinian refugee who was born in a Palestinian Refugees camp, and currently lives and works in her parents house since she was born.
In 2007, and after finishing  her special hair dressing vocational training, Layal decided to start her own business from her parents house as a first step forward towards opening her own beauty salon in the future.

Layal is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her business through buying updated tools and new released beauty products.  One of the obstacles she faced at the beginning was the limited access to the camp which lead to limited number of customers, but now her loyal customers recommended her to others.

Layal is working hard to move her business outside her parents house to provide both her family members and customers the privacy they deserve.

loans.use: To develop her business through buying updated tools and new released beauty products

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a 42-year-old, married mother with three children. She resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Sim and her husband can make some income from making clay piggy banks and other souvenirs to sell, Sim and her husband have been in this business for over three years. One of her children is a factory worker, and two attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $ 16.67 per day. 

Sim wants to earn more income to improve her family’s living standards, so she has decided to request a loan to buy paint to clay piggy banks. In the future, she wants to expand her business, build a bigger house and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy paint to clay piggy banks

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 53 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional more stocks of household goods to sell.

Solita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from .

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy other equipment for her business for her manicure and pedicure business.

Chona has been in this business for 5 years. Chona earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en:
Hariet is a 40 year old hardworking married woman with 5 children aged 9,12,17,18 & 20 years and 4 of them attend school in Kamwenge Uganda. She owns rentals and sells charcoal to get income to cater for her family and earn a living. 

Her intention is to finish her residential house and also educate all her children despite the hardship of inadequate capital.  To put her rentals to a level that will attract many tenants and increase her earnings.

She is requesting for a loan to finish up her residential house by closing and painting it.

loans.use: to finish her residential house by closing and painting it.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 58 years old and she live in Spitak city of Lori region. Gayane now lives alone, since her single son is in Russian Federation and he does there abroad works and helps his mother financially. Gayane has higher pedagogical education and already 30 years of work experience in that field. Now she works at the local school as a teacher of elementary classes. She also at her house helps some pupils to prepare their lessons and explains any misunderstandings that they have in their lessons. She is very kind and patient pedagogue and she finds her work very important and pleasant one. 

Now this loan she will be happy to receive this loan as she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature of pedagogical methodology,  and all these she will use for self-development, since as she mentions it is never late for anyone to learn more as there is so much that we do not now still.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature of pedagogical methodology

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales  trabajan en la pesca y recolección de moluscos, la actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración de pan (quesadillas de maíz y aros) además tiene una pequeña tienda.

María, tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad porque la realiza desde hace 10 años, debido al alto índice de pobreza de sus padres, no pudo estudiar por lo tanto no pudo optar por otra actividad, ahora aparte de esa actividad, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
                                  
María, solicita el crédito para mejorar el horno y la estructura donde trabaja fabricando el pan, además desea surtir su pequeña tienda y comprar materia prima para su negocio.

María, sueña con tener un negocio más grande, en el cual puedan involucrarse sus hijos y juntas sacarlo adelante.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, and studied until the third grade.  She is a single mother, and has 3 children, who are working in fishing and harvesting mollusks.  The work she does is in breadmaking where she makes sweet cheese poundcake and pastry rings.  She also runs a small store.

She has a lot of experience in this work because she has been doing this for the past 10 years.  Due to the high poverty index of her parents, she could not study and therefore could not choose other work.  Apart from this work, she works selling pupusas on the weekends.  

María is requesting the loan to improve the oven and the structure where she works making the bread.  She also wants to stock her small store and buy ingredients for her business.  She dreams of having a bigger business in which she could involve her children, so they could get ahead together.

loans.use: to improve the oven and the structure where she works making bread, to stock her small store, and to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is a distributor of soft drinks and had general store. It’s been seven years that he runs this kind of business. Paulino also offers bottled gasoline and had rice farm land.

With his determination to increase the stocks of soft drinks, grocery items and gasoline he is asking for additional capital of PHP20,000. He knows that through this amount of loan, he could increase his income and supply all his customer with soft drinks and other grocery items he offers within his locality.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items such as soft drinks,gasoline and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her son in Shahumyan village of Lori region. She is divorced.  The care of his school-aged son is her duty and her hardship to overcome. Susanna graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and already 36 years she works of her profession; at the village school she is a teacher of secondary classes. At her house she also gives paid private courses of Armenian Language and Literature. Susanna helps those pupils to get prepared for the entrance exams, who decided to continue their education in higher pedagogical institutions. 

She will be thankful and happy of Kiva lenders help her with loan amount, and she will buy computer and also professional literature and theses will be very useful for her private courses and make it more informative and useful for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature which will be very useful for her private courses in Armenian language and literature

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl, 34 years old, shows her vehicle repair shop located in Oton, Iloilo. It is the main source of her family’s livelihood. She’s been operating this business for six years now, and she pays one worker to do the manual work. She’s the one who transacts with clients and vehicle owners, does the estimation, purchasing, cashiering, and management of the shop. She also owns a tricycle that her husband, Vicente, drives as a secondary source of income. They have children who are still in elementary school, and they work hard to prepare for the huge educational expenses coming their way. 

Lately, her compressor started to malfunction due to long-time use. She aims to buy a new one to efficiently operate her shop. She is also running out of spare parts these days. Even her own tricycle that broke down and became idle for days lacks the necessary parts to function well. 

The situation diminishes their daily financial support affecting their food sustenance and allowances. She humbly asks your assistance in the amount of PHP 27,000 that she will use to buy a new compressor and spare parts. This will help sustain their everyday needs and the continuous operation of her business. She dreams to see her children graduate from college and obtain a stable job. 

She shares her experiences with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a new compressor and vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Jolen

texts.en:
You might be the answer to Jolen’s prayers!

Here is Jolen, a 41-year-old woman from Oton, Iloilo. She is married to Tomas, a 45-year-old mechanic who is also her business buddy. They have children who are in college and elementary levels.

Jolen operates a vehicle repair shop with his husband as the main worker. Her usual clients are vehicle owners in their community and public utility vehicle drivers who pass by regularly. Her income provides for their everyday needs and educational expenses of their children. However, due to familiarity, her usual clients can request for delayed payments that depletes her capital. Now she needs to replenish her stock of spare parts for vehicles and a generator. She wants to take out a loan worth PHP 26,000 to buy all these. This additional capital will ensure the continuous operation of her shop despite those collectibles. Your support would be gratefully appreciated. May God return more blessings to you.

Jolen gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and a generator

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
She is Nerissa, 49 years old from Oton, Iloilo. She’s living with Renato, a 55-year-old farmer. Since their children are no longer dependent on them, Nerissa focuses her attention to nurturing her hog business. She chose this enterprise because it provides reasonably-priced food for the community. 

She’s been in this venture for eight years, and she’s convinced that it is beneficial for her and for other people. Although the return of investment comes after several months, she is happy to run this endeavor. She is planning to expand her business by buying additional piglets and feed. 

She is requesting a PhP 12,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit and boost her savings. As early as now, she wants to prepare for her and her partner’s retirement, because she doesn’t want to depend on their children who are raising their own families too. 

She is a committed member of CCT Credit Cooperative and regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 56 years old. He is a Palestinian refugee and a married father of two children. Ahmad has special needs, but he works hard so that his medical situation doesn't stop him from providing his family with a better living situation. He lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp with his family. 

Three years ago he opened a grocery store to provide his family with daily income. He used to work in the scrap business, but the income was barely enough to cover his family's daily living requirements. Since his family's needs are increasing, Ahmad decided to start an additional business.
 
He decided to acquire a DAMJ loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua (which is specialized to support people with special needs) to open a new business: a coffee shop, where he can provide several services that will help him increase his income.

He hopes to stay capable of diversifying his income so that he can manage to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: To open a coffee shop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 45 years old, she has 3 children to provide for. She is peacefully separated to his husband, and she's the one supporting and providing the needs of her children. To earn for a living and to sustain their living condition she  engage in selling used clothes. 

She wants to improve and expand her business, that's why she decided to  borrowed loan to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell. Her plan in the future is to improve her business and to support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm so as to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to expand his farming.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 40-year-old married woman who helps her husband working on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this this since she got married. Banana farming is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. In the future, she wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 59 years old and is a widow with 5 children. She runs a retail shop and has been in the business for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, rice, flour,salt and cooking paraffin for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family. 

She will use the generated profits from the expanded business to buy more stock of goods for sell in the shop and pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes are to expand her business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, rice, flour,salt and cooking paraffin for sell and hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more milk, bread and yoghurt for sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is married, 39 years old, and has four children. She has been running her sari-sari store (general store) for the past eight years. She has been earning more income than she expected with her business. She has been able to send her children to school and provide for her family's needs. She wants to increase and expand her business. She is borrowing a loan to buy more goods to sell so that she will have more income, which she will use for educating her children. 

Nena’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mrutyunjay

texts.en:
Mrutyunjay lives in Tangi with his mother and a younger sister. He is a 22-year-old single boy. He is a bachelor’s student majoring in Banking Diploma (PGDBM) from Times Pro. Mrutyunjay chose this major because it is easier to find jobs in this field at this time.

He has been facing some financial problems that prevented him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. Thus, he has applied for an education loan of 60,000 INR to help him pay for his course fees.

Mrutyunjay always has felt supported with the help of his mother, who is a single mother. His mother is doing tailoring and overnight work so as to make her son study and mend his household expenses. As the years go on, he feels more excited about his studies, for which he wants to have all of the necessary tools to continue being an excellent student.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan to pay for his banking course fees. He aspires to pursue a technical career after finishing his undergraduate degree.

loans.use: to pay his course fees.

loans.name: Jesus Armando

texts.es:
Jesús Armando es un caficultor de 45 años, el lleva 30 años en el campo de la producción de café y cada día pone en práctica nuevas técnica de producción, Jesús Armando está casado con Iris Esperanza con quien tiene 3 hijos y su mayor sueño es poder darles a sus pequeños la mejor educación y calidad de vida posible.
Jesús Armando quiere producir café orgánico lo que es una novedad en la región que permite tener mejores precios por el café que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, la certificación de las fincas a parte de dar mejores ganancias en precio ayuda a tener producciones más abundantes y a proteger el medioambiente por medio de buenas prácticas agrícolas y aprovechando que las plagas tienen casi acabadas sus fincas aprovechara para replantarlas e iniciar la certificación con la plantación desde el inicio.
Jesús Armando solicita un crédito para convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mejores ganancias por el café y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Jesús Armando a certificar su cafetal lo que le permitirá tener mejores cosechas, mejores precios por el café y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús Armando is a 45 year old coffee producer. He has 30 years experience growing coffee and every day he puts new production techniques into practice. Jesús Armando is married to Iris Esperanza with whom he has three children. His biggest dream is to provide his young ones with the best education and highest quality of living possible.

Jesús Armando wants to produce organic coffee which is a novelty in the region which would allow him to obtain higher prices for the coffee he sells through COCAFCAL. The certification of these farms, in addition to providing greater profits in the price, helps to obtain more abundant production and to protect the environment through good agricultural practices. Taking advantage that the infestations are almost over these farms can replant and start the certification of the plants from the beginning.

Jesús Armando is requesting a loan to convert his coffee crops to organic production which will allow him to obtain higher profits for his coffee and provide better opportunities for his family.

A loan will help Jesús Armando to certify his coffee plantation which will allow him larger harvests and better prices for his coffee and in the end a higher quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to convert his coffee crops to organic such as: coffee plants, organic fertilizer and pay for labor amongst others.

loans.name: Suryakanta

texts.en:
Suryakanta lives in Dhenkanal town with his parents and two siblings. He is a 25-year-old man and is a bachelor’s student majoring in Banking Diploma (PGDMA) from Times Pro. Suryakanta chose this major because he always had an interest in this course and wanted to build a career in the banking profession.

As he is not financially sound enough, he has been facing problems that prevented him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. Thus, he has applied for an education loan of 80,000 INR to pay his course fees.

Suryakanta has always felt supported by the help of his father, who is a farmer. Suryakanta has a dream of becoming a senior manager in a leading bank and providing all the luxuries to his family.

loans.use: to pay his course fees.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a sari-sari store owner in Calape, Bohol. She is married with two young children ages six and one year old. Her husband is working abroad to earn a living. In the future, she wishes to improve her business for sustainability. 

With this, Gemma is asking a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, laundry soap, bath soap, chips, biscuits, candies, diapers, cooking oil, spices, eggs, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink. This she has been doing this for six years.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, laundry soap, bath soap, chips, biscuits, candies, diapers, cooking oil, spices, eggs, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a 42-year-old woman from Calape Bohol. She is married with four children. Her oldest child is 20 years old while her youngest child is seven years old. To earn a living Gleceria and her husband is running a tricycle for fifteen years. Aside from this, Gleceria’s husband is a fisherman and works hard for their family. 

Gleceria is asking a loan of PHP6000 for her tricycle maintenance. In the future, Gleceria dreams to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Damayanti Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, five self-dependent women of Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, of Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Damayanti. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social relations by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Ashalata is the most dynamic and vigorous lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a joint-liability group. This exceptional lady, aged about 39 years, is sitting in front of the group members and behind her tailoring machine with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high aspirations. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last six years, Ashalata has been engaged in the tailoring profession with the help and full support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 7,500 from her current occupation. But, the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family, so she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan.

She will purchase a tailoring machine and a huge quantity of cloth and related items. She will prepare readymade dress materials, for kids especially, which will bring a difference in the profession in the locality. Through this, Ashalata hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other four members of the group have also engaged themselves in different small businesses like tailoring, a snacks business, a dairy farm, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a huge quantity of cloth and related items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 63 years old and operates a mango farming/production business. This is her major source of income together with her husband & 2 adult age children. She is into this type of business for more than 20 years. She was able to sustain this type of business because she was supported financially by Paglaum MPC where she is a Microfinance member. Aside from the financial support, she also get farming training from the cooperative. 

She is grateful with the fortune she have now and she wants to employ more of her jobless neighbors. This time, she ask for a loan of PHP 40,000.00 to purchase insecticides, water pump & sprayer, paper bags and others for mango farming.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, water pump & sprayer, paper bags and others for mango farming

loans.name: Jenayda

texts.en:
Jenayda has a small sari-sari store in Calape, Bohol. She is 33 years old with two daughters ages 11 and seven years old. Her husband is carpenter and works hard to provide their needs. Jenayda wants to improve her sari-sari store business. 

She has been doing this for a year. In the future, she wishes to have a big and a better place for her business. With this, she is asking a loan to buy more grocery items such as sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, biscuits, chips, bread, toiletries, cooking oil, spices and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, biscuits, chips, bread, toiletries, cooking oil, spices and canned goods

loans.name: Snehajit

texts.en:
Snehajit, 23, hails from Dhenkanal. He is a bachelor’s student majoring in Banking Diploma (PGDBM) from IFBI. Snehajit chose this major due to the huge job opportunities available in this sector.

He has been facing financial hurdles that prevented him from paying his university fees and completing his studies; moreover, he wanted to self-finance his study instead of being dependent upon his mother and brother. Thus, he has applied for an education loan of 60,000 INR to help him pay for his course fees.

Snehajit has felt supported by the help of his mother, who is a single mother. His mother is a pension holder, and his brother is doing lectureship. With this loan amount, he believes that he will successfully complete his course and get a good job. He has also assured that he will be repaying the rest of his installments in due course of time.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for his higher education

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he left school at early age and started seven years ago working with his brothers in furniture making to cover his needs and expenses.
 
Mohammad is a hard worker and ambitious man who decided few months ago to start working on his own. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools which will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better service.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools which will facilitate his furniture making business

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar is a light hearted woman, who was born in northern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is lives and works in small town, at Khujand State University, where she is a tutor of physics. She has been a widow for many years and brought up her 2 children alone. 

She has a daughter who is sick and it is not curable. She depends on her care and support. Sanobar wants to get a loan to treat her daughter. Her daughter needs annual course of treatment. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to treat her daughter

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, vende y repara celulares, en su negocio ofrece diferentes accesorios para celulares y chips, dicho negocio es su fuente de ingresos, tiene más de cinco años de haberlo abierto; vive en casa familiar, junto a su madre y una hermana de 50 y 18 años de edad respectivamente.
Sus productos tienen una demanda considerable, por lo que decidió solicitar un crédito para comprar celulares, protectores, chips, cargadores, etc., incrementara su inventario para atender mejor a sus clientes y tener un negocio más competitivo.
Sus sueños son tener otro punto de ventas para incrementar sus ingresos y así tener la facilidad para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José sells and repairs cell phones. In his business he offers different accessories for cell phones and chips. This business is his source of income, which he opened more than 5 years ago. He lives at home with his mother and sister, who are 50 and 18 years old, respectively. 

There is a considerable demand for his products, which is why he decided to apply for a loan to buy cell phones, protectors, chips, chargers, etc. He will increase his inventory to better serve his customers and have a more competitive business. 

His dream is to open another store so that he can earn a higher income and be able to finish school.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, protectors, chips, chargers, etc. He will increase his inventory to better serve his customers.

loans.name: Madhu Group

texts.en:
The Madhu Group was formed in the year 2015 at Baramunda, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India. They are six active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Ashalata is one of them. She has taken a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting in front of her group behind her tailoring machine with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 48 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and two children.

Ashalata has been engaged in a tailoring business at Baramunda for the last five years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 6,500 INR. Her opinion is that her income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence, there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. She planned to improve her business over the course of the loan, which results in her taking taken the loan to purchase a zigzag sewing machine from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different businesses like a betel shop, a sari business and a tailoring business. With this loan they also hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a zigzag sewing machine from the local market.

loans.name: Rukmani Group

texts.en:
The Rukmani group was formed in the year 2015 at Harijan basti, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are five active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Sonu is one of them who taken a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting at the extreme left with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 30 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and two children.

Sonu has been engaged in a sari business from her home for the last four years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence, there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. She planned to improve her business over the course of the loan, which resulted in her taking the loan and purchasing a huge quantity of saris from the wholesale market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion, save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like coconuts, tailoring, eggs and vegetable vending. With this loan, they hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of saris

loans.name: Nikklus

texts.en:
Nikklus is 46 years old. He is married and has 6 children. 

He sells second-hand shoes and also does farming. He has been in these businesses for 6 years. 

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy additional stock of second-hand shoes to sell.

He will use profits from the business to  pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a large business that generates a lot of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Julia es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia en especial de su hijo, poco a poco ha ido incrementando las ventas de comida y refresco que ofrece a sus clientes. Para seguir prosperando en su negocio Doña Julia solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos tales como arroz, frijol, aceite, frutas entre otros. Con las ganancias obtenidas podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Julia is a woman who has succeeded in getting ahead with the support of her family, especially her son.  Little by little, she has been increasing her sales of food and beverages that she offers to her customers.  To continue prospering in her business, Julia is requesting a loan to purchase staple goods like rice, beans, oil, and fruit among others.  With the income she obtains, she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods like rice, beans, oil, and fruit among others.

loans.name: Riya Group

texts.en:
Riya Group was started in the year 2015 at Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, of Khurda district, Odisha, India. These are six active, self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of this group have their own profession and business.

Prabhati is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members’ employment improvement. She is seated in front of the group with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 42 years old and living with her small family, her husband and one child.

She has been engaged in a tailoring business in her own home for five years. Her husband is also helping her to support the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 6,000 INR. Her opinion is that, from this small income, it is very difficult to maintain her family in this urban city area like Bhubaneswar. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So, she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to access a loan for the expansion of her business.

Prabhati planned to purchase some readymade dress materials for kids and ladies to sell as per the demand of the customers. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money to rebuild another shop, and to provide better education to her children.

The other five members of the group are also smart at their professions and are also actively engaged with different professions like a grocery shop, medicine shop, and tailoring shop, and hope to make their livelihoods better.

loans.use: to purchase some readymade dress materials for kids and ladies.

loans.name: Gopala Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, six independent women from Baramunda, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Gopala. The main objective is to get economic security through expanding their existing businesses and developing their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Basumati is the most active and energetic lady in the concerned village and took a decision to improve herself. The outstanding lady’s age is about 38 years and she is standing second from the left hand side with her hand raised in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For 12 years, she has been engaged in dairy farming with the help and support of her family. She earns a monthly income of Rs 8,000/- from her occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business by debt in the form of loan. After taking the loan from Mahashakti Foundation, she will purchase another two or three cows from the nearest wholesale market. Through this, she hopes that it will definitely generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other five members of the group are also engaged in different small businesses like vegetable vending, tailoring and milk selling. They also can develop themselves through post loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase another two or three cows.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta tiene 35 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 14 y 13 años de edad. Marta se dedica al arte de confección y costura, actividad que realiza diariamente desde hacen un buen tiempo y es así como ella cubre sus necesidades básicas. Marta  solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para poder reparar el techo de su hogar porque no está en buenas condiciones. Ella invertirá en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y pines para reparar el techo lo antes que la época de invierno llegue y además así podrá brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 35 years old. She lives very happily in her own house along with her husband and their 14 and 13 year-old children. Marta bakes and sews, activities which she has done daily for a long time, and which cover her basic necessities.

Marta is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to repair the roof of her house, because it’s not in good condition. She will buy galvanized metal roofing, wood, and pins for repairing the roof as soon as possible, before winter comes. This way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing, wood, and pins for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Kasturi Group

texts.en:
The Kasturi group was formed in the year 2015 in Harijan basti, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are five active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Kasturi has taken a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is standing at the extreme left with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 29 years old and lives with her small family consisting of her husband and two children.

Kasturi has been engaged in a betel shop from her home for the last four years. She also tries to fulfill the other demands of her customers for items like snacks, eggs and cosmetic items. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. She plans to improve her business over the course of the loan, which will result in her taking the loan and purchasing a huge quantity of betel and related materials as well as snacks and cosmetic items. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion, save money for the construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged in different businesses like eggs, snacks and vegetable vending with this loan, and hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of betel and related materials as well as snacks and cosmetic items.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 52 años de edad, no estudio porque la escuela le quedaba muy lejos, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos pero solo su hija aún vive con ellos y les ayuda en los oficios de la casa.

María, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a los oficios de su casa y a ayudar a su esposo en la agricultura, ellos cultivan 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros de frijol, ella tiene que trasladarse 20 minutos para ir a dejar los alimentos a su esposo al trabajo y luego se queda ayudandole para realizar más trabajos.
 
Este crédito será destinado para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz y frijoles, porque para ellos es la mejor cosecha del año. 

María, sueña con tener una mejor estabilidad económica, para dejarla como patrimonio para su hija.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old. She didn’t study because the school was too far away. She is married. He husband is a farmer. She has two children, but only their daughter still lives with them and she helps them out with the household tasks. 

María is a very hardworking person. She works at the household tasks and also helps her husband with the farming. They cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 square meters of beans. She has to walk 20 minutes to the fields to take food to her husband and then stays to help him so they can get more work done.

This loan will be for buying agricultural inputs such as manure, insecticides, and herbicides in order to plant corn and beans, because these are their best harvests of the year. 

María dreams of having more economic stability and of leaving something behind for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides in order to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Itishree Group

texts.en:
The Itishree Group was formed in the year 2015 at Harijan basti, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India. There are five active independent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Mamata is one of them. She has taken a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. She is sitting on the extreme left with her hand raised in the photo. She is about 29 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and two children.

Mamata has been engaged in a sari business from her home for the last four years. Her husband is helping her to sponsor the business. Through the concerned business, she earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Her opinion is that the income is not sufficient to maintain her family and hence there is almost zero surplus at the end of the month. She plans to improve her business over the course of her loan, which results in her taking the loan and purchasing a huge quantity of saris from the wholesale market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion, save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and actively engaged with different business like rice, snacks and vegetable vending with this loan, and hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of saris.

loans.name: Diosis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Diosis, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, dejo de hacerlo porque tenía que ayudarle a su madre, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el campo y tiene 3 hijos.

Diosis, es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para toda la familia, ella lo hace de casa en casa desde hace varios años, porque su madre también se dedicaba a esta misma actividad y cuando ella sale a comprar más mercadería su esposo le ayuda a vender.

Diosis, está solicitando un crédito para comprar más mercadería, porque se quedó sin capital de trabajo y necesita comprar más ropa para continuar con su negocio.

Ella sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y en un futuro alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Diosis is 27 years old. She studied through sixth grade, but left school because she had to help her mother. She is married with 3 children and her husband earns a living working in the fields.


Diosis is a very hardworking woman. She earns a living buying and selling clothing for the whole family. She has done this work from her home for many years because her mother was in the same line of work. When she goes out to buy more merchandise her husband helps her to sell.

 
Diosis is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise because she ran out of working capital and needs to buy more clothing to continue her business. 


She dreams of being able to expand her business and support her children so that they can go to school and achieve their dreams in the future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Leonel

texts.es:
Jorge Leonel es un caficultor de 39 años, el lleva 20 años en el campo de la producción de café y cada día pone en práctica nuevas técnica de producción, Jorge Leonel está casado y tiene 2 hijos y su mayor sueño es poder darles a sus pequeños la mejor educación y calidad de vida posible.
Jorge Leonel quiere producir café orgánico lo que es una novedad en la región ya que permite tener mejores precios por el café que comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL, la certificación de las fincas a parte de dar mejores ganancias en precio ayuda a tener producciones más abundantes y a proteger el medioambiente por medio de buenas prácticas agrícolas y aprovechando que las plagas tienen casi acabadas sus fincas aprovechara para replantarlas e iniciar la certificación con la plantación desde el inicio.
Jorge Leonel solicita un crédito para convertir sus fincas a producción orgánica lo que le permitirá tener mejores ganancias por el café y darle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
Un crédito ayudara a Jorge Leonel a certificar su cafetal lo que le permitirá tener mejores cosechas, mejores precios por el café y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
39-year old Jorge Leonel grows coffee, a job he's had for 20 years. Every day he tries out new production techniques. He is married with two children. His greatest dream is to provide his children with the best education and quality of life possible.

Jorge Lionel wishes to produce organic coffee, a new product in the region. It would allow him to charge higher prices for his coffee which he sells through COCAFCAL, appropriate certification for his fields, increased earnings, higher production, and protect the environment through good agricultural practices. As disease has almost been wiped out, he would take advantage of the situation and replant his fields, and began the certification process at the outset.

Jorge Lionel is seeking a loan to convert his fields to organic coffee plants. This will allow him to earn more money and provide greater opportunities to his family. The loan money will help him get certification for his crop leading to a better harvest, improved prices, and finally a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy organic manure, insecticide, and coffee plants to convert his fields to growing organic coffee

loans.name: Saibaba Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, six independent women from Baramunda, Bhubaneswar in the Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Saibaba. The main objective is to get economic security through expanding their existing businesses and developing their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Sulochana is the most active and energetic lady of the concerned village and has taken a decision to improve herself. The outstanding lady’s age is about 44 years and she is standing at the extreme left with her hand raised in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For 12 years, she has been engaged in a dairy farm with the help and support of her family. She earns a monthly income of Rs 8,500/- from her occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business by taking a loan.

After taking the loan from Mahashakti Foundation she will purchase another two or three cows from the nearest wholesale market. Through this, she hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other five members of the group are also engaged in different small businesses like fruit, snacks, tailoring and milk selling. They also can develop themselves through post loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase another two or three cows.

loans.name: Exsi Esther

texts.es: Exsi de 64 años es una comerciante con una amplia trayectoria, ella inició esta actividad por una propuesta que recibió en una visita de unas promotoras de ventas por catálogos que lograron convencerla e incorporarla  y tan pronto como empezó a vender, su éxito no se hizo esperar, tanto que amplio su gama de productos e incorporó prendas de vestir, calzado y productos de nutrición elaborados a base de frutas y plantas medicinales.  Todos los días dedica cuatro horas a su gestión comercial y como su meta es posicionarse en un rango más alto para obtener más ingresos, ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en más surtido de productos naturales como malteadas, té, y demás.  Exsi sueña con tener un negocio familiar y afiliar a un gran número de personas para que incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Exsi is 62 years old. She is a merchant who sells a lot of different things. She started this business after hearing a proposal from visiting promoters of catalog sales who convinced her to join as soon as she started selling. Success did not make her wait, as her range of products was large, including clothing items, shoes, and nutritional products based on fruits and medicinal plants. Every day she spends four hours on her sales and her goal is to position herself in a higher range so she can earn better profits. 

She is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy more inventory of natural products such as shakes, teas, and other things. Exsi dreams of having a family business and recruiting a large number of people so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of natural products such as shakes, teas, and other things.

loans.name: Ana Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa, trabaja desde que estaba muy pequeña estudiaba y trabajaba con su madre, estudio hasta noveno grado y tiene 2 hijos.
