Narcisa, labora como empleada en un comedor en una universidad a 25 kilómetros de su casa, tiene que madrugar porque le exigen que este a las 5:00 de la mañana en el lugar, para empezar a preparar los productos para la venta, por las tardes se dedica a preparar pupusas y otros antojitos para vender, porque cerca de su casa hay una iglesia y tiene la posibilidad de vender a los que llegan a dicho lugar, mientras que su hijo mayor le ayuda a vender en la tienda que tiene en su casa, donde obtiene otro ingreso para su familia.

Los fondos de este crédito los necesita para ampliar su tienda, ya que los productos que tiene ya no le son suficientes para la demanda que tiene en la zona.

Ella sueño con poder ampliar sus negocios y sacar adelante a su hijo menor para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Narcisa has worked since she was very small.  She studied and worked with her mother.  She has a ninth grade education and 2 children.  

Narcisa works as an employee in a cafeteria at a university 25 kilometers from her home.  She has to get up early because she is expected to be at work at 5:00 in the morning, to start to prepare the food to sell.  In the afternoons, she works preparing pupusas and other snacks to sell, because near her home there is a church and she has the possibility of selling there, while her eldest son helps her sell from the store that she has in her home, where she obtains further income for her family. 

She needs the funds from this loan to expand her store, since the products she has are not sufficient to the demands that this location has. She dreams of being able to expand her businesses and help her youngest son to get ahead so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Edita Ismelda

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo cultiva plátanos y también cría animales para la venta.
Doña Edita realiza el crédito para ella y su esposo, él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra plátanos, cacao, frutas (naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, etc.) todo el año,  se dedica a esta actividad por la mañana. También ocupan dos horas diarias en la cría cerdos y pollos, los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los cerdos los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 30 años dedicado a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar cerdos, balanceados, vacunas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. Esta hace tres años en el Grupo de Crédito, le gusta la unión del grupo. Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su casa y arreglar los lugares donde crían y guardan a los animales.
texts.en:
In the cantón of El Carmen, where the members of the “Unión y Progreso” loan group meet every 15 days, the main source of income is farming the Barraganete variety of plantain.

This is where Edita lives. She is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 grown children who are economically independent. Her husband farms plantains and also raises animals for sale.

Edita is taking out the loan for her husband. He works in agriculture, farming plantains, cacao, and fruits (oranges, tangerines, papayas, etc.) all year long. He works at this in the mornings. He also spends two hours per day raising pigs and chickens. He raises them for three months, which is the time needed for them to be ready for sale. After this time, he sells them to stores in the area. He also sells them by the pound and “on the hoof” to a buyer who comes to his house. He butchers the pigs and then sells them by the pound. He has been in this business for 30 years and it has gone very well for him.

This loan will be used to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines, and fertilizers and manure for his crops. She has been in the communal loan group for three years and she likes the unity of the group. 

Her dream is finish construction of her house and to fix up the areas where they raise and care for their animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines, and fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 45 years old, and she has 3 children to provide for. She is separated from her husband.  

For the past ten years, Maridel's store has been doing really well. She really works hard in order to support her children and keep them in school. 

So, to improve her business and earn more, Maridel took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She is planning  to expand her store in order to earn more income to provide for her family's needs.

Maridel’s plan for her future is to sustain her family's daily needs and to save money for the bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia Gabriela

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 12, 7, 4 y 2  años de edad, 2 estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de frutas y verduras. Viven en una casa prestada de los suegros.
Doña Celia se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, se dedica 4 horas diaria a esta actividad, los cerdos son faenados y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 2 años a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa. Su esposo compra y vende verduras, esta actividad la realiza por 6 horas diarias de martes a domingos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, balanceados, vacunas, etc. Es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito grupo y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Su sueño es  tener casa propia y terminar sus estudios de enfermería.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Progreso credit group meet every two weeks in the canton of El Carmen. One of the local main sources of income is growing a variety of banana called Barraganete.

Sra, Celia lives here. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children aged 12, 7, 4 and 2. Two of them attend school. She earns her living raising pigs and poultry and has a small corral in her house. Every day she spends four hours tending the animals. After the pigs are slaughtered, the meat is sold by the pound. Celia has been doing this work for two years, and all is going well as she can work from home. Her husband buys and sells vegetables, a job he does for 6 hours daily from Tuesday to Sunday.

She is planning to use this new loan to buy pigs, special feed, vaccines etc. This is her second loan cycle with her credit group, and she is very happy as the members have helped her a great deal.  Her dream is to have a house of her own and finish her nursing studies.

loans.use: buy pigs, special feed, vaccines etc.

loans.name: Estela Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth, de 33 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, vive con su madre, está soltera y compra y vende pescado fresco.

Yamileth, trabaja en compañía de su madre vendiendo pescado extraído de laguna que está cercana a su casa, ella lo vende  a la orilla de la calle, porque ahí pasan muchas personas, pero cuando termina de vender el pescado, se dedica a vender frescos, panes y tostadas en el mismo lugar todos los días para ayudar a su familia y los días sábados se dedica a vender pan de casa en casa.- Pero además por las tardes elabora pupusas; ella ha trabajado desde que estaba muy pequeña, porque su madre le inculco el valor de la responsabilidad y de trabajar y granarse el dinero con mucho esfuerzo.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar más mercadería para preparar los alimentos que vende y para comprar una plancha para elaborar pupusas, porque la que tiene ya está bastante dañada.

Su deseo es ayudar a sus padres en los gastos familiares y en un futuro lograr poner su propio negocio de manera formal.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 33 years old and only studied until the ninth grade due to her parents’ lack of resources. She is single and lives with her mother. She buys and sells fresh fish.


Yamileth works in her mother’s business selling fish from the lagoon near her house. She sells fish from the sidewalk of her street because many people pass by there. When she finishes selling the fish she sells drinks, bread, and tostadas [a traditional snack] in the same place every day in order to help her family. On Saturdays she sells bread door to door. In addition she sells pupusas [a thick, stuffed corn tortilla]. She has been working since she was very small because her mother instilled in her the value of responsibility, work and earning money with lots of effort. 


The loan funds will be used to buy more merchandise to prepare the foods she sells and to buy a new griddle to prepare pupusas because the one she has is damaged. 


Her wish is to help her parents with family costs and in the future to be able to start her own formal business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to prepare the foods she sells and to buy a new griddle to prepare pupusas

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is thankful for her first Kiva loan and partnership, and she hopes that this second one will also be profitable for her business, and family as well. 

Anna lives with her husband and 2 sons in Vanadzor city in the Lori region of Armenia. Their youngest son is now in the army performing his military service. All her family members are employed, and Anna also helps her family greatly with her business income. 

At the Vanadzor wholesale market, Anna rents a cute stall where she sells curtains, covers and towels, and women and children's clothing. She mentions that, thanks to her number of regular customers, she has been able to maintain her business already for many years now.
 
Anna is requesting her second Kiva loan for the purchase of mannequins to nicely display her assortment of clothing in her stall and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase mannequins to nicely display her assortment of clothing in her stall.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 49 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He sells caps and clothing and has been in this business for 15 years. 

Patrick will use this loan to buy caps and jackets to sell, and he hopes this will enable him to earn more income so he can educate his children. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his children's school fees. 

Patrick's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business, earn more income, and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy caps and jackets to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 54 years old, married and has 4 children to provide for.  She owns a small cafeteria which has started 7 years ago.This business becomes their main source of income.To attract more customers, she plans of putting up additional food and drinks with some new recipes. So she took a loan for that purpose.

As future plans, she hopes to expand her business and be able to meet the needs of her children in sending them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, with  new recipes, to sell

loans.name: Jorge Edson

texts.es: Jorge de 51 años es un fotógrafo que se inició en esta actividad, instruido por un vecino que ofrecía estos servicio, él lo acompañaba en los recorridos por las calles de Barranquilla, ofreciendo puerta a puerta estudios fotográficos y como se destacó en esta actividad,  su vecino decidió contratarlo y llevarlo hasta el municipio de Montería en donde duraron dos meses trabajado y luego retornaron a Barranquilla.  Confiado en su buena labor,  lo dejó con otros dos colaboradores prestando los servicios, pero Jorge sintió que debía independizarse.  Un primo le prestó una cámara fotográfica con la que laboró por un tiempo, mientras con sus utilidades logró comprarse su herramienta de trabajo.  Hoy en día ofrece sus servicios en poblaciones del Atlántico y con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un computador, paraguas de iluminación fotográfica, dos flash  y fondos decorativos, con esta inversión va a organizar su estudio fotográfico y con ello presentará mejores trabajos y obtendrá mayores recomendaciones.  Su meta a futuro es adecuar su vivienda y continuar construyendo sobre toda la extensión de su terreno.
texts.en:
Jorge is 51 years old and is a photographer. He began in this field with instruction from a neighbor who offered these services. He went with is neighbor on his rounds of the streets of Barranquilla, offering photography studios. Because he stood out in this business his neighbor decided to hire him and take him to the town of Montería where they worked for two months and then returned to Barranquilla. 


Trusting Jorge’s good work, the neighbor left him with two other coworkers providing these services, but Jorge felt he should become independent. A cousin loaned him a photography camera that he had used for some time, and meanwhile he was able to buy work equipment with his income. 


Today he offers his services to people in the department of Atlántico. With hopes of improving the quality of his work, he is applying for his first Kiva Loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy a computer, a photography lighting umbrella, two flashes, and decorative backgrounds. With this investment he is going to set up a photography studio so that he can offer better work and will get more recommendations. His goal is to tailor his home and continue building on his stretch of land.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a photography lighting umbrella, two flashes, and decorative backgrounds.

loans.name: Sokhea's Group

texts.en: Sokhea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhea makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a seller and as a teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Franca Clemencia

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Clemencia, tiene 62 años de edad y  está viuda,  tiene 10 hijos  mayores de edad e independientes. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Clemencia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y sabanas,  trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4 años a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los conjuntos de sabanas.
Este crédito es para comprar conjuntos de sabanas, ropa y zapatos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un almacén en su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet in El Carmen canton, where one of the primary sources of income is cultivation of the barraganete variety of plantains.

Clemencia lives in this place, she is 62 years old and a widow. She has 10 adult children who are independent. They live in their own houses. Clemencia is a homemaker who, to earn her own income and with this be able to help with the household expenses, works selling clothing and sheets. She works three days a week from two to three hours per day. She leaves the products on credit and collects weekly. She has been doing this work for 4 years and it is going very well for her. She sells the most of sheet sets.

This loan is to purchase sheet sets, clothing and shoes. This is her second loan cycle in the loan group and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a shop in her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheet sets, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Audrey Marianela

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Audrey, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 6 hijos de 16, 14, 12, 11, 9 y 5  años los mismos que estudian en escuela y en el colegio. El cónyuge es jornalero, sembrador y criador de cerdos, gallinas, etc. Viven en casa arrendada.
Doña Audrey se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los cerdos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 1 año dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa. Su cónyuge tiene 16 años cultivando frutas de temporada.
Este nuevo crédito se lo va a dar a su cónyuge para que compre semillas y fertilizantes. Está en el  Grupo De Crédito hace un año y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son tener casa propia y viajar por el Ecuador con sus hijos
texts.en:
In the town of El Carmen, the members of the Credit Union and Progress group meet every 15 days.  One of the main sources of income in this area is the cultivation of Barraganate plantains.  

In this area lives Audrey, who is 36 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has 6 children, ages 16, 14, 12, 11, 9, and 5.  They are all in school.  Her partner is a day laborer, farmer, and raises pigs, chickens. etc.  They lived in a rented house.  Audrey works raises pigs and poultry.  She has a small farm in her house and during certain seasons, she buys a large quantity of chickens which she raises for 2 or 3 months, until they are ready to sell.  After that time, she delivers them to some stores in the area and also sells them by the pound on foot and to customers who come to her house.  By contrast, she slaughters the pigs and then sells the meat by the pound.  She has been working at this for a year and it has been going very well since it is a way to earn income from home.  

Her partner has been cultivating seasonal fruits for 16 years.  She will give this new loan to him to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  She has been part of the Credit Group for one year and is very happy because they have helped her a lot.  Her dreams are to have her own home and to travel through Ecuador with her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Melojean

texts.en:
Melojean is married and lives in Sibutad with her family where she has been selling barbecue to make a living. 

Melojean sells barbecue in her village and earns well for her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy ingredients. 

To meet her customers' current demands, Melojean recently took a new loan to buy additional ingredients for her barbecue business. She is happy to say that with this loan, she will be able to earn her desired income and to save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 29-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has seven year old daughter. Her husband works abroad to earn a living. While Joan has been engaged in making seashells craft for souvenir items and for house indoors decorations. She has been doing this business for four years.

In the future, Joan wants to improve her business for a better living. She is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy materials for seashells craft such as seashells, glue sticks and paints

loans.use: to buy seashells, glue sticks and paints

loans.name: Sokhob's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Sokhob is 60 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support only one schoolchild. Sokhob can earn income to improve her living condition via cassava growing on three hectares area and working for others for a fee to get more income. She did not have enough capital to support on her cassava farm, so that her cassava did not grow well. She has been involved her farm for 12 years and she can save her daily income about 29,900KHR per day. 

This is fourth cycle for Sokhob with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She can earn more income to improve her living condition as well from her previous loan. She leads a group of three members to borrow a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fee to support her cassava produce higher yield. She hopes this loan can help on her cassava farm to get good yield and return her good income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for plowing fee to support her cassava produce higher yield.

loans.name: Hilda Marianela

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Las Luchadoras, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Hilda, tiene38 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de los cuales dos son mayores de edad e independientes y tres de 17, 12 y 5 años de edad que estudian en colegio  y escuela. Ella vive en casa propia.
Doña Hilda para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados.  Tiene 4 años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 1 año y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su sueño es construir su casa en un terreno que tiene.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Las Luchadoras loan group meet in El Carmen canton, where one of the primary sources of income is cultivation of the barraganete variety of plantains.

Hilda lives in this place. She is 38 years old and is a single mother of 5 children of whom two are adults and independent and three, ages 17, 12, and 5, are students in secondary and primary school. She lives in her own house. 

Hilda, to get ahead with her family, has a grocery store in her house. There, she sells all sorts of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruits. She works every day from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm and sometimes later. Her children help her in her work when they can and are not busy. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. 

This loan will be used to stock her store more. She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other basic products. She has been in the loan group for one year and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group. Her dream is to build a house on land that she has.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts and other basic products.

loans.name: Chorrn's Group

texts.en: Chorrn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chorrn makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has three children between the ages of 9 and 13. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a butchery where he sells beef and goat meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to open other business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of meat to other retailers. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Chheng's Group

texts.en:
Chheng’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chheng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save both money otherwise spent on medical expenses and time used to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Gjele

texts.en:
Gjele is shown above in the photograph with her husband Ded.

Gjele's husband has been scheduled for surgery. They are seeking your compassion and your financial help to pay for this surgery.

loans.use: to pay for the surgery of her husband.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has 4 children who range in age from 7 years to 16 years. He describes himself as focused and disciplined. 

James operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. 

James describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use his 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics. 

James hopes that, in the future, he will have good living conditions and be able to educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: To earn a living, Marlene has been engaged in seashell crafts. She makes souvenirs and house decorations from seashells. She has been in this business for six years. Aside from this business she also sells bananas. Her husband is working hard as a fisherman and also a carpenter. They have several incomes to provide for the needs of their children. They have three children ages 13, 11 and 10 years old. In the future, Marlene wants to improve her business. Thus she is asking for a loan to buy materials for seashell crafts such as sea shells and glue sticks, and also to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sea shells and glue sticks, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en:
Sern’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Sern makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.en:
Shahriniso is a talented woman. She was born into a family of farmers in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is an emigrant and works in Russia. 

Shahriniso's parents did business in agriculture, keeping livestock and selling them in the domestic market. She decided to continue her parents’ activity and does business in feeding livestock. She has many years of practice in this field. 

Shahriniso hopes to buy additional calve and enlarge her business. She is planning to also do sheep shearing and sell their wool to make thread. 

Shahriniso appealed to IMON and Kiva's lenders to take a loan to buy calves. She awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Roxana Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Roxana, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años, uno estudia en la escuela. El cónyuge es agricultor. Viven en casa alquilada.
Doña Roxana se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa, en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los cerdos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 6 años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien ya que es una forma de ganar algo desde su casa. Su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura, siembra  verduras y hortalizas.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, alimentos y medicinas. Está en el  grupo de Crédito hace un años y está muy contenta ya que tiene la oportunidad de crecer y porque  le han ayudado mucho. Su sueñoes  tener una casa propia y una finca.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks in El Carmen canton, where one of the primary sources of income is the cultivation of barraganete variety plantains. 

Roxana lives in this place. She is 28 years old, and in a common-law marriage in which she has two children, ages 6 and 3. One is in primary school. Her spouse is a farmer. They live in a rented house.

Roxana works raising pigs and poultry. She has a small farm at her house. Seasonally, she purchases a large quantity of chickens which she raises for two to three months, which is the time for them to be ready for sale. After this time, she sells them to some stores in the area or also sells them by the pound and live to salespeople who come to her house. The pigs, on the other hand, she slaughters and later sells the meat by the pound. She has been doing this work for 6 years and it has gone fairly well for her, since it is a way to earn something from her house. Her spouse works in agriculture, growing vegetables. 

This new loan will be used to purchase pigs, feed, and medicine. She has been in the loan group for a year and is very happy since she has the opportunity to grow and because they have helped her a lot. Her dream is to have her own house and a farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Mercedes Aydee

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señorita Mercedes, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive con los padres.
Doña Mercedes se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en casa de sus padres, también es niñera de una niña desde las 8h00 am a 16h00.  Ella en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras y en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los cerdos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva muchos años dedicada a esta labor y le ha ido bastante bien. 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cerdos, gallinas, alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace dos años, le gusta porque el grupo es unido y está muy contenta porque le han ayudado mucho. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Progreso loan group meet every two weeks in El Carmen canton, where one of the primary sources of income is the cultivation of barraganete variety plantains. 

Mercedes lives in this place. She is 31 years old, single, and lives with her parents.

Mercedes works raising pigs and poultry, she has a small farm at her parents' house. She is also a nanny of a girl from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. Seasonally, she purchases a large quantity of chickens, which she raises for two to three months, which is the time for them to be ready for sale. After this time, she sells them to some stores in the area or also sells them by pound or live to salespeople who come to her house. The pigs, on the other hand, she slaughters, and later sells the meat by the pound. She has been doing this work for many years and it has gone rather well for her.

This new loan will be used to purchase pigs, chickens, feed, and medicines, for both the chickens and the pigs. She has been in the loan group for two years and she likes it because the group is close-knit and she is very happy because they have helped her a lot. Her dream is to purchase land to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chickens, feed and medicines.

loans.name: Hilda Iliana

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Las Luchadoras, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Hilda, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es agricultor. Viven en casa de los suegros.
Doña Hilda con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, cobra semanalmente y le encanta vender, esto lo viene realizando desde hace algún tiempo y  le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. También cría cerdos, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, ella los faena y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva algún tiempo a esta actividad y les ha ido bastante bien.
Con este crédito va a comprar cerdos, vacunas y balanceados y hacer arreglos en la chanchera. Está en el grupo de crédito hace varios ciclos ya que es socia fundadora y le gusta la fundación porque los créditos son rápidos y el grupo es unido. Su sueño es tener casa propia y tener una finca.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Las Luchadoras loan group meet in El Carmen canton, where one of the primary sources of income is cultivation of the barraganete variety of plantains.

Hilda lives in this place. She is 54 years old, and in a common-law marriage from which she has 3 adult and independent children. Her spouse is a farmer. They line in her in-laws' house. 

Hilda, with the end of having her own income, works selling products from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells from door to door and by orders, she collects weekly and she loves to sell. She has been doing this for some time and it has gone very well for her since she has a lot of customers. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes. She also raises pigs, she has a small farm at her house, she slaughters them and then sells them by weight. She has done this work for some time and it is going rather well for her.

With this loan, she will purchase pigs, vaccines, and balanced feed and make repairs to the pig sty. She has been in the loan group for some loan cycles now, since she is a founding member and she likes the foundation because the loans are quick and the group is close-knit. Her dream is to have her own house and have a farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, vaccines, and balanced feed, and to make repairs on the pig sty.

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Гулжамал по-прежнему работает в школе, 3 младших детей живут с ней и во всем помогают. Она повторно обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) с целью проведения ремонтных работ в доме, приобретет цемент, глину, доски и прочее. Свои доходы Гулжамал будет вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Gulzhamal successfully repaid her loan after using it as she had intended.  She is grateful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She is still working in a school and her youngest three children help her around the house.  She is once more turning to Bai Tushum and requesting a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to perform some home improvements in her house.  She will be buying cement, clay, boards etc.  She is planning to use her earnings to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, clay, bricks, and other construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Kalbyubyu

texts.ru: Калбюбю, 62 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода Калбюбю занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Калбюбю, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 21 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калбюбю обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для продажи экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Калбюбю планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку дома.
texts.en: Kalbyubyu is sixty two years old and married. She has a high school education. To earn an income Kalbyubyu raises animals, a business she began 20 years ago by purchasing 6,000 som (KGS) worth of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work Kalbyubyu today owns 21 sheep. Her monthly income is around 21,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business Kalbyubyu came to Bai-Tushum bank for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to buy dairy cows for production of eco-friendly milk. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her livestock herd, and building a house.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows for selling eco-friendly milk

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en: Seat’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Seat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Jahongir is a careful father. He is living in a small beautiful city called Khujand and is married and has three children. He works at the committee on emergency situations in the respirator position. Each day he helps and saves many people. His work is responsible and active. He likes to be helpful and responsible. 

He needs to have an operation on his eyes, because eyes are an important role in his job. He is applying to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to for pay his surgery. He awaits Kiva lenders support and compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his surgery operation on eyes

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth is a single woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile-phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to add M-pesa float. She hopes that in the future, she will open other business outlets. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 53 years old. She is married and she has 4 children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 13 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, tissue papers, paraffin and wheat flour for sale. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to grow her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil, tissue papers, paraffin and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Santa Concepción

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 64 años de edad y  está separada,  tiene ocho hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en casa propia.
Doña Santa con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas ya que hay más diseños y con estos aprende aún más, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Trabaja todos los días 5 horas diarias y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar una máquina de coser, telas y otros materiales para la costura. Su sueño es irse de viaje a otros países y ampliar su taller de costura.
texts.en:
In the town of El Carmen the group members of the communal bank called Union and Progress Credit meet together every two weeks.  In their town the principle source of income comes from growing plantains of the Barraganete variety. 

Santa lives in this town.  She is 64 years old and is separated.  She has 8 adult children who are all independent.  She lives in her own home.  With the goal of obtaining her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge of sewing she began a small seamstress shop in her home.  

She works making all types of clothing for women and since there are always new designs she keeps learning even more.  She works based on customer requests.  She works every day for five hours and sometimes for more time when she has orders to meet.  This new loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, fabric, and other materials for sewing.  Her dream is to be able to travel to other countries, and to grow her sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Maison

texts.en:
Maison is 22 years old. He is single and has no children. He has a potato farming business and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to buy potato seedlings and seeds for planting and hopes this will enable him to get more potato produce for sell and make more income to buy  land. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming business, make more income and buy more pieces of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and seeds for planting and hopes this will enable him to get more potato produce for sale and make more income to buy  land.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
Saumu has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Saumu dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour,cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items. This will enable her to increase sales. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within 5 years. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be self motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells plastic containers, jugs, basins. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers, utensils. Her business goal is to enlarge her business within 5 years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of plastic containers, utensils

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима из района Гиссар. Ей 57 лет. Она мать троих дочери. К сожалению, она потеряла мужа, и выросла детей сама одна. Дочери уже взрослые и семейные девушки. Салиме было тяжело прокормить и вырасти детей, но она старалась, не смотря ни на что. Салима сильная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она мастер швея. До сегодняшнего дна Салима занимается шитьем женской одежды в ателье. Салима выбрала себе достаточного опыта, и она решила открыть свой бизнес у себя дома, ей не выгодна заниматься в ателье. Салима хочет приобрести швейную машинку, чтобы поскорее начать зарабатывать. С такими планами она обратилась за кредитом. У нее мечта в будущем открыть себе новую точку шитья национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
Salima comes from the Gissar district of Tajikistan. She is 57 years old and the mother of three daughters. Unfortunately, she lost her husband and had to raise her children alone. Her daughters are adults now and they have their own families. Salima went through a difficult period of time raising and feeding her children, but she always did her best, in spite of the circumstances.

Salima is a strong and hardworking woman as well as a skilled seamstress. Until this day, she has been sewing women's clothes in a sewing shop. She has now acquired enough experience and she has decided to open her own business at home, since working in a workshop is not that convenient. She wants to buy a new sewing machine, so that she can quickly start to make a living. With this goal in mind, she is taking a loan. In the future, Salima is dreaming of opening her own shop, where she will be sewing traditional women's outfits.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and start her own business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a small remote city with her family. She is divorced and has a son. She is a businesswoman. She has been in business for about five years. She has a small store where she retails diverse items such as batteries, lanterns, hats, etc. She wants to enlarge her assortment and get a better income to have a good standard of living. She has requested a loan from IMON and Kiva to buy an additional assortment of items with her working capital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an additional assortment of items with her working capital

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: María  tiene  46 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus  dos hijos de 6   y 2 años de. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy laboriosa y responsable que junto a su esposo luchan a diario para salir adelante, ella posee una tienda  donde vende insumos básicos  de primera necesidad entre ellos: aceite, granos básicos, bebidas, jabón y otros, también tiene una pequeña granja de pollos la cual le brinda buenas ganancias y  además su esposo con su trabajo le permite obtener ingresos extras. María está solicitando un crédito FUSAI para poder comprar: lamina, pines, pilones y pago de mano de obra con  el fin de mejorar el techo de su hogar el cual en gran parte se encuentra deteriorado y así poder dar a su familia mayor protección y un lugar más digno para vivir.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her children ages 6 and 2. Maria is a hardworking and responsible woman who, alongside her husband, fights daily to survive. She has a store where she sells basic staple goods such as oil, basic grains, drinks, and soap, among other things. She also has a small chicken farm which produces good profits. Her husband’s work also provides extra income. 

Maria is asking for a FUSAI loan to be able to buy sheet metal, roofing beams, and fasteners, and to pay laborers in order to improve the roof on her house, which is deteriorated. This way she can provide her family with better protection and a more dignified place to live.

loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, roofing beams, fasteners, and payment for laborers in order to improve the roof on her house.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en: Mueni is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, bread, soap, cooking oil and other household items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old. She is married and has 4 children to support. She has been practicing tea farming for the last 7 years and she has been earning an income of KES10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan from KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more firm input such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields and the surplus to buy a dairy cow. 

She plans to use the anticipated loan to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more firm input such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields and the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man with eight children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a barber shop and has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy barber shop items. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop items

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al comercio informal, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias, solo tiene un nieto que está con él y su compañera de vida.

Jorge, trabaja en un camión que lo utiliza para hacer viajes de todo tipo y además se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura cultivando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, los viajes los hace dependiendo el lugar que lo soliciten y la agricultura la realiza en la temporada agrícola en época de invierno.- Pero aparte de todo eso también tiene una tienda en su casa y tiene también una compra y venta de cocos afuera de su casa a orilla de la calle, pero también sale a venderlos de casa en casa, porque los prepara, los mete en una hielera y luego los transporta en un carretón y los vende de casa en casa.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar una bicicleta para poder transportar con mayor facilidad sus productos, ya que con el carretón recorre poca distancia y con la bicicleta podrá cubrir mayor territorio.

Sus sueños son llevar el sustento diario para su casa y poder ampliar su negocio con la compra de la bicicleta.
texts.en:
Jorge is 50 years old and he studied until the eighth grade. His life companion dedicates her time to domestic tasks and informal work. His children are grown and have their own families. He has only one grandchild living with him and his life companion. 

Jorge works in a truck that he uses to make all kinds of trips, and also works in agriculture cultivating 7000 square meters of corn. He makes trips depending on when he is requested to do so, and he works in agriculture during the farming season in winter. Aside from all of this he also has a store in his home and sells and buys coconuts on the sidewalk outside his home. He also sells them door to door by preparing them, putting them in a cooler, and transporting them in a cart. 

The loan funds will be used to buy a bicycle to be able to transport his goods more easily, as his cart goes only a short distance and a bicycle would allow him to cover more ground. 

His dream is to earn the daily sustenance for his household and to be able to expand his business with the purchase of a bicycle.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle to be able to transport his goods more easily.

loans.name: Jaider Luis

texts.es:
Jaider tiene 21 años y vive en Tierralta, lugar donde tiene un negocio desde hace dos años de venta de comida, el cual decidió comenzar por su gusto por la cocina y por su deseo de salir adelante en la vida. A pesar de su corta edad sabe muy bien lo que quiere para él, su familia y su negocio, y está dispuesto a continuar trabajando para lograr todos sus objetivos.

Lamentablemente la falta de capital ha causado que no posea un inventario suficiente para responder a la demanda con la que hoy se enfrenta, así que en Kiva e Interactuar encontró la oportunidad de darle un cambio a esto a través de un préstamo que le ayudará a comprar mayor inventario para su negocio de comida, esperando que esto le ayude a aumentar sus ventas.

Un hombre soñador pero con los pies en la tierra, que trabaja arduamente para hacer sus sueños realidad, uno de ellos, el de arreglar su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y que no le brinda buena seguridad a él o a su familia. Ayuda  Jaider a tener un negocio exitoso y una vivienda segura, un préstamo lo impulsará a estar más cerca de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Jaider, age 21, lives in Tierralta. This is where he has had a business of selling food for two years. He decided to start the business because of his enjoyment of cooking and his wish to get ahead in life. In spite of his young age, he knows very well what he wants for himself, his family, and his business. He is prepared to continue working in order to obtain his objectives.

Sadly, the lack of capital has resulted in not having enough inventory to respond to the current demand. With Kiva and Interactuar he found the opportunity to change this through a loan that will help him buy more inventory for his food business. He is hoping that this will help him to increase his sales.

He is a dreamer, but he has his feet firmly on the ground. He works arduously to make his dream a reality. One of them is to fix his house, which is in bad condition and does not provide him or his family with good security. Help Jaider to have a successful business and a secure house. A loan will move him closer to achieving his dream.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a widowed woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Mwanamkasi operates a stall selling vegetables, and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lucy Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, four self-dependent women of Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, of Khurda district, Odisha, India formed a group named Lucy. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social source of revenue by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Binodini is the most dynamic and vigorous lady of this village and has taken the leadership to form a joint-liability group. This exceptional lady is aged about 46 years and is standing at the extreme right with a red saree in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high aspirations. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

For the last four years, Binodini has been engaged in tailoring with the help and full support of her husband. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 8,500 from her current occupation, but the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So, she decided to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business through a loan.

She will purchase a huge quantity of cloth and tailoring-related items from the nearest market to prepare more and more dresses in a slot. Through this, Binodini hopes that she will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and for construction of a good house.

The other three members of the group are also engaged in different small businesses like a betel shop, a snacks business, and an incense sticks business.

loans.use: to purchase a huge quantity of cloth and tailoring-related items.

loans.name: Bubiniso

texts.en:
Buniniso was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in big city with her family. She is married and has one child and is a teacher. She teaches the beginner classes at school. She is well known among teachers and pupil. She likes her job and children. 

Her daughter is sick, she worries about her health. She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to treat her daughter at hospital. She awaits your compassion and help.

loans.use: to treat her daughter at hospital

loans.name: Melly

texts.en: For 30 years, Melly has been engaged in selling fish and earns about PHP 3,500 per month, enough for their daily consumption. Thus she needs  additional capital to continue her business.  She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell. Melly is a 54-year-old woman from Calape, Bohol. She is married and has one adult child. Melly is working hard to have something for her family. In the future, she dreams of improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta is 42 years old. She is married and they have three children. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for 15 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, salt, maize and wheat flours, sugar, cooking oil and other items for sale.

loans.name: Jimmy Javier

texts.es:
En el cantón El Carmen se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso, donde una de las fuentes principales de ingreso es el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete.
En este lugar vive el señor Jimmy, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Su cónyuge es ama de casa. Viven en una pequeña finca donde alquilan.
Don Jimmy realiza el crédito para él y su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao, frutas tropicales (naranjas, mandarinas, y verduras en la época invernal). También con su mujer crían y venden cerdos los mismos que son faenados y luego venden la carne por libras,  llevan 2  años a esta labor y les ha ido bastante bien. El compra y vende verduras y esta actividad la realiza por 6 horas diarias de martes a domingos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar cerdos, abonos, semillas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el  Grupo de Crédito le gusta la unión del grupo y la facilidad de los créditos. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
The partners of Grupo de Crédito Unión y Progreso meet every 2 weeks in the El Carmen canton, where one of the main source of income is the growth of bananas of the Barraganete variety. This is the place where Jimmy lives.

Jimmy is 27, lives in a common law marriage and has a 2-year-old daughter. His spouse is a house-wife and they live in a small farm that they rent.

Jimmy is requesting the loan for him and his wife. He works in agriculture and grows cocoa and tropical fruits (oranges, mandarins and vegetables during the winter season). They also raise and sell pigs, which are later slaughtered. Afterwards they sell the meat by the pound. They have been doing this for 2 years and are doing quite well. He also works buying and selling vegetables 6 hours per day from Tuesday to Sunday.

He is going to use this loan to buy pigs, manure, seeds and fertilizer for the crops. This is his second cycle in the Group of Credit and he likes the cohesion of the group and the easiness to obtain a loan. His dream is to have a house of his own and finish his university degree.

loans.use: to buy pigs, manure, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old. He is married and they have 3 children.  He sells used clothes as well as farming. He has been in business for 25 years. 

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy additional materials and threads for dressmaking.

He will use profits from the business to expand do home repairs as well as supporting family budget. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his business to bring enough income.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and threads for dressmaking

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 55 years old. She is married and has eight children to support. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 10 years and she has been earning an income of KES 24,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a married woman with two children. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a shop with more variety of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, flour and other items

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a retail business where she sells utensils, shoes, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils, shoes, and other items.

Her business goal is to have a kitchenware shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to  buy more stock of utensils, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman  and has seven children . She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mina Kumari

texts.en:
Mina Kumari, 33, is featured in the photograph. She lives with her partner and has one daughter. She hails from a small town of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She has a business making woven woolen products.

Mina Kumari is enterprising, sincere, generous, understanding, patient, responsible, and very hardworking.

Her husband works as a grocer in a nearby grocery shop. The income earned by both of them is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have always lacked cash in order to build a toilet for their safety and hygiene.

Therefore, Mina Kumari is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum in order to build a toilet for her family and safeguard the health of her family.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita, 59, is a responsible, generous, and hardworking lady. Her family has five members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and her grandson. Her family is living in a small town of Kandhamal district.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. She earns 5,000 INR every month after harvesting her crops. However, after deducting costs, the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and save a small amount of money. Therefore, until this date she was never able to build a toilet for her family.

Lalita is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to install a commode and build a toilet for her family in order to promote cleanliness and hygiene. She will be very thankful if you accept her request.

loans.use: to install a commode and build a toilet.

loans.name: Developmental Consideration Forum Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of Developmental Consideration Forum Group and a resident of Kyebando, Uganda. He is married with 3 kids, all of whom all are school-going. 

Moses is on his fourth loan cycle at UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), applying for a loan portion of 2,500,000 UGX. He has been servicing a loan of 1,500,00 UGX which helped him to increase his productivity and profit. 

Moses deals in selling agricultural products, especialy vegetables like tomatoes, onions, avocados, as well as other fresh fruits. However, he also has some small rental houses from which he earns income to look after his family and provide for their basic needs.

The purpose of this loan is to inject more funds into Moses' business and help him serve his clients. His future dream is see that his children finish school and get better jobs.

Moses is so grateful to this institution and the funders, as well for the great work they do for the borrowers, despite their low-income status. He is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: To buy stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en: Sokhim, 36, is a young mother blessed with two young kids living in Mondulkiri province. To support her living, she can earn income via cassava cropping  and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her cassava did not grow well this year because she did not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She has been involved in farming for 10 years. This is Sokhim's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of five and as the group leader, she will manage her portion of loan to buy pesticide to protect her farm from insects so that she can gain a higher yield. She hopes that she can increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her farm from insects so that she can gain a higher yield

loans.name: Mercedes Rosa

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de 51 años de edad y tiene 6 hijos, a los cuales los ha criado con todo el amor del mundo, y sobretodo, con mucho sacrificio. Vive en Tarazá, municipio donde decidió comenzar su negocio de cría de ganado hace 3 años, motivada por la necesidad económica que su familia estaba enfrentando, además por el gusto que le tiene a la labor.

Esta mujer dedicada y responsable espera ver su negocio sostenible, además quiere aumentar la cantidad de clientes y la ganancia, sabe que para esto debe tener más inventario, por esto llega el día de hoy con el deseo de obtener un préstamo que le permita comprar más cerdos de levante y cuido para alimentarlos, confía que con estos su negocio crecerá. 

Esta madre espera algún día tener la oportunidad de dejar su negocio a sus hijos, no sin antes asegurarse de que es exitoso y reconocido, por lo cual trabaja arduamente. Usted puede ayudar a esta mujer a lograr sus sueños con este préstamo que seguro le traerá grandes beneficios.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 51, has six children. She raised them with all of the love in the world and with a great deal of sacrifice. She lives in Tarazá, the municipality where she decided to start her business of raising livestock three years ago. She was motivated by financial necessity that her family was facing and by the enjoyment she gets from the work.

This dedicated and responsible woman hopes to see her business sustainable. She also wants to increase the number of customers she has and the earnings. She knows that in order to do this she needs to have more inventory.

That is why she now comes with the wish of getting a loan that will allow her to buy more pigs to raise and care for and for their feed. She is confident that with these things her business will grow.

This mother hopes to one day have the opportunity of leaving her business to her children. However, before that she wants to assure that is is successful and well- known. She works arduously for that. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and care for and to feed them.

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her late forties, is a divorcee with six children. One of them is still in school, and the others are grownups. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy the out-of-stock items in a mamalishe store and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses. She dreams of building her own house.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Mwambisi, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe (food stall) stock and serve more people.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon is an adventurous guy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. He lives in a small town with his family. 

Murodjon is single, and he provides the services of applying master wizard finishes to houses. He has been hardworking, responsible, and helpful since his childhood. He tries to support and help his foster family. 

Murodjon is sick. He cut his leg and now needs to have his leg have medical attention. He appealed to IMON and Kiva's lenders to take a loan so he can be treated at a hospital. He hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 22 years old. He is single and has no children. He is a cash-crop farmer. His business has been profitable. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to get more farm produce to sell. He will use the income to buy livestock. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming operation, make more income, and become a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Vachik

texts.en: Vachik is from the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. He is a farmer and he greatly wants to develop his farming with the help of Kiva lenders. On his farm Vachik takes care of cows, sheep, a calf and chickens. With the help of his wife, Vachik sells his farm’s products such as meat, milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese and eggs. Vachik is happy to be able to sustain his family’s needs through his farming and also provides his family with tasty and fresh products. Vachik asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen is 43 years old and he lives in Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. Arsen used to work as a policeman but now his only occupation is faming and agriculture. With the help of his nice wife, Arsen takes care of his farm cattle such as cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Arsen sells his farm’s cheese, milk, macun (national dairy product), curd, meat and eggs at the wholesale market together with his land’s harvest of potato, carrot, greens and tomato. Arsen has a school-aged son who also actively helps his parents about their farm. Now Arsen asks for this Kiva loan as he needs to buy one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for all of his farm cattle

loans.name: Synich's Group

texts.en:
Synich, 21, is a young mother blessed with two young kids living in Siem Reap province. To support her living, she earns income from rice cropping and by raising pigs for sale to supplement her income. 

Her rice didn't grow well this year, because she did not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. Her pigs are getting sick as well, which causes her to not have enough money to take care of her family members. She has been involved in farming for 3 years. 

For Synich, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kadage Village, Nigeria. 

Sani joined Babban Gona Farmers Organization to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sani now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Zouhal 1 Group

texts.en:
Liliane is the featured borrower of Zouhal 1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua,  because they have always been neighbors and friends and are working hard to develop their living.

Liliane is a 27-year-old single lady who opened her own beauty salon in 2013 after resigning from being a secretary at a car rental company. Liliane is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special new summer-released beauty products necessary for her business development. Liliane is the lady standing at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Maysaa is the lady at the center, while Samah is the first from the left.

loans.use: To buy special new summer-released beauty products necessary for her business development

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 35-year-old married man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Twenty years ago he started selling sanitary products to cover his family's living conditions. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new items and products to satisfy his customers' needs. Hassan hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new items and products

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a single man. He describes himself as patient.
