Anderson operates a retail business where he sells cushions. He has been involved in this business for 5 years now. His primary customers are locals. 

Anderson describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of cushions to sell. His business goal is to have a wholesale operation within 5 years.

loans.use: buy more inventory of cushions.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as competition. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat lives with his wife, two children and his retired father in the village of Kavart in the Syunik region. Marat used to work as a watchman, but now he is only a farmer and a rather prosperous beekeeper. On his farm he has a lot of beehives, calves, pigs, piglets and a horse. Marat mentions that he is lucky as all of his farm products--honey, beef, pork and eggs--are of great demand. He sells his land’s harvest of potato, beans and tomato. 

Marat is now the only breadwinner in his family and he wants to make it richer to have more income for his family’s great number of needs. With this loan Marat plans to buy chickens, fodder for his farm cattle, diesel fuel and organize upcoming hay mowing activities on his farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens, fodder for his farm cattle, diesel fuel and organize upcoming hay mowing activities in his farm

loans.name: Esteban David

texts.es:
Esteban tiene tan solo 25 años y tiene una hermosa hija de 6, la cual se ha convertido en su motor para seguir luchando y salir adelante. Él vive en Montería, municipio donde hace 2 años decidió comenzar un negocio de venta de madera, donde emplea a dos familiares con los que trabaja los 7 días de la semana. 

Para Esteban el crecimiento de su negocio es de suma importancia, pero la falta de capital no le ha permitido impulsarlo de la manera que desea, es por esta razón que tomó la decisión de pedir un préstamo, el cual le permitirá comprar más insumos y madera para que su negocio pueda responder a mayor demanda y alcanzar mayores clientes.

Él quiere que su hija pueda acceder a una gran educación que la convierta en una gran persona, también desea que viva en un hogar tranquila y segura, por esto quiere mejorar las condiciones de esta pues no están en su mejor estado. Ayuda a Esteban a estar más cerca de sus objetivos a través del préstamo que hoy solicita.
texts.en:
Esteban is 25 years old. He has a beautiful 6-year-old daughter, who has become his motivation to continue fighting and to move forward. He lives in Montería, the city where he decided to start a wood sale business two years ago. His business employs two of his family members, with whom he works seven days a week.

The growth of the business is extremely important to Esteban. However, a lack of capital has not allowed him to promote it in the way that he wishes. For this reason, he decided to request a loan, which will allow him to buy more supplies and wood so that his business can respond to a greater demand and reach a greater number of customers.

He wishes for his daughter to obtain a great education that helps her become a great person. He also desires for her to live in a calm and safe home. For this reason, he wants to improve the condition of his house, which is currently not in its best state.

Help Esteban move one step closer to achieving his goals through the loan that he is requesting!

loans.use: to buy more supplies and wood.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is a young farmer who lives with his brother in Kavart village of the Syunik region. Garik is 31 years old, and he is seriously engaged in beekeeping.

He has a lot of bee families and also cows, calves and a horse. Garik manages to sell perfect honey from his farm for which he has already a number of regular customers.  So the sale of honey, his farm milk and meat bring some income to him and his brother for living. 

Garik also has a hay field and by selling hay from his farm as fodder, he increases his family income. Now with this loan Garik plans to buy wax paper for his bees, diesel fuel and also to organize hay mowing work in the field.

loans.use: to buy wax paper for his bees, diesel fuel and also to organize hay mowing work in the field

loans.name: Bebelonia

texts.en:
Generally Filipinos are capable of handling well life’s many adversities. They are like bamboo trees, which are bent but not broken. This 41-year-old Bebelonia from Matina, Davao City was separated from her husband, but she didn’t give in to emotional troubles. Instead, she focused her attention to her variety store business with strong belief that she can support all her needs without depending on her husband. She finds encouragement from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative through their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

Bebelonia is pursuing improvement of her business so she can extend financial assistance to her parents and siblings. To pay for their monthly utilities such as electric and water bills is already a big help to them. She aims to expand the selection of her store to entice more buyers. She appeals for PHP 16,000 additional capital to buy grocery items, beverages, and charcoal for her inventory. In due time, she will put up another income generating venture to boost her profit and savings. Your generous assistance will surely give her hope and a little comfort. Thank you so much in advance. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages, and charcoal for her inventory

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram is a happy farmer since he is engaged in his favorite work in his nice village, where he was born 57 years ago. In the village Sevakar of Syunik region, Vahram lives with his beloved wife. Their two children are already married and they live with their families. Vahram used to work as a locksmith, but now he is only farming and in his farm he takes care of a lot of cows, calves, pigs and chickens. As he likes to say, with the help of his wife they have the richest and the nicest vegetable garden, from which he gathers harvests of potatoes, beans, garlic, tomatoes, cabbages, onions, radishes and cucumbers.

Vahram sells all his farm goods, vegetables, milk, meat, cheese, curd and eggs at both the wholesale market and from his farm, as well. With this loan of 500,000 AMD, Vahram wants to develop swine breeding in his farm, and he will buy a pig and also organize hay-mowing activities.

loans.use: to buy a pig in order to develop swine breeding and also to organize hay mowing activities.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 45 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days Rehana's husband's rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this her husband is unable to generate any income. Her husband wants to be able to repair it as soon as possible. However due lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC  Pakistan.

loans.use: repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Aster

texts.en:
Aster is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for five years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to have maintenance done on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Aster has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Aster's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Aster  also plans to save money from the profit amount of her husband's income to help meet her family's needs in the future. Aster is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Amakene Group

texts.fr: FATOUMATA est la femme qui a la main levé sur la photo,  c’est une malienne de cinquante-un (51) ans. Elle est mariée à un agriculteur et mère de douze (12) enfants dont cinq (5) garçons et sept (7) filles. Le plus âgé est de vingt-huit ans (28) qui fait partir de ses sept (7) enfants scolarisés; le dernier a six (6) ans.FATOUMATA est éleveuse d’ovins depuis vingt-neuf (29) ans et fait recourt au prêt RMCR dans l’intention d’acheter des moutons sur le marché local, les revend auprès des revendeurs dans le village.  L’intérêt de son activité la permettra de prendre  en charge les frais scolaire et  habillements de ses enfants.   Dans les jours à venir elle aimerait avoir un prêt plus élevé, s’acheter  beaucoup de moutons afin d’avoir plus de profit et aider son mari à acheter des bœufs de labours.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the one woman raising her hand in the photo. She is from Mali and 51 years old. She is married to a farmer and has 12 children: five sons and seven daughters. Her eldest child is 28 years old (he is among her seven children who have attended or still attend school); the youngest is six years old. 

Fatoumata has been raising sheep for 29 years. She has applied for a loan from RMCR with the goal of buying sheep at the local market and later resell them to the village distributors. The revenue from her business will allow Fatoumata to pay the costs of schooling and clothing her children. In the future she would like to take out a larger loan, to buy many sheep and raise a greater profit in order to help her husband buy draft oxen.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bakin Kasuwa Village. Samaila joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will allow him to increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samaila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields

loans.name: Aquiles Rosendo

texts.es:
Aquiles tiene 29 años y vive en Montería con su familia. En el 2010 tomó la decisión de comenzar su propio negocio, una farmacia que hoy abastece gran parte de la localidad donde vive. Trabaja arduamente para hacer crecer su negocio, 8 horas al día los 7 días de la semana.

La falta de capital no le ha permitido responder a la demanda con la que se encuentra, dejando algunos de sus clientes sin el medicamento que llegan a solicitar, por esto, el día de hoy pide un préstamo que le permitirá comprar más surtido y hacer unas adecuaciones locativas que hoy está necesitando su farmacia.

Aquiles sueña con ver su negocio siendo reconocido dentro y fuera de su comodidad, que la gente lo vea como un emprendedor que es un ejemplo a seguir. Ayuda a Aquiles con un préstamo que lo llevará más cerca de lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 29 years old and lives in Montería with his family. In 2010, he made the decision to open his own business, a pharmacy that today supplies most of the town where he lives. He is working hard to grow his business – eight hours a day, seven days a week.

His lack of capital has not allowed him to respond to the demand he has, leaving some of his customers without medication that come in to request it. For this reason, he is asking for a loan today that will allow him to buy more supplies and make needed updates to his pharmacy. 

Aquiles dreams of having his business recognized in and outside of his community – and that people see him as an entrepreneur who is a role model to follow. Help Aquiles with a loan that will get him closer to fulfilling his dreams.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and update his shop.

loans.name: Gulzarda

texts.en:
Gulzarda, 53, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. However, due to the lack of money her husband finds this difficult. This purchase will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that reason, his wife Gulzarda is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. Gulzarda is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's embroidery business

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 31-year-old married mother of two children. She sells bags and scarfs to support her husband, who is employed with a limited salary for covering their family's living needs.

Zeina is a hard worker who works on providing her customers with special care to make sure they will always visit her shop for a new collection. Today, and since her family's needs are increasing, Zeina is working on increasing her business merchandise with a newly-released summer collection. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.

This is Zeina's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that through this loan she can increase her family's income and improve their living.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a newly-released summer collection

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy runs a variety store with an adjacent canteen in Matina, Davao City. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Sometimes it hampers the smooth operation of her business and consequently affects her income. If she is given enough capital, she is confident that she can improve her business. She desires to become a dealer of soft drinks and other beverages in the near future.

For the meantime, she would like to borrow PHP 29,000 to pay for added items to sell in her store. She will also cook more meal choices in her canteen. Her income will sufficiently provide for her family’s usual expenditures, while her husband’s income as a regular employee of Bureau of Fire Protection is allotted for their children’s educational needs and savings for the future.

You may be assured that she can faithfully repay her loan because she has gained the virtue of a responsible entrepreneur. She prays for a growing business, good health and more blessings for her whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for added items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy stock of cereals for resale. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereals for resale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows tomatoes, bananas and other crops. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash is a married man with four children. He describes himself as ambitious and patient. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Cristobal Aurelio

texts.es:
Cristóbal tiene 51 años y vive en el municipio de Los Córdobas, junto con su compañera sentimental y sus 4 hijos. Este hombre emprendedor lleva más de 25 años criando ganado pues comenzó su propio negocio en 1990, decisión que tomo solo, pero impulsado por el deseo de brindar a su familia una buena calidad de vida.

Cristóbal ha tenido un trabajo que ha aprendido a realizar de manera que sea sostenible, aun así sabe que los tiempo cambias y que debe adaptarse para que pueda continuar así, siempre buscando mejorar sus ventas para obtener ganancias que le permitan a su negocio crecer. Ha pedido hoy un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios para poder tener la finca en la que cría ganado en el mejor estado.

Cristóbal sabe que le quedan muchos años de trabajo antes de retirarse, pero sueña con dejar a sus hijos un negocio exitoso y que ellos pueda continuar haciéndolo crecer. Ayuda hoy a este responsable padre a lograr esto y mucho más, una donación puede cambiar su vida.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 51 years old, and he lives in the municipality of Los Córdobas with his life companion and their four children. 

This enterprising man has been raising livestock for more than twenty-five years, as he started his own business in 1990.  It was a decision that he made on his own, but he was motivated to do so by the desire to give his family a good quality of life. 

Cristobal has learned to carry out his work in such a way that it is sustainable, yet he knows that times change, and that he must adapt so that he may continue as he has been. He is always looking to improve his sales in order to obtain earnings that will allow him to grow his business.  Today he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies so that he can have the farm on which he raises livestock in the best condition. 

Cristóbal knows that there are many years remaining to work before he retires, but he dreams of leaving his children a successful business, and that they may continue making it grow. Please help this responsible father today, so that he may achieve this and much more. A donation can change his life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Donaida Rosa

texts.es:
Donaida es una empresaria de 53 años de edad, responsable, carismática, sonriente y pujante, residente del municipio de Sahagún, un lugar donde hay dificultades de orden social, se ve pobreza, pero que está lleno de trabajadores que quieren cambiarle la cara y la realidad a su municipio, trabajadores como Donaida que con su proyección como independiente monto un negocio de cría de pollos, pero que no ha logrado despegar por la falta de recursos, por ello quiere acudir a una ayuda financiera con el objetivo de comprar los insumos que necesita para su negocio, tales como: pollos, cerdos, alimento y vitaminas.

Este préstamo será una enorme ayuda para esta mujer, ya que dispondrá de las herramientas suficiente para poner a producir su negocio y generar utilidades que servirán mucho en el mantenimiento y mejora de la calidad de vida de los suyos (su pareja junto con sus 5 hijos)
texts.en:
Donaida is a responsible, charismatic, smiley, vibrant 53 year-old businesswoman. She lives in the municipality of Sahagún, a place where there are social problems and you see poverty, but that is full of workers who want to change the image and the reality of the municipality. Workers like Donalda, who independently started a business breeding chickens, but has not been able to get it off the ground due to a lack of resources. 

Therefore she wants to get financial assistance with the objective of purchasing the supplies she needs for her business, such as chickens, pigs, feed and vitamins. 

This loan will be a huge help for this woman since she will have the sufficient tools to make her business productive and to generate resources that will be very useful in the maintenance and improvement of the quality of life of her family (her partner and their five children).

loans.use: to purchase the necessary supplies for her business, such as chickens, pigs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Sule joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Sule suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase his farmland. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Sule has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Sule can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Rukundo Kwetu Group

texts.fr: Pour contourner les charges familiales, la plupart de membres du groupe RUKUNDO KWETU ont appris à cultiver la tomate avec l'aide de familiers. Mbambambe, président du groupe, tenant sur la photo un carnet rose, en est l'exemple. Il deplore l'insuffisance de moyens pour valoriser cette activité mais souhaiterait que grâce à cet appui financier d'arriver à une production importante qui leur permettrait de subvenir à leurs besoins familiaux. signalons cependant que, l'un de membres sur la photo a été eliminé au cours du processus de crédit.
texts.en:
Most members of the Rukundo Kweti have learned how to grow tomatoes from their relatives, as a way of providing for their families. This has also been the case of Mmabambe, the group's leader, who is shown on the photo holding a pink certificate. 

Mbambambe complaints of lack of funds to make his business profitable; thanks to this financial support, he would like to increase the volume of his produce and support his family. We point out that one of the members pictured in the photo ended up not being approved for a loan during the review process.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor for sowing and weeding, as well as for the purchase of lime and other treatments.

loans.name: Sunisi

texts.en:
Sunisi is a Babban Gona farmer from Doka Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Sunisi no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize / hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his income considerably. This season Sunisi has ambitious plans to harvest 20 bags of maize.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sunisi now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 62-year-old single lady who works hard to develop her business so that she can make sure her increasing income is good enough to support another family member she's responsible for. Fifteen years ago, Nahla opened a clothes-selling shop, after being a salesperson in a similar business and acquiring good experience to launch her own.

Today, and since Nahla is focusing on developing her business through increasing her merchandise from selling income, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make the necessary maintenance to her house before the coming winter season to avoid problems with leaks. She will work hard in the future to expand her workplace to better display her products and facilitate customers' decisionmaking.

loans.use: To make the necessary maintenance to her house before the coming winter season to avoid problems with leaks

loans.name: Sukna

texts.en: Sukna is a 56-year-old married mother of one child. Eight years ago she started working in her grocery shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their only child. Sukna is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new items and products to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. Sukna hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to attract more customers

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. He hopes that in the future he will expand business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is a married man with four children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to own a big charcoal store within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Tuhtajon

texts.en: Tuhtajon is a careful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1956. She is living in a small city with her family. She is a widow and has five children. She is a farmer. She keeps, feeds and sells livestock at the domestic market. She has been keeping livestock at home and doing business for about five years. She likes sheep and goats. She takes care of them and looks after them gently. She is willing to buy three more calves in order to do her business better. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy three calves. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman and she has six children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big supermarket. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a cashew nuts business for the past 10 years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo Andres

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 22 años y vive en el municipio de Momil, es un hombre emprendedor y responsable que siempre ha sabido que la mejor forma de triunfar en la vida es trabajando arduamente para lograr sus metas y sueños. El año pasado decidió llevar esto un paso adelante comenzando su negocio de cría de aves, el cual le ha funcionado bien hasta hoy.

Para este hombre soñador no existen límites, y para su negocio tampoco, es por esto que quiere asegurarse de que este sea sostenible en el tiempo y pueda brindarle lo que necesita. Hoy quieren invertir en el, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo, por esto pide un préstamo que le permita comprar más lechones, pollos, alimento, vacunas y vitaminas para su animales, pues le gusta asegurar de criarlos con la mejor calidad.

La vivienda de Ricardo se encuentra muy deteriorada, y ha sido su sueño hace ya varios años el de mejorarla para que su familia se siente orgullosa y pueda vivir más segura. Ayuda a este emprendedor a alcanzar sus sueños y a consolidar su empresa, un préstamo de seguro lo llevará más cerca de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 22 years old, and he lives in the city of Momil. He is an entrepreneurial and responsible man who has always known that the best way to succeed in life is by working very hard to achieve his goals and dreams. Last year, he decided to take one step forward by starting a poultry business, which has done well so far.

For this dreamer and his business, limits do not exist. It is for this reason that he wants to ensure that his business is sustainable through time and that it can provide him with what he needs. He wishes to invest in his business, but he does not have enough capital to do this. Therefore, he is requesting a loan, which will allow him to buy more piglets and chickens as well as feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his animals, since he likes making sure that they are raised in the best conditions.

The house where Ricardo lives is greatly deteriorated. For many years, he has dreamed of improving it so that his family can feel proud and live more safely. Help this entrepreneur to fulfill his dreams and to consolidate his business! A loan will certainly push him one step closer to achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chickens as well as feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his animals.

loans.name: Alfredo Miguel

texts.es:
Alfredo es un persona muy inquieta, trabajador que dedica largas jornadas de trabajo para cubrir sus dos negocios, ya que posee una carnicería y una ebanistería, profesiones que aprendió en el recorrido de su vida y las cuales emplea con mucha dedicación para generar  los recursos necesarios para el mantenimiento de sus seres amados, las cuales son su esposa y sus dos hijos.

El principal objetivo que tiene este trabajador campesino es capacitar a sus hijos apra que tomen la rienda de sus negocios y está en él la obligación de dejarles un negocio prospero para que no lleguen a pasar necesidades.

Pensando en incentivar su actividad, aumentar sus ventas y lograr captar la atención de un mayor número de clientes, Alfredo solicita un préstamo para la compra de lechones para la carnicería y materiales para la ebanistería, principalmente madera y aerosoles.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very lively and hardworking person who dedicates long workdays to both of his businesses, since he has both a butchery and a woodworking shop. He learned these professions throughout the course of his life and he works on them with a lot of dedication in order to generate the necessary resources to take care of his loved ones, who are his wife and his two children. 

The main objective of this hardworking man from the countryside is to teach his children so that they can take the reigns of his businesses. As part of this objective, he has an obligation to leave them a prosperous business so that they will not suffer hardships. 

In hopes of stimulating his business, increasing his sales, and getting the attention of a greater number of customers, Alfredo is requesting a loan to buy suckling pigs for his butchery and materials for his woodworking shop, primarily wood and aerosols.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs for his butchery and materials for his woodworking shop.

loans.name: Priskillah

texts.en:
Priskillah is 42 years old. She is married and has eight children to support. 

She has been practicing tea farming for the last 40 years and she has been earning an income of KES 24,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Galatmo

texts.ru: 50 летняя жена и мать, Галатмо. Она жительница города Душанбе. У нее 4 детей. Сыновьям 29,27,24 и 19 лет. Сыновья взрослые и самостоятельные парни. Старшие сыновьями занимаются таксистом, а младшие еще учатся в университете. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Галатмо активная женщина. У нее есть маленький бизнес, который ей приносит больше прибыль. Галатмо 5 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. У Галатмо старая швейная машинка. Она хочет купить себе современную электронную швейную машинку, чтобы расширить деятельность. Чтобы достичь своих целей, у нее нет денег для приобретения желаемую машинку. Поддержите ее достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Galatmo is a 50 year old wife and mother. She lives in Dushanbe. She has four children. Her sons are 29, 27, 24, and 19. Her sons are independent adults. Her older sons are taxi drivers, and the youngest are still attending university. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. 

Galatmo is an active woman. She has a small business, which brings in more profit for her. Galatmo has been sewing women's clothes from her home for five years. Galatmo has an old sewing machine. She wants to buy a modern electric sewing machine for herself, so that she can expand her business. 

She does not have enough money to obtain her desired machine in order to reach her goals. Please support her in reaching her goals!

loans.use: to buy a new modern electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 41 years old and she is married with five children. She has had a sweet potatoes business for five years and it has been profitable. She will be using the loan to purchase sweet potatoes to plant and hopes this will help her pay school fees. Her hope and dream for the future is to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase sweet potatoes to plant to help her pay school fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and she has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes and other vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation of her goods to her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a coconut business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Zaberio

texts.en: Zaberio is a married man with one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with four children. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a marketable area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Tasiú

texts.en: Tasiú is a Babban Gona farmer from Fulani Gimba Vilage. Tasiú joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Tasiú will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Tasiú would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es un humilde, trabajador y pujante empresario de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja con al cual tuvo tres hijos, dos menores de edad y la mayor que es adolescente, genera los recursos para el mantenimiento de su seres amados gracias a su negocio de cría de aves, el cual aprendió de sus padres y lo ejerce desde que era un jovencito.

La fuerte competencia en el sector incentivo a este hombre a buscar alternativas para potenciar su negocio, por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos que dinamicen su actividad, permitiéndole competir en precios y cantidad de estos animales en el mercado.

Por tal razón Rafael quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento, vitaminas con los que aumentara considerablemente la cantidad de aves en su negocio.

Estos cambios los quiere realizar ya que quiere brindarle una excelente educación a sus tres muchachos.
texts.en: Rafael is a humble, hardworking and vigorous 43 year old businessman. He lives with his life partner, with whom he had three children, two young ones and a teenage girl. He generates resources to support his loved ones thanks to his business raising poultry, which he learned from his parents and has done since he was very young. The strong competition in this area motivated him to look for alternatives in order to make his business successful. For this, he is requesting a loan to buy inputs that will make his job more dynamic, allowing him to compete in prices and the quantity of these animals in this market. For this reason, Rafael wants to request a loan to buy chickens, food, vitamins, with which he will considerably increase the quantity of poultry animals in his business. He wants to make these changes in order to give his three children an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy inputs.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is 22 years old. She is single and has no children. She sells farm produce like cow peas, beans, maize, mangoes and cabbage, among other farm products, and has been in this business for two years. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of mangoes, spinach, cabbage, onions and maize to sell and get more income to expand her business. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to expand her business by buying more groceries. Her future hopes and dreams are to open a grocery store and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy stock of mangoes, spinach, cabbage, onions and maize to sell and get more income to expand her business.

loans.name: Jorge Ignacio

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 33 años y vive en Bello con su familia, y tiene una hermosa pequeña hija de tan solo 1 año de edad. Hace 15 años decidió comenzar un negocio de cría de ganado, en especial de cerdos, labor que le ha permitido sostener a su familia.

Hoy Jorge pide un préstamo porque no posee el suficiente capital para comprar el cuido para los animales que posee en día además de ampliación de sus cosechas, unos cultivos que decidió comenzar, por lo tanto requiere el dinero para invertir en su negocio.

Jorge no posee vivienda en estos días, y es un sueño el poder brindarle una a su familia para que tengan una buena calidad de vida, además de tener la posibilidad de brindar a su hija una buena educación. Ayuda a Jorge con un préstamo y permítele triunfar en su negocio.
texts.en: Jorge is 33 years old and lives in Bello with his family. He has a beautiful small daughter who is only one year old. Fifteen years ago, he started a business raising cattle, specially pigs, a job that has allowed him to support his family. Currently, Jorge is requesting a loan because he does not have enough capital to take care of the animals he owns, and also to expand his harvests, with some crops he decided to start. Therefore, he needs the money to invest in his business. Nowadays, Jorge does not own a house, and his dream is to be able to give one to his family so they can have a good quality of life, and also to give his daughter a good education. Help Jorge with a loan and allow him to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to invest in care for his animals, and also to expand his harvest.

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.ru: Зарыл, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 сыновей школьного возраста. По характеру она очень ответственная, пунктуальная, целеустремленная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, занимается животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 2 коровы и 5 овец. Зарыл получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 7,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для разведения и увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зарыл планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она мечтает отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Zaryl is 41 years old, married, and has three sons of school-going age. She is a responsible, punctual, and goal-oriented woman. She is engaged in animal husbandry as the main source of income for her family. She has a developed farm, with two cows and five sheep to be exact. Zaryl receives a monthly profit of about 7000 som (KGS). 

Zaryl has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a cow for breeding and increasing her livestock headcount. Zaryl plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further augmentation of her farm, and also dreams of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Yahaya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Catalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Catalina es una dulce señora de 57 años de edad la cual tiene gran sentido de pertenencia con su hogar y trabajo, es una persona muy aplicada y organizada que a pesar de desempeñarse como ama de casa, genera recursos atendiendo un negocio de cría de aves.

Catalina es madre de 4 hijos, ya esos son mayores de edad y tienen sus familias, apoyan a su amdre cuando lo necesiten, pero está increíble mujer en pocas ocasiones acude a ellos puesto que con su negocio genera los recursos necesarios para su mantenimiento.

Su ambición en su vida es trabajar para mantenerse e ir mejorando las condiciones y aspecto de su hogar conforme aumente las ventas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos, alimento y cerdos, con los cuales aumentara su inventario y tendrá mayor disponibilidad de animales para llegar a una buena negociación.
texts.en:
Catalina is a sweet 57-year-old woman who has a great sense of belonging with respect to her home and her work. She is a very diligent and organized person who, despite also being a housewife, generates resources by tending to a poultry-breeding business. 

Catalina is the mother of 4 children. Since her children are older and have their own families, they support their mother when she needs it. However, this incredible woman rarely turns to them for help, since through her business she generates the resources she needs to take care of herself.

Her life’s ambition is to work to take care of herself, and to continue improving the conditions and appearance of her home as sales increase. 

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, feed, and pigs. With these, she will expand her inventory, which will allow her to have a greater availability of animals and to be able to have good negotiations.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and pigs.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir ia married and has an adult daughter. He has his own business. Vladimir has been selling women's clothes at the central market for 20 years. He always chooses the most popular clothes. Vladimir is a hardworking and responsible person. Vladimir is asking for a loan of 50,000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's clothes for the fall season. The loan will help him to attract new clients and increase his income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of women's clothes for the fall season

loans.name: Mujeres Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES COMERCIANTES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Graciela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Graciela es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la necesidad de adquirir un crédito por lo que se acercó a la institución para solicitar un crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, con un pequeño capital para emprender su negocio, menciona que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de chamarras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece el señor Socrates ya que después del desembolso se tuvo que ir a su negocio, sin embargo, en la aparecen ocho integrantes, ya que en la foto se encuentra también la hija de la señora Toribia que es la señorita que esta vestida con una blusa a cuadros de color rosado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Business Women" will begin their first loan cycle with Kiva's partner Pro Mujer, which is part of the city center of Alto Lima.  The group is composed of 8 members and is directed by a board that includes Graciela as President.  The businesses fun by women in the association include a neighborhood store, transportation services, selling food, and selling clothing. 

The loan that they will receive will be used to benefit micro-businesses such as the one that Graciela runs.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer in order to acquire credit.  Currently she has a business selling clothing.  She began her business several years ago with a bit of capital to open.  She mentions that she learned the business from her husband. 

She will use the current loan to augment capital (to purchase jackets in bulk) that she will acquire from sellers in the city of El Alto and will then sell in her store.  This method of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that the likes the trainings they offer and the health services offered by the institution. 

In the picture Socrates does not appear because after the meeting he had to return to his business.  However, 8 members appear, since the daughter of Mrs. Toribia was there.  The daughter is the young woman dressed in a checkered pink blouse.

loans.use: to purchase jackets in bulk

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a tea leaves business for five years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase tea leaves to sell and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children with the anticipated income earned. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Shamine

texts.en: Shamine is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebbeca is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children to support. 

She has been practicing tea farming for the last 40 years and she has been earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
This is 69-year-old Lernik. He lives with his nice wife in Kapan city of Syunik region. Lernik has higher education and a specialty of engineer and he worked in his profession for many years. Now he works at a private company. Lernik’s wife used to work at the furniture factory of the city, but now she is retired. Their two children are married and they live with their families.

Lernik wants to make a surprise for his wife and he relies on Kiva support. He mentions that after repairing their flat, they did not manage to furnish it properly. So since his wife’s birthday is very soon, he wants to make a present for her, and with this loan amount he wants to buy a sofa and armchairs for their guest room.

loans.use: to buy a sofa and armchairs for their guest room.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sarki Yakubu Village. Yakubu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yakubu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yakubu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Maria Aileen

texts.en:
Provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines were hit hard by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all businesses in those areas dwindled if they did not go bankrupt. Entrepreneurs worked hard to recover and rehabilitate their businesses. “Sari-sari” or variety stores were not exempted from that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan affected communities almost crushed the variety stores, because the commodities that the people need everyday were supplied to them through relief goods. It was several months after Haiyan when variety stores rose again. 

Maria Aileen from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental is one of those variety store owners. It’s good that she also owns a tricycle being driven by her husband, Randy, which gives additional income for the family. Somehow the income derived from her tricycle is reliable and constant. But today it needs troubleshooting and maintenance. Maria Aileen knocks at your kind hearts to lend her PHP 60,000 which she will use to buy spare parts for her tricycle and pay for its maintenance. She will also add stocks of variety store items like snacks, toiletries and beverages. Hope you are willing to help her as she continuously strengthens her business. Her profit will sustain their everyday needs and educational expenses of her two children. She would like to see them with a college diploma and stable career someday.

Maria Aileen is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle and pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for 20 years. He has three heated greenhouses. With the previous loan from Kiva he bought coal and film cover for the greenhouses.

Alexander is a very hardworking person. In future he plans to buy another piece of land for building greenhouses. This spring, prices for cucumbers fell very quickly. Alexander got less income than he expected. That's why he is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to purchase coal for greenhouses. The price for coal in winter will be much higher, so Alexander wants to buy coal now and invest more money into the business.

loans.use: to purchase coal for greenhouses

loans.name: Muborro

texts.ru: Замечательная женщина Муборро. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Ее муж занимается водителем такси. Дочери занимается шитьем женской одежды и помогает маму в работе. Муборро рукодельница. Она 15 лет назад освоила кроить и шить национальную женскую одежду. Сейчас занимается шитьем у себя дома. Ее доходы только от этой деятельности. Муборро с мужем копили денег для свадьбы сына, но их денег не хватает для свадьбы сына. Она решила взять кредит и приобрести свадебные принадлежности. С такими планами Муборро обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее!
texts.en:
This excellent woman is Muborro. She is married and has three children. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her daughters sew women's clothes and help their mother with her work. Muborro is a seamstress. She mastered cutting and sewing national women's clothes 15 years ago. Now she sews from home. Her funds come only from this business. 

Muborro and her husband have saved money for their son's wedding, but they do not have enough money for the wedding. She has decided to take a loan in order to obtain wedding supplies. With this plan, Muborro has applied for a loan. Please support her!

loans.use: to buy wedding supplies for her son.

loans.name: 12 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “12 DE ABRIL” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de medias, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de medias; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace quince años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medias por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "12 de abril" will begin their seventh loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer.  The group is from the city of Cascada, and is made up of 8 people and directed by a board including Julia, who is the President.  The businesses run by the group members are varied, including selling vegetables, stockings, cosmetics, blankets, and shoes.  

Their loan will be used to support micro-businesses such as Julia's.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining based on the invitation of a friend who was a client.  Currently she has a business selling nylons.  She notes that she learned this business on her own 15 years ago.  

She will use her loan to increase capital via the purchase of nylons in bulk.  She will buy them from bulk salespeople in the city of La Paz and then resell in her store.  This method of work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the trainings and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase nylons in bulk

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en: This woman lives in Tsovazard Village of the Gegharkunik region and her name is Azatuhi (in Armenian her name means freedom). She lives here with her husband and smallest son (he is a student). Her daughter is married and she lives abroad. Her elder son is doing his military service in the army. Azatuhi has always been engaged in farming and now also she takes care of her farm cattle (cows, bulls, calves and chickens). She sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs right from her farm. Potato cultivation also brings good income and it usually buy resellers from her farm. She asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy chickens and also fodder for all of her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy chickens and also fodder for all of her farm cattle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 57 years old. She is married and has seven children to support. 

She has been practicing tea farming for the last 40 years and she has been earning an income of KES 20,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya To purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, rice, sugar, soap and other items.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable area and her primary customers are regular.

This is Kadzo's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more rice, sugar, soap, flour and other items to sell.

loans.use: buy more rice, sugar, soap, flour and other items to sell

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 26 years old. She is married, and she and her spouse have two children. She runs a green grocery business selling cabbages, carrots and tomatoes and has been in business for two years.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

She will use the anticipated profits from the business to purchase food for her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and generate more income to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell, and she hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Badamasi Village. Yau joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Yau suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Yau has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare -- double the national average in Nigeria -- and earn an income of up to $2,000 per hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably.

With ambitious goals of harvesting 18 bags of maize this year, Yau can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields

loans.name: 2 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beneranda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de flores, venta de frutas, venta de faldas para cholitas, venta de productos lácteos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beneranda es integrante, ella indica que hace un dos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace diez años, con un pequeño capital que tenía; en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su sobrina.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una freidora, que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto porque esta compra le beneficiará a vender más variedad de platos de comida  en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "2 de octubre" will begin its fourth loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer.  It is found in the city of Cascada and is made up of 8 members and directed by a board of which Beneranda is the President.  The businesses run by group members are varied and include selling food, flowers, fruit, traditional skirts for dolls, as well as milk products.  

The loan will be used to support micro-business like that run by Beneranda.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, based on the invitation of a friend who is also a client.  Currently she has a business selling food.  She comments that she began this business ten years ago on her own initiative with a bit of savings that she had.  Currently she gets help in the business from her niece. 

The loan will be used to purchase a fryer which she will buy from sellers in the city of El Alto. This purchase will help her sell a greater variety of dishes from her stall.  This form of work allows her to support her family economically, since she is single and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training and the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase a fryer.

loans.name: Hermanas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HERMANAS DE VIACHA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yhiedeta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de coca, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de computadoras, venta de dulces. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yhiedeta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace un año, por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra verduras, fideo y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "Hermanas de Viacha" will begin its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer.  The group is from the town of Cascada, and it is made up of 8 members and directed by a board of which Yhiedeta is the President.  The businesses run by members are varied and include selling food, cocoa, clothing, transportation services, computers, and sweets. 

The loan will be used to benefit micro-businesses, including the one Yhiedeta runs.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago because of an invitation from a friend who is also a member.  Currently Yhiedeta has a business selling food.  She notes that she began the business one year ago on her own initiative. 

The loan that she will receive will be used to augment capital (by purchasing vegetables, noodles, and rice in bulk).  She will buy these items from vendors in the city of El Alto and then will use them to make and sell her food.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has one child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she ways that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, noodles, and rice in bulk

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham is a 21-year-old single young man who started working as a plumber with his father five years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who took on his responsibilities at early age due to the low financial situation of his family. Adham is now well known among his region and has a good reputation among his customers. Thus he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own plumbing business and buy the necessary tools. Adham hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to start his own plumbing business and buy the necessary tools

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 55 years old. She is married and has eight children to support. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 40 years and she has been earning an income of KES 24,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs such as chemicals for spraying and fertilizers for better yields. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old. He is married and has two children to support. He has been in this field for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 20,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes, and pangas for work efficiency.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and use the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes, and pangas for work efficiency.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as tea leaves seedlings, suckers for pruning his tea, and fertilizer

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius used the previous loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation. He is a farmer and at the same time earns a salary that boosts his income.

He is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital, which hinders expansion of his business. Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he educates all his children to higher levels of learning.

Julius has asked for another loan to buy Friesian cows for milk production.

loans.use: to buy Friesian cows for milk production.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 48-year-old married man with six children. He used the previous loan to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

He is living in Masindi-Uganda, where e sells cows and also slaughters some for his butcher shop for selling.

He started this business to sustain and provide for his family's needs. He requests a loan to buy more cows for his butcher shop sales.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his butcher shop sales.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a Babban Gona farmer from Bakutaje Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Usman no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve his farming skills.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds. These will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably.

This season Usman has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Usman now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ESTRELLITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olivia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, venta de lentes, venta de jugos, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olivia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de transporte; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace más de quince años y lo aprendió de su esposo.  

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el mantenimiento de su movilidad ya que con el crédito solicitado realizará el cambio  de aceite de su movilidad que lo realizara en las tiendas de lubricantes de la ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente ofrecer sus servicios de transporte en la ciudad de la Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS ESTRELLITAS (The Little Stars)" is on the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Alto Lima. It consists of eight members and is led by a board where Olivia is the President. Businesses that members conduct vary and include selling socks, glasses, juice, food, fruits and shuttle service.

The loan will benefit small businesses where Olivia is part of. She got into Pro Mujer by an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a transportation service business. She started the business more than fifteen years ago and learned the trade from her husband.

The current loan will be used to maintain her vehicle. Olivia requests a loan to get oil change in the city of El Alto in order to provide transport services in the city of Paz. This arrangement allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the range of health and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to change oil for her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a single mother of three girls and one boy. She lives in a sub-location of Soweto where she sells cosmetics. She works hard everyday so that she can afford to pay her children's fees, which is a daunting task.

She is requesting a loan to buy stock. Hope also wants to add household products such as cleaning detergents to her business so that she can increase her revenue. 

She is hopeful that her business will grow and that she will provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic stocks: assorted perfumes and body lotion, as well as "Handy Andy" cleaning detergent

loans.name: Sea''s Group

texts.en:
Sea’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
