Yusif is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwanki Village. Yusif joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.

In the past, Yusif suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusif will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare: double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yusif now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm’s yields

loans.name: Villa Alemania Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ALEMANIA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de papa, chuño y tunta, venta de ropa, venta de polainas, venta de comida, venta de frazadas, venta de pan.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace más de un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa, chuño y tunta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  hace tres años, quien le enseño este negocio fue su mamá, en la actualidad quienes le ayudan en su negocio son sus hijos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de la comunidad de Patacamaya y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es divorciada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Villa Alemania" will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Cascada regional office. It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board where Sonia is the President. The businesses that are carried out by the members of the group are varied, among them are: blanket sales, potato and chuño sales, clothing sales, leggings sales, food sales, strawberry sales, and bread sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Sonia is a member. She mentions that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for more than one year. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling potatoes and chuño. She mentions that she learned this business three years ago, and it was her mother who taught her. Currently it is her children that help her with the business.

The loan that she will take out now will increase her capital to buy potatoes and chuño at wholesale. She will obtain them from the community of Patacamaya and then she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is divorced and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chuño at wholesale.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim is an 18-year-old single young man who opened a mobile phone shop to cover his needs and expenses. He has five years experience in this domain. He used to work and study at the same time, due to the poor financial situation of his family.

Naim is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his inventory with a new collection of mobile phones to satisfy his customers' needs.

Naim hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his inventory with a new collection of mobile phones to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 40 years old and married to Vivian; he supports 2 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last three years and the business earns him KES 15,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase packets of maize seeds and sacks of fertilizers for planting in his farm so as to yield a better harvest for family use, with the surplus being for sale in the market.

He plans to use the profits gained to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable him supply milk to clients in the region and to pay for the education of his children.

His hope is to eradicate poverty in his family and expand his agricultural work.

loans.use: To purchase packets of maize seeds and sacks of fertilizers for planting in his farm so as to yield a better harvest

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Rice is a staple food in the Philippines, thus it is always in demand. It is therefore wise to include it in a “sari-sari” (variety) store's inventory if a vendor has enough capital. Ines of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental is trying her best to use her capital wisely and she combines her variety store business with rice retailing. It’s her way of helping her husband, Alexander, a driver. They are doing their best to meet their everyday needs and support their children’s education. Like many Filipinos, they consider education to be the best inheritance to bestow on their children. 

Ines’ business is not always smooth sailing. Stiff competition squeezes her income. Therefore Ines aims to improve her business further and she seeks a PHP 15,000 loan to buy more sacks of rice and grocery items for her variety store. Your kind generosity will help her a lot in strengthening her business. In due time, she plans to invest in another enterprise when her current business is already stable. 

Ines is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and grocery items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence used the previous loan to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell. She owns a bar and also has a retail shop that adds to her income.

She is faced with challenges such as bottles breaking as a result of customers fighting when they are drunk. However, she is working very hard to build and improve her home plus pay school fees for her children.

Florence needs a loan to stock more beers to sell.

loans.use: to stock more beers to sell.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is 31 years old. He is married and has four children to support. Dismas is a farmer and has been in this line of work for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 17,000 per month.

Dismas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes, and pangas for work efficiency. He plans to use his anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production. Dismas hopes  to become financially stable

loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as suckers for pruning his tea, jembes, and pangas for work efficiency.

loans.name: Renacer 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosemery  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, servicio de punto de llamadas, venta de papa, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosemery es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo hace más de doce años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de una máquina de coser que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la localidad de Viacha, esta compra le beneficiará a renovar su herramienta, ya que la máquina que tiene está muy usada, con esta  adquisición, la señora podrá aumentar su capital para comercializarlo en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "RENACER 2015 (REBIRTH 2015)" will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Cascada. It is comprised of nine members and is led by a board where Rosemery is the President. Businesses that members conduct vary and include selling skirts, neighborhood store, call center, potato sales and furniture sales.

The loan will benefit small businesses where Rosemery is a part of. She got into Pro Mujer by the invitation through a massive promotion of the institution that held in your area. Today she has a business selling skirts. She learned the trade from her husband more than twelve years ago.

The current loan will be used to buy a sewing machine from the sellers in Viacha. This will help renew her tool because the machine she has is worn out. With this purchase, she will be able to raise capital to market it in her shop. This will enable her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the range of health and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, Mauwa has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the high cost of transportation. With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, Mauwa wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as determined. John operates a retail business where he sells jikos, cooking pans, and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good place. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of funds. 

John will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking pans, jikos, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and he plans to use his anticipated profits to do so.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking pans, jikos, and other items

loans.name: Ivetta

texts.en: Ivetta is 43 years old and she lives with her smallest son in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Ivetta’s elder son now is in the Russian Federation and working there. He transfers money for his family's needs while his mother is engaged in farming which is not a rich one. On the farm Ivetta has cows, a calf and a heifer. So her farm products assortment is also very cute; she sells some milk and a little meat. Ivetta hopes very much that Kiva lenders support her with money so she will be able to buy one more calf for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more calf for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain and repair the motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is from Vinogradovo. She is 41 and married with two sons and a daughter. Irina works at a local clothing factory.

Irina is requesting 30,000 Grivnyas to change two windows and a front door in her house, as well as to substitute newer aluminum radiators for old iron ones and buy paint for floors in all three of her rooms. One of Irina's sons is planning to get married soon, which is why Irina wants to make sure her house is all ready for the big event.

loans.use: to change two windows and a front door in her house, as well as to substitute newer aluminum radiators for old iron ones and buy paint for floors in all three of her rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers so as to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, and he has five children. He describes himself to be industrious. 
 
Joseph operates a retail business where he sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

Joseph will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, soap and other items. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is a farmer from Vinogradovo. She has already received financial assistance from Kiva. That funding helped Olga increase her seeding and harvest as a result. Olga is seeking 40,000 UAH from Kiva this time to buy materials needed to renovate her greenhouses and get them ready for fall and winter. Due to a surge in prices for materials and supplies for the greenhouse business, Olga is now forced to seek additional help because her savings are not enough to cover all the related expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to renovate her greenhouses and get them ready for fall and winter

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab is a 49-year-old married mother of five children. Five years ago she started preparing and selling "mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She has a lot of experience in this domain from her parents. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying necessary raw materials to increase her production of tomato sauce, vinegar, jam, etc. to satisfy her customers' requests. Rihab hopes to expand her business more in the future by opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to increase her production of tomato sauce, vinegar, jam, etc.

loans.name: Elya

texts.en:
Elya is 35 years old and lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. Elya has a vocational medical education with a nursing specialty, but she never worked in that sphere. She has sold vegetables and fruits at a rented stall in the city’s wholesale market for 10 years with her husband's help. She sells a fresh and tasty assortment of fruits and vegetables that she buys from the villagers during the week. 

She mentions that her business is the only income for her family and the source for solving the financial needs of her two school-aged children. She is kind and polite with her regular customers so she never loses any of them, simultaneously gaining more customers by the help of her stall’s tasty products and  inexpensive prices.  Elya asks for this loan as she wants to refresh the assortment of her stall’s products and to repair her stall to make it cuter and more attractive for her customers.

loans.use: to refresh the assortment of her stall’s products and to repair her stall to make it cuter and more attractive for her customers

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and also earns additional income from crop growing. He has an intention of growing his business into a wholesale store but his main challenge is inadequate capital which limits his investments.

 He is requesting a loan to buy more bread, soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bread, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. 

David has a retail shop selling general merchandise, but he also sells dried food stuffs to supplement his income. He is very hardworking man who has managed to educate his children using the proceeds. 

David's business is threatened by high license fees and the on-going high rate of inflation. He has a dream of trading in wholesale. 

David requests a loan to buy shop items such as cooking oil, soap, salt and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy shop items such as cooking oil, soap, salt and other items to sell.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en: This nice woman is a pedagogue with 43 years of work experience in this field. Her name is Arusyak and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region with her husband (he is a teacher) and her daughter (she works as a translator). Arusyak now also works and she is a teacher of mathematics at the city school. As her pupils describe their teacher, she is a very kind, patient and calm person who does her best to teach and give a lot of useful information connected with her subject. She also has several pupils to whom she gives paid private courses and prepares them for the entrance exams. Arusyak would like to use this loan to purchase a computer and also professional literature for her courses at home with her pupils.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and also professional literature for her courses at home with her pupils.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is from Vinogradovo. She has already used Kiva assistance to change five windows in her house, as well as an interior door. Nataliya is hoping to use 30,000 UAH to remodel two rooms in her house; to install drywall, to spackle, paint and insulate walls, and to do window jamb extensions. These renovations will help Natalya improve living conditions in her house considerably, giving her a nicer, more comfortable place to live with her family.

loans.use: to remodel two rooms in her house: to install drywall, to spackle, paint and insulate walls, and to do window jamb extensions

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man with six children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. He will use the loan of KES 15,000 to buy more milk for resale. He hopes that in the future he will excel. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a business selling khangas (women's wrap cloth), selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Omega Fire Group

texts.en:
Lucresia is the first lady standing at the far right side of the picture. She is the featured borrower of the Omega Fire group. 

Lucresia got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They trust each other and have became close friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as housekeepers, financially supporting their families back in the Philippines.

Lucresia is a 62-year-old widowed mother of four children, who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for her grandchildren's school tuition fees, which will provide them with a better future.

As for the other group members, Cherylyn is the second from the right, Novy is the second from the left, Luzviminda is the first from the left, while Francis is the lady at the centre of the picture.

They are all working hard to make sure they can develop their families' living (i.e. children, grandchildren, parents and other family members).

loans.use: To pay for her grandchildren's school tuition fees to provide them with a better future

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is from Vinogradovo. She is married with two sons. Mariya works as an administrator of a local recreation center in her home town. Besides her regular job Mariya also owns a land lot of 1,89 hectares where she has two wooden greenhouses. She grows strawberries in one of them and radishes and cucumbers in the other one. Her entire family is actively involved in this business.

Mariya is seeking financial assistance of 10,000 Grivnyas to remodel her bathroom: to clad walls and floor with nice quality tiles. Additional funding will help Mariya to improve her living conditions making her bathroom comfortable and clean for her family to use.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom: to clad walls and floor with nice quality tiles

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 48-year-old single lady. Fifteen years ago, she started selling scarfs to cover her needs and expenses as she is responsible of one member of her family.

Najah is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable colorful scarfs to attract more customers and satisfy their requests.

Najah hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with more fashionable colorful scarfs
